40template<bool LWA=false, bool RWA=false>
41bm::id_t bit_block_calc_count_range(const bm::word_t* block,
42 bm::word_t left,
43 bm::word_t right) BMNOEXCEPT;
44
45inline
46bm::id_t bit_block_any_range(const bm::word_t* block,
47 bm::word_t left,
48 bm::word_t right) BMNOEXCEPT;
49
50/*!
51 @brief Structure with statistical information about memory
52 allocation footprint, serialization projection, number of vectors
53 @ingroup bvector
54*/
55struct bv_statistics
56{
57 size_t bit_blocks; ///< Number of bit blocks
58 size_t gap_blocks; ///< Number of GAP blocks
59 size_t ptr_sub_blocks; ///< Number of sub-blocks
60 size_t bv_count; ///< Number of bit-vectors
61 size_t max_serialize_mem; ///< estimated maximum memory for serialization
62 size_t memory_used; ///< memory usage for all blocks and service tables
63 size_t gap_cap_overhead; ///< gap memory overhead between length and capacity
64 gap_word_t gap_levels[bm::gap_levels]; ///< GAP block lengths in the bvect
65 unsigned long long gaps_by_level[bm::gap_levels]; ///< number of GAP blocks at each level
66
67 /// cound bit block
68 void add_bit_block() BMNOEXCEPT
69 {
70 ++bit_blocks;
71 size_t mem_used = sizeof(bm::word_t) * bm::set_block_size;
72 memory_used += mem_used;
73 max_serialize_mem += mem_used;
74 }
75
76 /// count gap block
77 void add_gap_block(unsigned capacity, unsigned length, unsigned level) BMNOEXCEPT
78 {
79 BM_ASSERT(level < bm::gap_levels);
80
81 ++gap_blocks;
82 size_t mem_used = (capacity * sizeof(gap_word_t));
83 memory_used += mem_used;
84 max_serialize_mem += (unsigned)(length * sizeof(gap_word_t));
85 BM_ASSERT(length <= capacity);
86 gap_cap_overhead += (capacity - length) * sizeof(gap_word_t);
87 if (level < bm::gap_levels)
88 gaps_by_level[level]++;
89 }
90
91 /// Reset statisctics
92 void reset() BMNOEXCEPT
93 {
94 bit_blocks = gap_blocks = ptr_sub_blocks = bv_count = 0;
95 max_serialize_mem = memory_used = gap_cap_overhead = 0;
96 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bm::gap_levels; ++i)
97 gaps_by_level[i] = 0;
98 }
99
100 /// Sum data from another sttructure
101 void add(const bv_statistics& st) BMNOEXCEPT
102 {
103 bit_blocks += st.bit_blocks;
104 gap_blocks += st.gap_blocks;
105 ptr_sub_blocks += st.ptr_sub_blocks;
106 bv_count += st.bv_count;
107 max_serialize_mem += st.max_serialize_mem + 8;
108 memory_used += st.memory_used;
109 gap_cap_overhead += st.gap_cap_overhead;
110 }
111};
112
113/*!
114 @brief Structure with statistical information about memory
115 allocation for arena based vectors
116 @ingroup bvector
117*/
118struct bv_arena_statistics
119{
120 size_t bit_blocks_sz; ///< Total size of bit blocks
121 size_t gap_blocks_sz; ///< Total size of gap blocks
122 size_t ptr_sub_blocks_sz; ///< Total size of sub-blocks ptrs
123 unsigned top_block_size; ///< size of top descriptor
124
125 /// Reset statisctics
126 void reset() BMNOEXCEPT
127 {
128 bit_blocks_sz = gap_blocks_sz = ptr_sub_blocks_sz = top_block_size = 0;
129 }
130};
131
132/**
133 @brief Pair type
134*/
135template<typename First, typename Second>
136struct pair
137{
138 First first;
139 Second second;
140
141 pair(First f, Second s) : first(f), second(s) {}
142};
143
144/**
145 \brief bit-decode cache structure
146*/
147struct bit_decode_cache
148{
149 unsigned short bits[65]; //< decoded bits
150 unsigned bcnt; //< length of bits array
151 bm::id64_t cvalue; //< cache decoded value
152
153 bit_decode_cache() : bcnt(0), cvalue(0) {}
154};
155
156
157/**
158 \brief Recalc linear bvector block index into 2D matrix coordinates
159 \internal
160*/
161template<typename BI_TYPE>
162BMFORCEINLINE
163void get_block_coord(BI_TYPE nb, unsigned& i, unsigned& j) BMNOEXCEPT
164{
165 i = unsigned(nb >> bm::set_array_shift); // top block address
166 j = unsigned(nb & bm::set_array_mask); // address in sub-block
167}
168
169/**
170 Compute bit address of the first bit in a superblock
171 \internal
172*/
173template<typename RTYPE>
174BMFORCEINLINE RTYPE get_super_block_start(unsigned i) BMNOEXCEPT
175{
176 return RTYPE(i) * bm::set_sub_total_bits;
177}
178
179/**
180 Compute bit address of the first bit in a block
181 \internal
182*/
183template<typename RTYPE>
184BMFORCEINLINE RTYPE get_block_start(unsigned i, unsigned j) BMNOEXCEPT
185{
186 RTYPE idx = bm::get_super_block_start<RTYPE>(i);
187 idx += (j) * bm::gap_max_bits;
188 return idx;
189}
190
191
192/*!
193 @defgroup gapfunc GAP functions
194 GAP functions implement different opereations on GAP compressed blocks (internals)
195 and serve as a minimal building blocks.
196 \internal
197 @ingroup bvector
198 */
199
200/*!
201 @defgroup bitfunc BIT functions
202 Bit functions implement different opereations on bit blocks (internals)
203 and serve as a minimal building blocks.
204 \internal
205 @ingroup bvector
206 */
207
208
209/**
210 32-bit paralle, bitcount
211 \internal
212 @ingroup bitfunc
213 */
214inline
215int parallel_popcnt_32(unsigned int n) BMNOEXCEPT
216{
217 unsigned int tmp;
218
219 tmp = n - ((n >> 1) & 033333333333)
220 - ((n >> 2) & 011111111111);
221 return ((tmp + (tmp >> 3)) & 030707070707) % 63;
222}
223
224
225
226/*!
227 Parallel popcount on 4x 64-bit words
228 @ingroup bitfunc
229*/
230inline
231unsigned bitcount64_4way(bm::id64_t x, bm::id64_t y,
232 bm::id64_t u, bm::id64_t v) BMNOEXCEPT
233{
234 const bm::id64_t m1 = 0x5555555555555555U;
235 const bm::id64_t m2 = 0x3333333333333333U;
236 const bm::id64_t m3 = 0x0F0F0F0F0F0F0F0FU;
237 const bm::id64_t m4 = 0x000000FF000000FFU;
238
239 x = x - ((x >> 1) & m1);
240 y = y - ((y >> 1) & m1);
241 u = u - ((u >> 1) & m1);
242 v = v - ((v >> 1) & m1);
243 x = (x & m2) + ((x >> 2) & m2);
244 y = (y & m2) + ((y >> 2) & m2);
245 u = (u & m2) + ((u >> 2) & m2);
246 v = (v & m2) + ((v >> 2) & m2);
247 x = x + y;
248 u = u + v;
249 x = (x & m3) + ((x >> 4) & m3);
250 u = (u & m3) + ((u >> 4) & m3);
251 x = x + u;
252 x = x + (x >> 8);
253 x = x + (x >> 16);
254 x = x & m4;
255 x = x + (x >> 32);
256 return x & 0x000001FFU;
257}
258
259
260// --------------------------------------------------------------
261// Functions for bit-scanning
262// --------------------------------------------------------------
263
264/*!
265 \brief Templated algorithm to unpacks octet based word into list of ON bit indexes
266 \param w - value
267 \param func - bit functor
268
269 @ingroup bitfunc
270*/
271template<typename T, typename F>
272void bit_for_each_4(T w, F& func)
273{
274 for (unsigned sub_octet = 0; w != 0; w >>= 4, sub_octet += 4)
275 {
276 switch (w & 15) // 1111
277 {
278 case 0: // 0000
279 break;
280 case 1: // 0001
281 func(sub_octet);
282 break;
283 case 2: // 0010
284 func(sub_octet + 1);
285 break;
286 case 3: // 0011
287 func(sub_octet, sub_octet + 1);
288 break;
289 case 4: // 0100
290 func(sub_octet + 2);
291 break;
292 case 5: // 0101
293 func(sub_octet, sub_octet + 2);
294 break;
295 case 6: // 0110
296 func(sub_octet + 1, sub_octet + 2);
297 break;
298 case 7: // 0111
299 func(sub_octet, sub_octet + 1, sub_octet + 2);
300 break;
301 case 8: // 1000
302 func(sub_octet + 3);
303 break;
304 case 9: // 1001
305 func(sub_octet, sub_octet + 3);
306 break;
307 case 10: // 1010
308 func(sub_octet + 1, sub_octet + 3);
309 break;
310 case 11: // 1011
311 func(sub_octet, sub_octet + 1, sub_octet + 3);
312 break;
313 case 12: // 1100
314 func(sub_octet + 2, sub_octet + 3);
315 break;
316 case 13: // 1101
317 func(sub_octet, sub_octet + 2, sub_octet + 3);
318 break;
319 case 14: // 1110
320 func(sub_octet + 1, sub_octet + 2, sub_octet + 3);
321 break;
322 case 15: // 1111
323 func(sub_octet, sub_octet + 1, sub_octet + 2, sub_octet + 3);
324 break;
325 default:
326 BM_ASSERT(0);
327 break;
328 }
329
330 } // for
331}
332
333
334/*!
335 \brief Templated algorithm to unpacks word into list of ON bit indexes
336 \param w - value
337 \param func - bit functor
338
339 @ingroup bitfunc
340*/
341template<typename T, typename F>
342void bit_for_each(T w, F& func)
343{
344 // Note: 4-bit table method works slower than plain check approach
345 for (unsigned octet = 0; w != 0; w >>= 8, octet += 8)
346 {
347 if (w & 1) func(octet + 0);
348 if (w & 2) func(octet + 1);
349 if (w & 4) func(octet + 2);
350 if (w & 8) func(octet + 3);
351 if (w & 16) func(octet + 4);
352 if (w & 32) func(octet + 5);
353 if (w & 64) func(octet + 6);
354 if (w & 128) func(octet + 7);
355
356 } // for
357}
358
359/**
360 portable, switch based bitscan
361 @internal
362 @ingroup bitfunc
363 */
364inline
365unsigned bitscan_nibble(unsigned w, unsigned* bits) BMNOEXCEPT
366{
367 unsigned cnt = 0;
368 for (unsigned sub_octet = 0; w; w >>= 4, sub_octet+=4)
369 {
370 switch (w & 15) // 1111
371 {
372 //case 0: // 0000
373 // break;
374 case 1: // 0001
375 bits[cnt++] = 0 + sub_octet;
376 break;
377 case 2: // 0010
378 bits[cnt++] = 1 + sub_octet;
379 break;
380 case 3: // 0011
381 bits[cnt] = 0 + sub_octet;
382 bits[cnt+1] = 1 + sub_octet;
383 cnt += 2;
384 break;
385 case 4: // 0100
386 bits[cnt++] = 2 + sub_octet;
387 break;
388 case 5: // 0101
389 bits[cnt+0] = 0 + sub_octet;
390 bits[cnt+1] = 2 + sub_octet;
391 cnt += 2;
392 break;
393 case 6: // 0110
394 bits[cnt+0] = 1 + sub_octet;
395 bits[cnt+1] = 2 + sub_octet;
396 cnt += 2;
397 break;
398 case 7: // 0111
399 bits[cnt+0] = 0 + sub_octet;
400 bits[cnt+1] = 1 + sub_octet;
401 bits[cnt+2] = 2 + sub_octet;
402 cnt += 3;
403 break;
404 case 8: // 1000
405 bits[cnt++] = 3 + sub_octet;
406 break;
407 case 9: // 1001
408 bits[cnt+0] = 0 + sub_octet;
409 bits[cnt+1] = 3 + sub_octet;
410 cnt += 2;
411 break;
412 case 10: // 1010
413 bits[cnt+0] = 1 + sub_octet;
414 bits[cnt+1] = 3 + sub_octet;
415 cnt += 2;
416 break;
417 case 11: // 1011
418 bits[cnt+0] = 0 + sub_octet;
419 bits[cnt+1] = 1 + sub_octet;
420 bits[cnt+2] = 3 + sub_octet;
421 cnt += 3;
422 break;
423 case 12: // 1100
424 bits[cnt+0] = 2 + sub_octet;
425 bits[cnt+1] = 3 + sub_octet;
426 cnt += 2;
427 break;
428 case 13: // 1101
429 bits[cnt+0] = 0 + sub_octet;
430 bits[cnt+1] = 2 + sub_octet;
431 bits[cnt+2] = 3 + sub_octet;
432 cnt += 3;
433 break;
434 case 14: // 1110
435 bits[cnt+0] = 1 + sub_octet;
436 bits[cnt+1] = 2 + sub_octet;
437 bits[cnt+2] = 3 + sub_octet;
438 cnt += 3;
439 break;
440 case 15: // 1111
441 bits[cnt+0] = 0 + sub_octet;
442 bits[cnt+1] = 1 + sub_octet;
443 bits[cnt+2] = 2 + sub_octet;
444 bits[cnt+3] = 3 + sub_octet;
445 cnt += 4;
446 break;
447 default:
448 break;
449 }
450 } // for
451 return cnt;
452}
453
454#ifdef BM_NONSTANDARD_EXTENTIONS
455#ifdef __GNUC__
456/**
457 bitscan based on computed goto (GCC/clang)
458 @internal
459 @ingroup bitfunc
460 */
461inline
462unsigned bitscan_nibble_gcc(unsigned w, unsigned* bits) BMNOEXCEPT
463{
464 static void* d_table[] = { &&l0,
465 &&l1, &&l3_1, &&l3, &&l7_1, &&l5, &&l7_0, &&l7, &&l15_1,
466 &&l9, &&l11_0, &&l11, &&l15_0, &&l13, &&l14, &&l15 };
467 unsigned cnt = 0;
468
469 for (unsigned sub_octet = 0; w; w >>= 4, sub_octet+=4)
470 {
471 goto *d_table[w & 15];
472 l1: // 0001
473 bits[cnt++] = sub_octet;
474 continue;
475 l3: // 0011
476 bits[cnt++] = sub_octet;
477 l3_1:
478 bits[cnt++] = 1 + sub_octet;
479 continue;
480 l5: // 0101
481 bits[cnt++] = sub_octet;
482 goto l7_1;
483 l7: // 0111
484 bits[cnt++] = sub_octet;
485 l7_0:
486 bits[cnt++] = 1 + sub_octet;
487 l7_1:
488 bits[cnt++] = 2 + sub_octet;
489 continue;
490 l9: // 1001
491 bits[cnt++] = sub_octet;
492 goto l15_1;
493 continue;
494 l11: // 1011
495 bits[cnt++] = sub_octet;
496 l11_0:
497 bits[cnt++] = 1 + sub_octet;
498 bits[cnt++] = 3 + sub_octet;
499 continue;
500 l13: // 1101
501 bits[cnt++] = sub_octet;
502 goto l15_0;
503 l14: // 1110
504 bits[cnt++] = 1 + sub_octet;
505 goto l15_0;
506 l15: // 1111
507 bits[cnt++] = 0 + sub_octet;
508 bits[cnt++] = 1 + sub_octet;
509 l15_0:
510 bits[cnt++] = 2 + sub_octet;
511 l15_1:
512 bits[cnt++] = 3 + sub_octet;
513 l0:
514 continue;
515 } // for
516 return cnt;
517}
518
519#endif
520#endif
521
522/*! @brief Adaptor to copy 1 bits to array
523 @internal
524*/
525template<typename B>
526class copy_to_array_functor
527{
528public:
529 copy_to_array_functor(B* bits): bp_(bits)
530 {}
531
532 B* ptr() { return bp_; }
533
534 void operator()(unsigned bit_idx) BMNOEXCEPT { *bp_++ = (B)bit_idx; }
535
536 void operator()(unsigned bit_idx0,
537 unsigned bit_idx1) BMNOEXCEPT
538 {
539 bp_[0] = (B)bit_idx0; bp_[1] = (B)bit_idx1;
540 bp_+=2;
541 }
542
543 void operator()(unsigned bit_idx0,
544 unsigned bit_idx1,
545 unsigned bit_idx2) BMNOEXCEPT
546 {
547 bp_[0] = (B)bit_idx0; bp_[1] = (B)bit_idx1; bp_[2] = (B)bit_idx2;
548 bp_+=3;
549 }
550
551 void operator()(unsigned bit_idx0,
552 unsigned bit_idx1,
553 unsigned bit_idx2,
554 unsigned bit_idx3) BMNOEXCEPT
555 {
556 bp_[0] = (B)bit_idx0; bp_[1] = (B)bit_idx1;
557 bp_[2] = (B)bit_idx2; bp_[3] = (B)bit_idx3;
558 bp_+=4;
559 }
560
561private:
562 copy_to_array_functor(const copy_to_array_functor&);
563 copy_to_array_functor& operator=(const copy_to_array_functor&);
564private:
565 B* bp_;
566};
567
568
569/*!
570 \brief Unpacks word into list of ON bit indexes
571 \param w - value
572 \param bits - pointer on the result array
573 \return number of bits in the list
574
575 @ingroup bitfunc
576*/
577template<typename T,typename B>
578unsigned bit_list(T w, B* bits) BMNOEXCEPT
579{
580 copy_to_array_functor<B> func(bits);
581 bit_for_each(w, func);
582 return (unsigned)(func.ptr() - bits);
583}
584
585
586
587/*!
588 \brief Unpacks word into list of ON bit indexes (quad-bit based)
589 \param w - value
590 \param bits - pointer on the result array
591 \return number of bits in the list
592
593 @ingroup bitfunc
594*/
595template<typename T,typename B>
596unsigned bit_list_4(T w, B* bits) BMNOEXCEPT
597{
598 copy_to_array_functor<B> func(bits);
599 bit_for_each_4(w, func);
600 return (unsigned)(func.ptr() - bits);
601}
602
603/*!
604 \brief Unpacks word into list of ON bit indexes using popcnt method
605 \param w - value
606 \param bits - pointer on the result array
607 \param offs - value to add to bit position (programmed shift)
608 \return number of bits in the list
609
610 @ingroup bitfunc
611 @internal
612*/
613template<typename B>
614unsigned short
615bitscan_popcnt(bm::id_t w, B* bits, unsigned short offs) BMNOEXCEPT
616{
617 unsigned pos = 0;
618 while (w)
619 {
620 bm::id_t t = w & -w;
621 bits[pos++] = (B)(bm::word_bitcount(t - 1) + offs);
622 w &= w - 1;
623 }
624 return (unsigned short)pos;
625}
626
627/*!
628 \brief Unpacks word into list of ON bit indexes using popcnt method
629 \param w - value
630 \param bits - pointer on the result array
631 \return number of bits in the list
632
633 @ingroup bitfunc
634 @internal
635*/
636template<typename B>
637unsigned short bitscan_popcnt(bm::id_t w, B* bits) BMNOEXCEPT
638{
639 unsigned pos = 0;
640 while (w)
641 {
642 bm::id_t t = w & -w;
643 bits[pos++] = (B)(bm::word_bitcount(t - 1));
644 w &= w - 1;
645 }
646 return (unsigned short)pos;
647}
648
649
650/*!
651 \brief Unpacks 64-bit word into list of ON bit indexes using popcnt method
652 \param w - value
653 \param bits - pointer on the result array
654 \return number of bits in the list
655 @ingroup bitfunc
656*/
657template<typename B>
658unsigned short bitscan_popcnt64(bm::id64_t w, B* bits) BMNOEXCEPT
659{
660 unsigned short pos = 0;
661 while (w)
662 {
663 bm::id64_t t = bmi_blsi_u64(w); // w & -w;
664 bits[pos++] = (B) bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
665 w = bmi_bslr_u64(w); // w &= w - 1;
666 }
667 return pos;
668}
669
670/*!
671 \brief Unpacks word into list of ON bits (BSF/__builtin_ctz)
672 \param w - value
673 \param bits - pointer on the result array
674 \return number of bits in the list
675
676 @ingroup bitfunc
677 @internal
678*/
679template<typename B>
680unsigned short bitscan_bsf(unsigned w, B* bits) BMNOEXCEPT
681{
682 unsigned short pos = 0;
683 while (w)
684 {
685 bits[pos++] = count_trailing_zeros_u32(w);
686 w &= w - 1;
687 }
688 return pos;
689}
690
691template<typename B, typename OT>
692unsigned short bitscan_bsf(unsigned w, B* bits, OT offs) BMNOEXCEPT
693{
694 unsigned short pos = 0;
695 while (w)
696 {
697 bits[pos++] = (B) (bm::count_trailing_zeros_u32(w) + offs);
698 w &= w - 1;
699 }
700 return pos;
701}
702
703/*!
704 \brief Unpacks word into list of ON bits (BSF/__builtin_ctz)
705 \param w - value
706 \param bits - pointer on the result array
707 \return number of bits in the list
708
709 @ingroup bitfunc
710 @internal
711*/
712template<typename B>
713unsigned short bitscan_bsf64(bm::id64_t w, B* bits) BMNOEXCEPT
714{
715 unsigned short pos = 0;
716 while (w)
717 {
718 bits[pos++] = bm::count_trailing_zeros_u64(w);
719 w &= w - 1;
720 }
721 return pos;
722}
723
724
725/*!
726 \brief Unpacks 64-bit word into list of ON bit indexes using popcnt method
727 \param w - value
728 \param bits - pointer on the result array
729 \param offs - value to add to bit position (programmed shift)
730 \return number of bits in the list
731 @ingroup bitfunc
732*/
733template<typename B>
734unsigned short
735bitscan_popcnt64(bm::id64_t w, B* bits, unsigned short offs) BMNOEXCEPT
736{
737 unsigned short pos = 0;
738 while (w)
739 {
740 bm::id64_t t = bmi_blsi_u64(w); // w & -w;
741 bits[pos++] = B(bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1) + offs);
742 w = bmi_bslr_u64(w); // w &= w - 1;
743 }
744 return pos;
745}
746
747/**
748 Templated Bitscan with dynamic dispatch for best type
749 @ingroup bitfunc
750 */
751template<typename V, typename B>
752unsigned short bitscan(V w, B* bits) BMNOEXCEPT
753{
754 static_assert(std::is_unsigned<V>::value, "BM: unsigned type is required");
755#if (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__))
756 if constexpr (sizeof(V) == 8)
757 return bm::bitscan_bsf64(w, bits);
758 else
759 return bm::bitscan_bsf((bm::word_t)w, bits);
760#else
761 if constexpr (sizeof(V) == 8)
762 return bm::bitscan_popcnt64(w, bits);
763 else
764 return bm::bitscan_popcnt((bm::word_t)w, bits);
765#endif
766}
767
768// --------------------------------------------------------------
769// Functions for select
770// --------------------------------------------------------------
771
772/**
773 \brief word find index of the rank-th bit set by bit-testing
774 \param w - 64-bit work to search
775 \param rank - rank to select (should be > 0)
776
777 \return selected value (inxed of bit set)
778 @ingroup bitfunc
779 @internal
780*/
781inline
782unsigned word_select64_linear(bm::id64_t w, unsigned rank) BMNOEXCEPT
783{
784 BM_ASSERT(w);
785 BM_ASSERT(rank);
786
787 for (unsigned count = 0; w; w >>=1ull, ++count)
788 {
789 rank -= unsigned(w & 1ull);
790 if (!rank)
791 return count;
792 }
793 BM_ASSERT(0); // shoud not be here if rank is achievable
794 return ~0u;
795}
796
797/**
798 \brief word find index of the rank-th bit set by bit-testing
799 \param w - 64-bit work to search
800 \param rank - rank to select (should be > 0)
801
802 \return selected value (inxed of bit set)
803 @ingroup bitfunc
804 @internal
805
806*/
807inline
808unsigned word_select64_bitscan_popcnt(bm::id64_t w, unsigned rank) BMNOEXCEPT
809{
810 BM_ASSERT(w);
811 BM_ASSERT(rank);
812 BM_ASSERT(rank <= bm::word_bitcount64(w));
813
814 do
815 {
816 --rank;
817 if (!rank)
818 break;
819 w &= w - 1;
820 } while (1);
821 bm::id64_t t = w & -w;
822 unsigned count = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
823 return count;
824}
825
826/**
827 \brief word find index of the rank-th bit set by bit-testing
828 \param w - 64-bit work to search
829 \param rank - rank to select (should be > 0)
830
831 \return selected value (inxed of bit set)
832 @ingroup bitfunc
833 @internal
834
835*/
836inline
837unsigned word_select64_bitscan_tz(bm::id64_t w, unsigned rank) BMNOEXCEPT
838{
839 BM_ASSERT(w);
840 BM_ASSERT(rank);
841 BM_ASSERT(rank <= bm::word_bitcount64(w));
842
843 do
844 {
845 if (!(--rank))
846 break;
847 w &= w - 1;
848 } while (1);
849 bm::id64_t t = w & -w;
850 unsigned count = bm::count_trailing_zeros_u64(t);
851 return count;
852}
853
854
855
856/**
857 \brief word find index of the rank-th bit set by bit-testing
858 \param w - 32-bit work to search
859 \param rank - rank to select (should be > 0)
860
861 \return selected value (inxed of bit set)
862 @ingroup bitfunc
863 @internal
864*/
865inline
866unsigned word_select32_bitscan_popcnt(unsigned w, unsigned rank) BMNOEXCEPT
867{
868 BM_ASSERT(w);
869 BM_ASSERT(rank);
870 BM_ASSERT(rank <= bm::word_bitcount(w));
871
872 do
873 {
874 --rank;
875 if (!rank)
876 break;
877 w &= w - 1;
878 } while (1);
879 unsigned t = w & -w;
880 unsigned count = bm::word_bitcount(t - 1);
881 return count;
882}
883
884/**
885 \brief word find index of the rank-th bit set by bit-testing
886 \param w - 32-bit work to search
887 \param rank - rank to select (should be > 0)
888
889 \return selected value (inxed of bit set)
890 @ingroup bitfunc
891 @internal
892
893*/
894inline
895unsigned word_select32_bitscan_tz(unsigned w, unsigned rank) BMNOEXCEPT
896{
897 BM_ASSERT(w);
898 BM_ASSERT(rank);
899 BM_ASSERT(rank <= bm::word_bitcount(w));
900
901 do
902 {
903 if (!(--rank))
904 break;
905 w &= w - 1;
906 } while (1);
907 return bm::count_trailing_zeros_u32(w & -w);
908}
909
910
911/**
912 \brief word find index of the rank-th bit set by bit-testing
913 \param w - 64-bit work to search
914 \param rank - rank to select (should be > 0)
915
916 \return selected value (inxed of bit set)
917 @ingroup bitfunc
918 @internal
919*/
920inline
921unsigned word_select64(bm::id64_t w, unsigned rank) BMNOEXCEPT
922{
923#if defined(BMI2_SELECT64)
924 return BMI2_SELECT64(w, rank);
925#else
926 #if defined(BMI1_SELECT64)
927 return BMI2_SELECT64(w, rank);
928 #else
929 #if (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__))
930 return bm::word_select64_bitscan_tz(w, rank);
931 #else
932 return bm::word_select64_bitscan_popcnt(w, rank);
933 #endif
934 #endif
935#endif
936}
937
938/**
939 \brief word find index of the rank-th bit set by bit-testing
940 \param w - 32-bit work to search
941 \param rank - rank to select (should be > 0)
942
943 \return selected value (inxed of bit set)
944 @ingroup bitfunc
945 @internal
946*/
947inline
948unsigned word_select32(unsigned w, unsigned rank) BMNOEXCEPT
949{
950#if defined(BMI2_SELECT64)
951 return BMI2_SELECT64(w, rank);
952#else
953 #if defined(BMI1_SELECT64)
954 return BMI2_SELECT64(w, rank);
955 #else
956 #if (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__))
957 return bm::word_select32_bitscan_tz(w, rank);
958 #else
959 return bm::word_select32_bitscan_popcnt(w, rank);
960 #endif
961 #endif
962#endif
963}
964
965
966
967// --------------------------------------------------------------
968// Functions for bit-block digest calculation
969// --------------------------------------------------------------
970
971/*!
972 \brief Compute digest mask for word address in block
973
974 @return digest bit-mask
975
976 @ingroup bitfunc
977 @internal
978*/
979BMFORCEINLINE
980bm::id64_t widx_to_digest_mask(unsigned w_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
981{
982 bm::id64_t mask(1ull);
983 return mask << (w_idx / bm::set_block_digest_wave_size);
984}
985
986/** digest mask control generation (for debug and test only)
987 @internal
988 */
989inline
990bm::id64_t dm_control(unsigned from, unsigned to) BMNOEXCEPT
991{
992 bm::id64_t m = 0;
993 for (unsigned i = from; i <= to; ++i)
994 m |= (1ull << (i / 1024));
995 return m;
996}
997
998
999/**
1000 \brief Compute digest mask for [from..to] positions
1001 \param from - range from (in bit-block coordinates)
1002 \param to - range to (in bit-block coordinates)
1003
1004 @ingroup bitfunc
1005 @internal
1006*/
1007BMFORCEINLINE
1008bm::id64_t digest_mask(unsigned from, unsigned to) BMNOEXCEPT
1009{
1010 BM_ASSERT(from <= to);
1011 BM_ASSERT(to < bm::gap_max_bits);
1012
1013 bm::id64_t digest_from = from >> bm::set_block_digest_pos_shift;
1014 bm::id64_t digest_to = to >> bm::set_block_digest_pos_shift;;
1015 bm::id64_t mask(~0ull);
1016 mask = (mask >> (63 - (digest_to - digest_from))) << digest_from;
1017
1018 //BM_ASSERT(mask == bm::dm_control(from, to));
1019
1020 return mask;
1021}
1022
1023
1024/*!
1025 \brief check if all digest bits for the range [from..to] are 0
1026
1027 \param digest - current digest
1028 \param bitpos_from - range from (in bit-block coordinates)
1029 \param bitpos_to - range to (in bit-block coordinates)
1030
1031 @return true if all range is zero
1032
1033 @ingroup bitfunc
1034 @internal
1035*/
1036inline
1037bool check_zero_digest(bm::id64_t digest,
1038 unsigned bitpos_from, unsigned bitpos_to) BMNOEXCEPT
1039{
1040 bm::id64_t mask = bm::digest_mask(bitpos_from, bitpos_to);
1041 return !(digest & mask);
1042}
1043
1044/*!
1045 \brief Init block with 000111000 pattren based on digest
1046 \param block - Bit block [out]
1047 \param digest - digest (used for block initialization)
1048
1049 @ingroup bitfunc
1050 @internal
1051*/
1052inline
1053void block_init_digest0(bm::word_t* const block, bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
1054{
1055 unsigned off;
1056 for (unsigned i = 0; i < 64; ++i)
1057 {
1058 off = i * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1059 bm::word_t mask = (digest & 1) ? ~0u : 0u;
1060#if defined(VECT_BLOCK_SET_DIGEST)
1061 VECT_BLOCK_SET_DIGEST(&block[off], mask);
1062#else
1063 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size; j+=4)
1064 {
1065 block[off+j+0] = block[off+j+1] =
1066 block[off+j+2] = block[off+j+3] = mask;
1067 } // for j
1068#endif
1069 digest >>= 1ull;
1070 } // for
1071}
1072
1073/*!
1074 \brief Compute digest for 64 non-zero areas
1075 \param block - Bit block
1076
1077 @return digest bit-mask (0 means all block is empty)
1078
1079 @ingroup bitfunc
1080 @internal
1081*/
1082inline
1083bm::id64_t calc_block_digest0(const bm::word_t* const block) BMNOEXCEPT
1084{
1085 bm::id64_t digest0 = 0;
1086 unsigned off;
1087
1088 for (unsigned i = 0; i < 64; ++i)
1089 {
1090 off = i * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1091 #if defined(VECT_IS_DIGEST_ZERO)
1092 bool all_zero = VECT_IS_DIGEST_ZERO(&block[off]);
1093 digest0 |= bm::id64_t(!all_zero) << i;
1094 #else
1095 const bm::id64_t mask(1ull);
1096 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size; j+=4)
1097 {
1098 bm::word_t w = block[off+j+0] | block[off+j+1] |
1099 block[off+j+2] | block[off+j+3];
1100 if (w)
1101 {
1102 digest0 |= (mask << i);
1103 break;
1104 }
1105 } // for j
1106 #endif
1107
1108 } // for i
1109 return digest0;
1110}
1111
1112/*!
1113 \brief Compute digest for 64 non-zero areas based on existing digest
1114 (function revalidates zero areas)
1115 \param block - bit block
1116 \param digest - start digest
1117
1118 @return digest bit-mask (0 means all block is empty)
1119
1120 @ingroup bitfunc
1121 @internal
1122*/
1123inline
1124bm::id64_t
1125update_block_digest0(const bm::word_t* const block, bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
1126{
1127 const bm::id64_t mask(1ull);
1128 bm::id64_t d = digest;
1129
1130 while (d)
1131 {
1132 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(d); // d & -d;
1133
1134 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
1135 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1136
1137 #if defined(VECT_IS_DIGEST_ZERO)
1138 bool all_zero = VECT_IS_DIGEST_ZERO(&block[off]);
1139 digest &= all_zero ? ~(mask << wave) : digest;
1140 #else
1141 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u =
1142 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&block[off]);
1143 bm::id64_t w64 = 0;
1144 unsigned j = 0;
1145 do
1146 {
1147 w64 |=
1148 src_u->w64[j+0] | src_u->w64[j+1] | src_u->w64[j+2] | src_u->w64[j+3];
1149 j += 4;
1150 } while ((j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size/2) & !w64);
1151 digest &= w64 ? digest : ~(mask << wave);
1152 #endif
1153
1154 d = bm::bmi_bslr_u64(d); // d &= d - 1;
1155 } // while
1156
1157 BM_ASSERT(bm::calc_block_digest0(block) == digest);
1158 return digest;
1159}
1160
1161// --------------------------------------------------------------
1162
1163/**
1164 Compact sub-blocks by digest (rank compaction)
1165 \param t_block - target block
1166 \param block - src bit block
1167 \param digest - digest to use for copy
1168 \param zero_tail - flag to zero the tail memory
1169
1170 @ingroup bitfunc
1171 @internal
1172 */
1173inline
1174void block_compact_by_digest(bm::word_t* t_block,
1175 const bm::word_t* block,
1176 bm::id64_t digest,
1177 bool zero_tail) BMNOEXCEPT
1178{
1179 unsigned t_wave = 0;
1180 bm::id64_t d = digest;
1181
1182 while (d)
1183 {
1184 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(d); // d & -d;
1185 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
1186 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1187 unsigned t_off = t_wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1188
1189 const bm::word_t* sub_block = block + off;
1190 bm::word_t* t_sub_block = t_block + t_off;
1191 const bm::word_t* sub_block_end =
1192 sub_block + bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1193 // TODO 64-bit optimization or SIMD
1194 for (; sub_block < sub_block_end; t_sub_block+=4, sub_block+=4)
1195 {
1196 t_sub_block[0] = sub_block[0];
1197 t_sub_block[1] = sub_block[1];
1198 t_sub_block[2] = sub_block[2];
1199 t_sub_block[3] = sub_block[3];
1200 } // for
1201
1202 d = bm::bmi_bslr_u64(d); // d &= d - 1;
1203 ++t_wave;
1204 } // while
1205
1206 // init rest as zeroes (maybe need to be parametric)
1207 //
1208 if (zero_tail)
1209 {
1210 for ( ;t_wave < bm::block_waves; ++t_wave)
1211 {
1212 unsigned t_off = t_wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1213 bm::word_t* t_sub_block = t_block + t_off;
1214 const bm::word_t* t_sub_block_end =
1215 t_sub_block + bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1216 for (; t_sub_block < t_sub_block_end; t_sub_block+=4)
1217 {
1218 t_sub_block[0] = 0;
1219 t_sub_block[1] = 0;
1220 t_sub_block[2] = 0;
1221 t_sub_block[3] = 0;
1222 } // for
1223 } // for
1224 }
1225}
1226
1227// --------------------------------------------------------------
1228
1229/**
1230 expand sub-blocks by digest (rank expansion)
1231 \param t_block - target block
1232 \param block - src bit block
1233 \param digest - digest to use for copy
1234 \param zero_subs - flag to zero the non-digest sub waves
1235
1236 @ingroup bitfunc
1237 @internal
1238 */
1239
1240inline
1241void block_expand_by_digest(bm::word_t* t_block,
1242 const bm::word_t* block,
1243 bm::id64_t digest,
1244 bool zero_subs) BMNOEXCEPT
1245{
1246 unsigned s_wave = 0;
1247 bm::id64_t d = digest;
1248
1249 bm::id64_t mask1 = 1ULL;
1250 for (unsigned wave = 0; wave < bm::block_waves; ++wave)
1251 {
1252 unsigned s_off = s_wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1253 const bm::word_t* sub_block = block + s_off;
1254 const bm::word_t* sub_block_end =
1255 sub_block + bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1256 bm::word_t* t_sub_block =
1257 t_block + (wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size);
1258 if (d & mask1)
1259 {
1260 for (; sub_block < sub_block_end; t_sub_block+=4, sub_block+=4)
1261 {
1262 t_sub_block[0] = sub_block[0];
1263 t_sub_block[1] = sub_block[1];
1264 t_sub_block[2] = sub_block[2];
1265 t_sub_block[3] = sub_block[3];
1266 } // for
1267
1268 ++s_wave;
1269 }
1270 else
1271 {
1272 if (zero_subs)
1273 {
1274 const bm::word_t* t_sub_block_end =
1275 t_sub_block + bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
1276 for (; t_sub_block < t_sub_block_end; t_sub_block+=4)
1277 {
1278 t_sub_block[0] = 0; t_sub_block[1] = 0;
1279 t_sub_block[2] = 0; t_sub_block[3] = 0;
1280 } // for
1281 }
1282 }
1283 mask1 <<= 1;
1284 } // for i
1285}
1286
1287
1288// --------------------------------------------------------------
1289
1290
1291/// Returns true if set operation is constant (bitcount)
1292inline
1293bool is_const_set_operation(set_operation op) BMNOEXCEPT
1294{
1295 return (int(op) >= int(set_COUNT));
1296}
1297
1298/**
1299 Convert set operation to operation
1300*/
1301inline
1302bm::operation setop2op(bm::set_operation op) BMNOEXCEPT
1303{
1304 BM_ASSERT(op == set_AND ||
1305 op == set_OR ||
1306 op == set_SUB ||
1307 op == set_XOR);
1308 return (bm::operation) op;
1309}
1310
1311//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1312
1313/**
1314 Structure carries pointer on bit block with all bits 1
1315 @ingroup bitfunc
1316 @internal
1317*/
1318template<bool T> struct all_set
1319{
1320 struct BM_VECT_ALIGN all_set_block
1321 {
1322 bm::word_t BM_VECT_ALIGN* _s[bm::set_sub_array_size] BM_VECT_ALIGN_ATTR;
1323 bm::word_t BM_VECT_ALIGN _p[bm::set_block_size] BM_VECT_ALIGN_ATTR;
1324 bm::word_t* _p_fullp;
1325
1326 all_set_block() BMNOEXCEPT
1327 {
1328 ::memset(_p, 0xFF, sizeof(_p)); // set FULL BLOCK content (all 1s)
1329 if constexpr (sizeof(void*) == 8)
1330 {
1331 const unsigned long long magic_mask = 0xFFFFfffeFFFFfffe;
1332 ::memcpy(&_p_fullp, &magic_mask, sizeof(magic_mask));
1333 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++i)
1334 _s[i] = reinterpret_cast<bm::word_t*>(magic_mask);
1335 }
1336 else
1337 {
1338 const unsigned magic_mask = 0xFFFFfffe;
1339 ::memcpy(&_p_fullp, &magic_mask, sizeof(magic_mask));
1340 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++i)
1341 _s[i] = reinterpret_cast<bm::word_t*>(magic_mask);
1342 }
1343 }
1344 };
1345
1346 // version with minimal branching, super-scalar friendly
1347 //
1348 inline
1349 static bm::id64_t block_type(const bm::word_t* bp) BMNOEXCEPT
1350 {
1351 bm::id64_t type;
1352 if constexpr (sizeof(void*) == 8)
1353 {
1354 bm::id64_t w = reinterpret_cast<unsigned long long>(bp);
1355 type = (w & 3) | // FULL BLOCK or GAP
1356 ((bp == _block._p) << 1);
1357 type = type ? type : w;
1358 }
1359 else
1360 {
1361 unsigned w = reinterpret_cast<unsigned long>(bp);
1362 type = (w & 3) | // FULL BLOCK or GAP
1363 ((bp == _block._p) << 1);
1364 type = type ? type : w;
1365 }
1366 return type;
1367 }
1368
1369 BMFORCEINLINE
1370 static bool is_full_block(const bm::word_t* bp) BMNOEXCEPT
1371 { return (bp == _block._p || bp == _block._p_fullp); }
1372
1373 BMFORCEINLINE
1374 static bool is_valid_block_addr(const bm::word_t* bp) BMNOEXCEPT
1375 { return (bp && !(bp == _block._p || bp == _block._p_fullp)); }
1376
1377 static all_set_block _block;
1378};
1379
1380
1381template<bool T> typename all_set<T>::all_set_block all_set<T>::_block;
1382
1383
1384/*!
1385 Fini not NULL position
1386 @return index of not NULL pointer
1387 @internal
1388*/
1389template<typename N>
1390bool find_not_null_ptr(const bm::word_t* const * const* arr,
1391 N start, N size, N* pos) BMNOEXCEPT
1392{
1393 BM_ASSERT(pos);
1394// BM_ASSERT(start < size);
1395//#if defined(BM64_AVX2) || defined(BM64_AVX512)
1396// TODO: optimization for SIMD based next ptr scan
1397#if 0
1398 const unsigned unroll_factor = 4;
1399 const unsigned len = (size - start);
1400 const unsigned len_unr = len - (len % unroll_factor);
1401 unsigned k;
1402
1403 arr += start;
1404 for (k = 0; k < len_unr; k+=unroll_factor)
1405 {
1406 if (!avx2_test_all_zero_wave(arr+k))
1407 {
1408 if (arr[k])
1409 {
1410 *pos = k + start;
1411 return true;
1412 }
1413 if (arr[k+1])
1414 {
1415 *pos = k + start + 1;
1416 return true;
1417 }
1418 if (arr[k+2])
1419 {
1420 *pos = k + start + 2;
1421 return true;
1422 }
1423 if (arr[k+3])
1424 {
1425 *pos = k + start + 3;
1426 return true;
1427 }
1428 }
1429 } // for k
1430
1431 for (; k < len; ++k)
1432 {
1433 if (arr[k])
1434 {
1435 *pos = k + start;
1436 return true;
1437 }
1438 } // for k
1439#else
1440 for (; start < size; ++start)
1441 {
1442 if (arr[start])
1443 {
1444 *pos = start;
1445 return true;
1446 }
1447 } // for i
1448#endif
1449 return false;
1450}
1451
1452
1453
1454
1455//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1456
1457/*!
1458 \brief Lexicographical comparison of two words as bit strings (reference)
1459 Auxiliary implementation for testing and reference purposes.
1460 \param w1 - First word.
1461 \param w2 - Second word.
1462 \return <0 - less, =0 - equal, >0 - greater.
1463
1464 @ingroup bitfunc
1465*/
1466template<typename T> int wordcmp0(T w1, T w2) BMNOEXCEPT
1467{
1468 while (w1 != w2)
1469 {
1470 int res = (w1 & 1) - (w2 & 1);
1471 if (res != 0) return res;
1472 w1 >>= 1;
1473 w2 >>= 1;
1474 }
1475 return 0;
1476}
1477
1478
1479/*
1480template<typename T> int wordcmp(T w1, T w2)
1481{
1482 T diff = w1 ^ w2;
1483 return diff ? ((w1 & diff & (diff ^ (diff - 1)))? 1 : -1) : 0;
1484}
1485*/
1486/*!
1487 \brief Lexicographical comparison of two words as bit strings.
1488 Auxiliary implementation for testing and reference purposes.
1489 \param a - First word.
1490 \param b - Second word.
1491 \return <0 - less, =0 - equal, >0 - greater.
1492
1493 @ingroup bitfunc
1494*/
1495template<typename T> int wordcmp(T a, T b) BMNOEXCEPT
1496{
1497 T diff = a ^ b;
1498 return diff? ( (a & diff & -diff)? 1 : -1 ) : 0;
1499}
1500
1501
1502// Low bit extraction
1503// x & (x ^ (x-1))
1504
1505
1506// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1507
1508
1509/*! @brief Returns "true" if all bits in the block are 0
1510 @ingroup bitfunc
1511*/
1512inline
1513bool bit_is_all_zero(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT start) BMNOEXCEPT
1514{
1515#if defined(VECT_IS_ZERO_BLOCK)
1516 return VECT_IS_ZERO_BLOCK(start);
1517#else
1518 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT blk = (bm::wordop_t*) (start);
1519 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT blk_end = (bm::wordop_t*)(start + bm::set_block_size);
1520 do
1521 {
1522 if (blk[0] | blk[1] | blk[2] | blk[3])
1523 return false;
1524 blk += 4;
1525 } while (blk < blk_end);
1526 return true;
1527#endif
1528}
1529
1530// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
1531
1532/*!
1533 \brief Checks if GAP block is all-zero.
1534 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1535 \returns true if all-zero.
1536
1537 @ingroup gapfunc
1538*/
1539BMFORCEINLINE
1540bool gap_is_all_zero(const bm::gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
1541{
1542 // (almost) branchless variant:
1543 return (!(*buf & 1u)) & (!(bm::gap_max_bits - 1 - buf[1]));
1544}
1545
1546/*!
1547 \brief Checks if GAP block is all-one.
1548 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1549 \returns true if all-one.
1550 @ingroup gapfunc
1551*/
1552BMFORCEINLINE
1553bool gap_is_all_one(const bm::gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
1554{
1555 return ((*buf & 1u) && (buf[1] == bm::gap_max_bits - 1));
1556}
1557
1558/*!
1559 \brief Returs GAP block length.
1560 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1561 \returns GAP block length.
1562
1563 @ingroup gapfunc
1564*/
1565BMFORCEINLINE
1566bm::gap_word_t gap_length(const bm::gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
1567{
1568 return (bm::gap_word_t)((*buf >> 3) + 1);
1569}
1570
1571
1572/*!
1573 \brief Returs GAP block capacity
1574 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer
1575 \param glevel_len - pointer on GAP header word
1576 \returns GAP block capacity.
1577
1578 @ingroup gapfunc
1579*/
1580template<typename T>
1581unsigned
1582gap_capacity(const T* BMRESTRICT buf, const T* BMRESTRICT glevel_len) BMNOEXCEPT
1583{
1584 return glevel_len[(*buf >> 1) & 3];
1585}
1586
1587
1588/*!
1589 \brief Returs GAP block capacity limit.
1590 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1591 \param glevel_len - GAP lengths table (gap_len_table)
1592 \returns GAP block limit.
1593
1594 @ingroup gapfunc
1595*/
1596template<typename T>
1597unsigned
1598gap_limit(const T* BMRESTRICT buf, const T* BMRESTRICT glevel_len) BMNOEXCEPT
1599{
1600 return glevel_len[(*buf >> 1) & 3]-4;
1601}
1602
1603
1604/*!
1605 \brief Returs GAP blocks capacity level.
1606 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1607 \returns GAP block capacity level.
1608
1609 @ingroup gapfunc
1610*/
1611template<typename T>
1612T gap_level(const T* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
1613{
1614 return T((*buf >> 1) & 3u);
1615}
1616
1617
1618/*!
1619 \brief GAP block find the last set bit
1620
1621 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1622 \param last - index of the last 1 bit
1623
1624 \return 0 if 1 bit was NOT found
1625
1626 @ingroup gapfunc
1627*/
1628template<typename T>
1629unsigned
1630gap_find_last(const T* BMRESTRICT buf, unsigned* BMRESTRICT last) BMNOEXCEPT
1631{
1632 BM_ASSERT(last);
1633
1634 T is_set = (*buf) & 1u;
1635 T end = T((*buf) >> 3u);
1636
1637 BM_ASSERT(buf[end] == bm::gap_max_bits - 1);
1638
1639 is_set ^= T((end-1) & 1u);
1640 if (is_set)
1641 {
1642 *last = buf[end];
1643 return is_set;
1644 }
1645 *last = buf[--end];
1646 return end;
1647}
1648
1649/*!
1650 \brief GAP block find the first set bit
1651
1652 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1653 \param first - index of the first 1 bit
1654
1655 \return 0 if 1 bit was NOT found
1656
1657 @ingroup gapfunc
1658*/
1659template<typename T>
1660unsigned
1661gap_find_first(const T* BMRESTRICT buf, unsigned* BMRESTRICT first) BMNOEXCEPT
1662{
1663 BM_ASSERT(first);
1664
1665 T is_set = (*buf) & 1u;
1666 if (is_set)
1667 {
1668 *first = 0;
1669 return is_set;
1670 }
1671 if (buf[1] == bm::gap_max_bits - 1)
1672 return 0;
1673 *first = buf[1] + 1;
1674 return 1;
1675}
1676
1677
1678
1679/*
1680 \brief Binary search for the block where bit = pos located.
1681 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1682 \param pos - index of the element.
1683 \param is_set - output. GAP value (0 or 1).
1684 \return GAP index.
1685 @ingroup gapfunc
1686*/
1687template<typename T>
1688unsigned gap_bfind(const T* BMRESTRICT buf,
1689 unsigned pos, unsigned* BMRESTRICT is_set) BMNOEXCEPT
1690{
1691 BM_ASSERT(pos < bm::gap_max_bits);
1692 #undef VECT_GAP_BFIND // TODO: VECTOR bfind causes performance degradation
1693 #ifdef VECT_GAP_BFIND
1694 return VECT_GAP_BFIND(buf, pos, is_set);
1695 #else
1696 *is_set = (*buf) & 1;
1697 unsigned start = 1;
1698 unsigned end = 1 + ((*buf) >> 3);
1699 while (start != end)
1700 {
1701 if ((end - start) < 16) // use direct scan on short span
1702 {
1703 do
1704 {
1705 if (buf[start] >= pos)
1706 goto break2;
1707 } while (++start);
1708 BM_ASSERT(0); // should not get here
1709 break;
1710 }
1711 unsigned curr = (start + end) >> 1;
1712 if ( buf[curr] < pos )
1713 start = curr + 1;
1714 else
1715 end = curr;
1716 } // while
1717 break2:
1718 *is_set ^= ((start-1) & 1);
1719 return start;
1720 #endif
1721}
1722
1723
1724/*!
1725 \brief Tests if bit = pos is true.
1726 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1727 \param pos - index of the element.
1728 \return true if position is in "1" gap
1729 @ingroup gapfunc
1730*/
1731template<typename T>
1732unsigned gap_test(const T* BMRESTRICT buf, unsigned pos) BMNOEXCEPT
1733{
1734 BM_ASSERT(pos < bm::gap_max_bits);
1735
1736 unsigned start = 1;
1737 unsigned end = 1 + ((*buf) >> 3);
1738 if (end - start < 10)
1739 {
1740 unsigned sv = *buf & 1;
1741 unsigned sv1= sv ^ 1;
1742 if (buf[1] >= pos) return sv;
1743 if (buf[2] >= pos) return sv1;
1744 if (buf[3] >= pos) return sv;
1745 if (buf[4] >= pos) return sv1;
1746 if (buf[5] >= pos) return sv;
1747 if (buf[6] >= pos) return sv1;
1748 if (buf[7] >= pos) return sv;
1749 if (buf[8] >= pos) return sv1;
1750 if (buf[9] >= pos) return sv;
1751 BM_ASSERT(0);
1752 }
1753 else
1754 {
1755 while (start != end)
1756 {
1757 unsigned curr = (start + end) >> 1;
1758 if (buf[curr] < pos)
1759 start = curr + 1;
1760 else
1761 end = curr;
1762 }
1763 }
1764 return ((*buf) & 1) ^ ((--start) & 1);
1765}
1766
1767/*!
1768 \brief Tests if bit = pos is true. Analog of bm::gap_test with SIMD unrolling.
1769 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
1770 \param pos - index of the element.
1771 \return true if position is in "1" gap
1772 @ingroup gapfunc
1773*/
1774template<typename T>
1775unsigned gap_test_unr(const T* BMRESTRICT buf, const unsigned pos) BMNOEXCEPT
1776{
1777 BM_ASSERT(pos < bm::gap_max_bits);
1778
1779 if (pos == 0) // quick answer possible
1780 {
1781 return (*buf) & 1;
1782 }
1783#if defined(BMSSE2OPT)
1784 unsigned res = bm::sse2_gap_test(buf, pos);
1785 BM_ASSERT(res == bm::gap_test(buf, pos));
1786#elif defined(BMSSE42OPT)
1787 unsigned res = bm::sse42_gap_test(buf, pos);
1788 BM_ASSERT(res == bm::gap_test(buf, pos));
1789#elif defined(BMAVX2OPT)
1790 unsigned res = bm::avx2_gap_test(buf, pos);
1791 BM_ASSERT(res == bm::gap_test(buf, pos));
1792#else
1793 unsigned res = bm::gap_test(buf, pos);
1794#endif
1795 return res;
1796}
1797
1798/*! For each non-zero block in [from, to] executes supplied functor
1799 \internal
1800*/
1801template<typename T, typename N, typename F>
1802void for_each_nzblock_range(T*** root,
1803 N top_size, N nb_from, N nb_to, F& f) BMNOEXCEPT
1804{
1805 BM_ASSERT(top_size);
1806 if (nb_from > nb_to)
1807 return;
1808 unsigned i_from = unsigned(nb_from >> bm::set_array_shift);
1809 unsigned j_from = unsigned(nb_from & bm::set_array_mask);
1810 unsigned i_to = unsigned(nb_to >> bm::set_array_shift);
1811 unsigned j_to = unsigned(nb_to & bm::set_array_mask);
1812
1813 if (i_from >= top_size)
1814 return;
1815 if (i_to >= top_size)
1816 {
1817 i_to = unsigned(top_size-1);
1818 j_to = bm::set_sub_array_size-1;
1819 }
1820
1821 for (unsigned i = i_from; i <= i_to; ++i)
1822 {
1823 T** blk_blk = root[i];
1824 if (!blk_blk)
1825 continue;
1826 if ((bm::word_t*)blk_blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1827 {
1828 unsigned j = (i == i_from) ? j_from : 0;
1829 if (!j && (i != i_to)) // full sub-block
1830 f.add_full(bm::set_sub_total_bits);
1831 else
1832 {
1833 do
1834 {
1835 f.add_full(bm::gap_max_bits);
1836 if ((i == i_to) && (j == j_to))
1837 return;
1838 } while (++j < bm::set_sub_array_size);
1839 }
1840 }
1841 else
1842 {
1843 unsigned j = (i == i_from) ? j_from : 0;
1844 do
1845 {
1846 if (blk_blk[j])
1847 f(blk_blk[j]);
1848 if ((i == i_to) && (j == j_to))
1849 return;
1850 } while (++j < bm::set_sub_array_size);
1851 }
1852 } // for i
1853}
1854
1855/*! For each non-zero block executes supplied function.
1856 \internal
1857*/
1858template<class T, class F>
1859void for_each_nzblock(T*** root, unsigned size1, F& f)
1860{
1861 typedef typename F::size_type size_type;
1862 for (unsigned i = 0; i < size1; ++i)
1863 {
1864 T** blk_blk = root[i];
1865 if (!blk_blk)
1866 {
1867 f.on_empty_top(i);
1868 continue;
1869 }
1870 f.on_non_empty_top(i);
1871 if ((bm::word_t*)blk_blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1872 {
1873 size_type r = i * bm::set_sub_array_size;
1874 unsigned j = 0;
1875 do
1876 {
1877 f(FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR, r + j);
1878 } while (++j < bm::set_sub_array_size);
1879 continue;
1880 }
1881
1882 unsigned non_empty_top = 0;
1883 size_type r = i * bm::set_sub_array_size;
1884 unsigned j = 0;
1885 do
1886 {
1887#if defined(BM64_AVX2) || defined(BM64_AVX512)
1888 if (!avx2_test_all_zero_wave(blk_blk + j))
1889 {
1890 non_empty_top = 1;
1891 T* blk0 = blk_blk[j + 0];
1892 T* blk1 = blk_blk[j + 1];
1893 T* blk2 = blk_blk[j + 2];
1894 T* blk3 = blk_blk[j + 3];
1895
1896 size_type block_idx = r + j + 0;
1897 if (blk0)
1898 f(blk0, block_idx);
1899 else
1900 f.on_empty_block(block_idx);
1901
1902 if (blk1)
1903 f(blk1, block_idx + 1);
1904 else
1905 f.on_empty_block(block_idx + 1);
1906
1907 if (blk2)
1908 f(blk2, block_idx + 2);
1909 else
1910 f.on_empty_block(block_idx + 2);
1911
1912 if (blk3)
1913 f(blk3, block_idx + 3);
1914 else
1915 f.on_empty_block(block_idx + 3);
1916 }
1917 else
1918 {
1919 f.on_empty_block(r + j + 0); f.on_empty_block(r + j + 1);
1920 f.on_empty_block(r + j + 2); f.on_empty_block(r + j + 3);
1921 }
1922 j += 4;
1923#elif defined(BM64_SSE4)
1924 if (!sse42_test_all_zero_wave((blk_blk + j)))
1925 {
1926 non_empty_top = 1;
1927 T* blk0 = blk_blk[j + 0];
1928 T* blk1 = blk_blk[j + 1];
1929
1930 size_type block_idx = r + j + 0;
1931 if (blk0)
1932 f(blk0, block_idx);
1933 else
1934 f.on_empty_block(block_idx);
1935
1936 ++block_idx;
1937 if (blk1)
1938 f(blk1, block_idx);
1939 else
1940 f.on_empty_block(block_idx);
1941 }
1942 else
1943 {
1944 f.on_empty_block(r + j + 0);
1945 f.on_empty_block(r + j + 1);
1946 }
1947 j += 2;
1948#else
1949 if (blk_blk[j])
1950 {
1951 f(blk_blk[j], r + j);
1952 non_empty_top = 1;
1953 }
1954 else
1955 f.on_empty_block(r + j);
1956 ++j;
1957#endif
1958 } while (j < bm::set_sub_array_size);
1959
1960 if (non_empty_top == 0)
1961 f.on_empty_top(i);
1962 } // for i
1963}
1964
1965/*! For each non-zero block executes supplied function.
1966*/
1967template<class T, class F>
1968void for_each_nzblock2(T*** root, unsigned size1, F& f)
1969{
1970#ifdef BM64_SSE4
1971 for (unsigned i = 0; i < size1; ++i)
1972 {
1973 T** blk_blk;
1974 if ((blk_blk = root[i])!=0)
1975 {
1976 if (blk_blk == (T**)FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1977 {
1978 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++j)
1979 {
1980 f(FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR);
1981 }
1982 continue;
1983 }
1984 {
1985 __m128i w0;
1986 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bm::set_sub_array_size; j+=4)
1987 {
1988 w0 = _mm_loadu_si128((__m128i*)(blk_blk + j));
1989 if (!_mm_testz_si128(w0, w0))
1990 {
1991 T* blk0 = blk_blk[j + 0];
1992 T* blk1 = blk_blk[j + 1];
1993
1994 if (blk0)
1995 f(blk0);
1996 if (blk1)
1997 f(blk1);
1998 }
1999 w0 = _mm_loadu_si128((__m128i*)(blk_blk + j + 2));
2000 if (!_mm_testz_si128(w0, w0))
2001 {
2002 T* blk0 = blk_blk[j + 2];
2003 T* blk1 = blk_blk[j + 3];
2004 if (blk0)
2005 f(blk0);
2006 if (blk1)
2007 f(blk1);
2008 }
2009 } // for j
2010 }
2011 }
2012 } // for i
2013#elif defined(BM64_AVX2) || defined(BM64_AVX512)
2014 for (unsigned i = 0; i < size1; ++i)
2015 {
2016 T** blk_blk;
2017 if ((blk_blk = root[i]) != 0)
2018 {
2019 if (blk_blk == (T**)FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
2020 {
2021 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++j)
2022 {
2023 f(FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR);
2024 }
2025 continue;
2026 }
2027 {
2028 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bm::set_sub_array_size; j += 4)
2029 {
2030 __m256i w0 = _mm256_loadu_si256((__m256i*)(blk_blk + j));
2031 if (!_mm256_testz_si256(w0, w0))
2032 {
2033 // as a variant could use: blk0 = (T*)_mm256_extract_epi64(w0, 0);
2034 // but it measures marginally slower
2035 T* blk0 = blk_blk[j + 0];
2036 T* blk1 = blk_blk[j + 1];
2037 T* blk2 = blk_blk[j + 2];
2038 T* blk3 = blk_blk[j + 3];
2039 if (blk0)
2040 f(blk0);
2041 if (blk1)
2042 f(blk1);
2043 if (blk2)
2044 f(blk2);
2045 if (blk3)
2046 f(blk3);
2047 }
2048 } // for j
2049 }
2050 }
2051 } // for i
2052
2053#else // non-SIMD mode
2054 for (unsigned i = 0; i < size1; ++i)
2055 {
2056 T** blk_blk;
2057 if ((blk_blk = root[i])!=0)
2058 {
2059 if (blk_blk == (T**)FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
2060 {
2061 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++j)
2062 {
2063 f(FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR);
2064 }
2065 continue;
2066 }
2067 unsigned j = 0;
2068 do
2069 {
2070 if (blk_blk[j])
2071 f(blk_blk[j]);
2072 if (blk_blk[j+1])
2073 f(blk_blk[j+1]);
2074 if (blk_blk[j+2])
2075 f(blk_blk[j+2]);
2076 if (blk_blk[j+3])
2077 f(blk_blk[j+3]);
2078 j += 4;
2079 } while (j < bm::set_sub_array_size);
2080 }
2081 } // for i
2082#endif
2083}
2084
2085
2086/*! For each non-zero block executes supplied function-predicate.
2087 Function returns if function-predicate returns true
2088*/
2089template<typename T, typename BI, typename F>
2090bool for_each_nzblock_if(T*** root, BI size1, F& f) BMNOEXCEPT
2091{
2092 BI block_idx = 0;
2093 for (BI i = 0; i < size1; ++i)
2094 {
2095 T** blk_blk = root[i];
2096 if (!blk_blk)
2097 {
2098 block_idx += bm::set_sub_array_size;
2099 continue;
2100 }
2101 if (blk_blk == (T**)FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
2102 {
2103 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++j, ++block_idx)
2104 {
2105 if (f(FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR, block_idx))
2106 return true;
2107 } // for j
2108 continue;
2109 }
2110
2111 for (unsigned j = 0;j < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++j, ++block_idx)
2112 {
2113 if (blk_blk[j])
2114 if (f(blk_blk[j], block_idx))
2115 return true;
2116 } // for j
2117 } // for i
2118 return false;
2119}
2120
2121/*! For each block executes supplied function.
2122*/
2123template<class T, class F, typename BLOCK_IDX>
2124void for_each_block(T*** root, unsigned size1, F& f, BLOCK_IDX start)
2125{
2126 BLOCK_IDX block_idx = start;
2127 for (unsigned i = 0; i < size1; ++i)
2128 {
2129 T** blk_blk = root[i];
2130 if (blk_blk)
2131 {
2132 if (blk_blk == (T**)FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
2133 {
2134 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++j, ++block_idx)
2135 {
2136 f(FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR, block_idx);
2137 }
2138 continue;
2139 }
2140 for (unsigned j = 0;j < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++j, ++block_idx)
2141 {
2142 f(blk_blk[j], block_idx);
2143 }
2144 }
2145 else
2146 {
2147 for (unsigned j = 0;j < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++j, ++block_idx)
2148 {
2149 f(0, block_idx);
2150 }
2151 }
2152 }
2153}
2154
2155
2156
2157/*! Special BM optimized analog of STL for_each
2158*/
2159template<class T, class F> F bmfor_each(T first, T last, F f)
2160{
2161 do
2162 {
2163 f(*first);
2164 ++first;
2165 } while (first < last);
2166 return f;
2167}
2168
2169/*! Computes SUM of all elements of the sequence
2170*/
2171template<typename T>
2172bm::id64_t sum_arr(const T* first, const T* last) BMNOEXCEPT
2173{
2174 bm::id64_t sum = 0;
2175 for (;first < last; ++first)
2176 sum += *first;
2177 return sum;
2178}
2179
2180/*!
2181 Extract short (len=1) exceptions from the GAP block
2182 \param buf - GAP buffer to split
2183 \param arr0 - [OUT] list of isolates 0 positions (clear list)
2184 \param arr1 - [OUT] list of isolated 1 positions (set list)
2185 \param arr0_cnt - [OUT] arr0 size
2186 \param arr1_cnt -
2187 @ingroup gapfunc
2188*/
2189template<typename T>
2190void gap_split(const T* buf,
2191 T* arr0, T* arr1, T& arr0_cnt, T& arr1_cnt) BMNOEXCEPT
2192{
2193 const T* pcurr = buf;
2194 unsigned len = (*pcurr >> 3);
2195 const T* pend = pcurr + len;
2196
2197 T cnt0, cnt1;
2198 cnt0 = cnt1 = 0;
2199 unsigned is_set = (*buf & 1);
2200
2201 if (*pcurr == 0)
2202 {
2203 if (is_set)
2204 {
2205 arr1[cnt1] = *pcurr;
2206 ++cnt1;
2207 }
2208 else
2209 {
2210 arr0[cnt0] = *pcurr;
2211 ++cnt0;
2212 }
2213 }
2214 T prev = *pcurr;
2215 ++pcurr;
2216
2217 while (pcurr <= pend)
2218 {
2219 is_set ^= 1;
2220 T delta = *pcurr - prev;
2221 if (delta == 1)
2222 {
2223 if (is_set)
2224 {
2225 arr1[cnt1] = prev;
2226 ++cnt1;
2227 }
2228 else
2229 {
2230 arr0[cnt0] = prev;
2231 ++cnt0;
2232 }
2233 }
2234 prev = *pcurr++;
2235 } // while
2236
2237 arr0_cnt = cnt0;
2238 arr1_cnt = cnt1;
2239}
2240
2241
2242/*!
2243 \brief Calculates number of bits ON in GAP buffer.
2244 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
2245 \param dsize - buffer size
2246 \return Number of non-zero bits.
2247 @ingroup gapfunc
2248*/
2249template<typename T>
2250unsigned gap_bit_count(const T* buf, unsigned dsize=0) BMNOEXCEPT
2251{
2252 const T* pcurr = buf;
2253 if (dsize == 0)
2254 dsize = (*pcurr >> 3);
2255
2256 const T* pend = pcurr + dsize;
2257
2258 unsigned bits_counter = 0;
2259 ++pcurr;
2260
2261 if (*buf & 1)
2262 {
2263 bits_counter += *pcurr + 1;
2264 ++pcurr;
2265 }
2266 for (++pcurr; pcurr <= pend; pcurr += 2)
2267 bits_counter += *pcurr - *(pcurr-1);
2268 return bits_counter;
2269}
2270
2271/*!
2272 \brief Calculates number of bits ON in GAP buffer. Loop unrolled version.
2273 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
2274 \return Number of non-zero bits.
2275 @ingroup gapfunc
2276*/
2277template<typename T>
2278unsigned gap_bit_count_unr(const T* buf) BMNOEXCEPT
2279{
2280 const T* pcurr = buf;
2281 unsigned dsize = (*pcurr >> 3);
2282
2283 unsigned cnt = 0;
2284 pcurr = buf + 1; // set up start position
2285 T first_one = *buf & 1;
2286 if (first_one)
2287 {
2288 cnt += *pcurr + 1;
2289 ++pcurr;
2290 }
2291 ++pcurr; // set GAP to 1
2292
2293 #if defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined(BMAVX512OPT)
2294 if (dsize > 34)
2295 {
2296 const unsigned unr_factor = 32;
2297 unsigned waves = (dsize-2) / unr_factor;
2298 pcurr = avx2_gap_sum_arr(pcurr, waves, &cnt);
2299 }
2300 #elif defined(BMSSE42OPT) || defined(BMSSE2OPT)
2301 if (dsize > 18)
2302 {
2303 const unsigned unr_factor = 16;
2304 unsigned waves = (dsize - 2) / unr_factor;
2305 pcurr = sse2_gap_sum_arr(pcurr, waves, &cnt);
2306 }
2307 #else
2308 if (dsize > 10)
2309 {
2310 const unsigned unr_factor = 8;
2311 unsigned waves = (dsize - 2) / unr_factor;
2312 for (unsigned i = 0; i < waves; i += unr_factor)
2313 {
2314 cnt += pcurr[0] - pcurr[0 - 1];
2315 cnt += pcurr[2] - pcurr[2 - 1];
2316 cnt += pcurr[4] - pcurr[4 - 1];
2317 cnt += pcurr[6] - pcurr[6 - 1];
2318
2319 pcurr += unr_factor;
2320 } // for
2321 }
2322 #endif
2323
2324 const T* pend = buf + dsize;
2325 for ( ; pcurr <= pend ; pcurr+=2)
2326 cnt += *pcurr - *(pcurr - 1);
2327
2328 BM_ASSERT(cnt == bm::gap_bit_count(buf));
2329 return cnt;
2330}
2331
2332
2333
2334/*!
2335 \brief Counts 1 bits in GAP buffer in the closed [left, right] range.
2336 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
2337 \param left - leftmost bit index to start from
2338 \param right - rightmost bit index
2339 \param pos - position in the
2340 \return Number of non-zero bits.
2341 @ingroup gapfunc
2342*/
2343template<typename T, bool RIGHT_END = false>
2344unsigned gap_bit_count_range(const T* const buf,
2345 unsigned left, unsigned right) BMNOEXCEPT
2346{
2347 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
2348 BM_ASSERT(right < bm::gap_max_bits);
2349
2350 unsigned is_set, bits_counter, prev_gap;
2351 unsigned start_pos = bm::gap_bfind(buf, left, &is_set);
2352 is_set = ~(is_set - 1u); // 0xFFF.. if true (mask for branchless code)
2353
2354 const T* pcurr = buf + start_pos;
2355 if (right <= *pcurr) // we are in the target gap right now
2356 bits_counter = unsigned(right - left + 1u) & is_set;
2357 else
2358 {
2359 bits_counter = unsigned(*pcurr - left + 1u) & is_set;
2360 if constexpr (RIGHT_END) // count to the end
2361 {
2362 BM_ASSERT(right == bm::gap_max_bits-1);
2363 for (prev_gap = *pcurr++ ;true; prev_gap = *pcurr++)
2364 {
2365 bits_counter += (is_set ^= ~0u) & (*pcurr - prev_gap);
2366 if (*pcurr == bm::gap_max_bits-1)
2367 break;
2368 } // for
2369 }
2370 else // true range search here
2371 {
2372 for (prev_gap = *pcurr++; right > *pcurr; prev_gap = *pcurr++)
2373 bits_counter += (is_set ^= ~0u) & (*pcurr - prev_gap);
2374 bits_counter += unsigned(right - prev_gap) & (is_set ^ ~0u);
2375 }
2376 }
2377 return bits_counter;
2378
2379}
2380
2381/*!
2382 \brief Counts 1 bits in GAP buffer in the closed [left, right] range using position hint to avoid bfind
2383 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
2384 \param left - leftmost bit index to start from
2385 \param right - rightmost bit index
2386 \param pos - position in the
2387 \param hint - position hint
2388 \return Number of non-zero bits.
2389 @ingroup gapfunc
2390*/
2391template<typename T>
2392unsigned gap_bit_count_range_hint(const T* const buf,
2393 unsigned left, unsigned right, unsigned hint) BMNOEXCEPT
2394{
2395 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
2396 BM_ASSERT(right < bm::gap_max_bits);
2397
2398 unsigned is_set, bits_counter, prev_gap;
2399
2400 // process the hint instead of binary search
2401 is_set = hint & 1;
2402 is_set = ~(is_set - 1u); // 0xFFF.. if true (mask for branchless code)
2403 unsigned start_pos = hint >> 1;
2404 {
2405 unsigned is_set_c; (void)is_set_c;
2406 unsigned pos; (void)pos;
2407 BM_ASSERT((pos = bm::gap_bfind(buf, left, &is_set_c))==start_pos);
2408 BM_ASSERT(bool(is_set) == bool(is_set_c));
2409 }
2410
2411 const T* pcurr = buf + start_pos;
2412 if (right <= *pcurr) // we are in the target gap right now
2413 bits_counter = unsigned(right - left + 1u) & is_set;
2414 else
2415 {
2416 bits_counter = unsigned(*pcurr - left + 1u) & is_set;
2417 for (prev_gap = *pcurr++; right > *pcurr; prev_gap = *pcurr++)
2418 bits_counter += (is_set ^= ~0u) & (*pcurr - prev_gap);
2419 bits_counter += unsigned(right - prev_gap) & (is_set ^ ~0u);
2420 }
2421 return bits_counter;
2422}
2423
2424
2425/*!
2426 \brief Test if all bits are 1 in GAP buffer in the [left, right] range.
2427 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
2428 \param left - leftmost bit index to start from
2429 \param right- rightmost bit index
2430 \return true if all bits are "11111"
2431 @ingroup gapfunc
2432*/
2433template<typename T>
2434bool gap_is_all_one_range(const T* const BMRESTRICT buf,
2435 unsigned left, unsigned right) BMNOEXCEPT
2436{
2437 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
2438 BM_ASSERT(right < bm::gap_max_bits);
2439
2440 unsigned is_set;
2441 unsigned start_pos = bm::gap_bfind(buf, left, &is_set);
2442 if (!is_set) // GAP is 0
2443 return false;
2444 const T* const pcurr = buf + start_pos;
2445 return (right <= *pcurr);
2446}
2447
2448/*!
2449 \brief Test if any bits are 1 in GAP buffer in the [left, right] range.
2450 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
2451 \param left - leftmost bit index to start from
2452 \param right- rightmost bit index
2453 \return true if at least 1 "00010"
2454 @ingroup gapfunc
2455*/
2456template<typename T>
2457bool gap_any_range(const T* const BMRESTRICT buf,
2458 unsigned left, unsigned right) BMNOEXCEPT
2459{
2460 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
2461 BM_ASSERT(right < bm::gap_max_bits);
2462
2463 unsigned is_set;
2464 unsigned start_pos = bm::gap_bfind(buf, left, &is_set);
2465 const T* const pcurr = buf + start_pos;
2466
2467 if (!is_set) // start GAP is 0 ...
2468 {
2469 if (right <= *pcurr) // ...bit if the interval goes into at least 1 blk
2470 return false; // .. nope
2471 return true;
2472 }
2473 return true;
2474}
2475
2476/*!
2477 \brief Test if any bits are 1 in GAP buffer in the [left, right] range
2478 and flanked with 0s
2479 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
2480 \param left - leftmost bit index to start from
2481 \param right- rightmost bit index
2482 \return true if "011110"
2483 @ingroup gapfunc
2484*/
2485template<typename T>
2486bool gap_is_interval(const T* const BMRESTRICT buf,
2487 unsigned left, unsigned right) BMNOEXCEPT
2488{
2489 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
2490 BM_ASSERT(left > 0); // cannot check left-1 otherwise
2491 BM_ASSERT(right < bm::gap_max_bits-1); // cannot check right+1 otherwise
2492
2493 unsigned is_set;
2494 unsigned start_pos = bm::gap_bfind(buf, left, &is_set);
2495
2496 const T* pcurr = buf + start_pos;
2497 if (!is_set || (right != *pcurr) || (start_pos <= 1))
2498 return false;
2499 --pcurr;
2500 if (*pcurr != left-1)
2501 return false;
2502 return true;
2503}
2504
2505/**
2506 \brief Searches for the last 1 bit in the 111 interval of a GAP block
2507 \param buf - BIT block buffer
2508 \param nbit - bit index to start checking from
2509 \param pos - [out] found value
2510
2511 \return false if not found
2512 @ingroup gapfunc
2513*/
2514template<typename T>
2515bool gap_find_interval_end(const T* const BMRESTRICT buf,
2516 unsigned nbit, unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
2517{
2518 BM_ASSERT(pos);
2519 BM_ASSERT(nbit < bm::gap_max_bits);
2520
2521 unsigned is_set;
2522 unsigned start_pos = bm::gap_bfind(buf, nbit, &is_set);
2523 if (!is_set)
2524 return false;
2525 *pos = buf[start_pos];
2526 return true;
2527}
2528
2529
2530/**
2531 \brief Searches for the first 1 bit in the 111 interval of a GAP block
2532 \param buf - GAP block buffer
2533 \param nbit - bit index to start checking from
2534 \param pos - [out] found value
2535
2536 \return false if not found
2537 @ingroup gapfunc
2538*/
2539template<typename T>
2540bool gap_find_interval_start(const T* const BMRESTRICT buf,
2541 unsigned nbit, unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
2542{
2543 BM_ASSERT(pos);
2544 BM_ASSERT(nbit < bm::gap_max_bits);
2545
2546 unsigned is_set;
2547 unsigned start_pos = bm::gap_bfind(buf, nbit, &is_set);
2548 if (!is_set)
2549 return false;
2550 --start_pos;
2551 if (!start_pos)
2552 *pos = 0;
2553 else
2554 *pos = buf[start_pos]+1;
2555 return true;
2556}
2557
2558/**
2559 \brief reverse search for the first 1 bit of a GAP block
2560 \param buf - GAP block buffer
2561 \param nbit - bit index to start checking from
2562 \param pos - [out] found value
2563
2564 \return false if not found
2565 @ingroup gapfunc
2566*/
2567template<typename T>
2568bool gap_find_prev(const T* const BMRESTRICT buf,
2569 unsigned nbit, unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
2570{
2571 BM_ASSERT(pos);
2572 BM_ASSERT(nbit < bm::gap_max_bits);
2573
2574 unsigned is_set;
2575 unsigned start_pos = bm::gap_bfind(buf, nbit, &is_set);
2576 if (is_set)
2577 {
2578 *pos = nbit;
2579 return true;
2580 }
2581 --start_pos;
2582 if (!start_pos)
2583 return false;
2584 else
2585 *pos = buf[start_pos];
2586 return true;
2587}
2588
2589
2590
2591/*!
2592 \brief GAP block find position for the rank
2593
2594 \param block - bit block buffer pointer
2595 \param rank - rank to find (must be > 0)
2596 \param nbit_from - start bit position in block
2597 \param nbit_pos - found position
2598
2599 \return 0 if position with rank was found, or
2600 the remaining rank (rank - population count)
2601
2602 @ingroup gapfunc
2603*/
2604template<typename T, typename SIZE_TYPE>
2605SIZE_TYPE gap_find_rank(const T* const block,
2606 SIZE_TYPE rank,
2607 unsigned nbit_from,
2608 unsigned& nbit_pos) BMNOEXCEPT
2609{
2610 BM_ASSERT(block);
2611 BM_ASSERT(rank);
2612
2613 const T* pcurr = block;
2614 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
2615
2616 unsigned bits_counter = 0;
2617 unsigned is_set;
2618 unsigned start_pos = bm::gap_bfind(block, nbit_from, &is_set);
2619 is_set = ~(is_set - 1u); // 0xFFF.. if true (mask for branchless code)
2620
2621 pcurr = block + start_pos;
2622 bits_counter += unsigned(*pcurr - nbit_from + 1u) & is_set;
2623 if (bits_counter >= rank) // found!
2624 {
2625 nbit_pos = nbit_from + unsigned(rank) - 1u;
2626 return 0;
2627 }
2628 rank -= bits_counter;
2629 unsigned prev_gap = *pcurr++;
2630 for (is_set ^= ~0u; pcurr <= pend; is_set ^= ~0u)
2631 {
2632 bits_counter = (*pcurr - prev_gap) & is_set;
2633 if (bits_counter >= rank) // found!
2634 {
2635 nbit_pos = prev_gap + unsigned(rank);
2636 return 0;
2637 }
2638 rank -= bits_counter;
2639 prev_gap = *pcurr++;
2640 } // for
2641
2642 return rank;
2643}
2644
2645
2646
2647/*!
2648 \brief Counts 1 bits in GAP buffer in the closed [0, right] range.
2649 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
2650 \param right- rightmost bit index
2651 \param is_corrected - if true the result will be rank corrected
2652 if right bit == true count=count-1
2653 \return Number of non-zero bits
2654 @ingroup gapfunc
2655*/
2656/*
2657template<typename T>
2658unsigned gap_bit_count_to(const T* const buf, T right,
2659 bool is_corrected=false) BMNOEXCEPT
2660{
2661 const T* pcurr = buf;
2662 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
2663
2664 unsigned bits_counter = 0;
2665 unsigned is_set = ~((unsigned(*buf) & 1u) - 1u); // 0xFFF.. if true (mask for branchless code)
2666 BM_ASSERT(is_set == 0u || is_set == ~0u);
2667 pcurr = buf + 1;
2668
2669 if (right <= *pcurr) // we are in the target block right now
2670 {
2671 bits_counter = (right + 1u) & is_set; // & is_set == if (is_set)
2672 bits_counter -= (is_set & unsigned(is_corrected));
2673 return bits_counter;
2674 }
2675 bits_counter += (*pcurr + 1u) & is_set;
2676
2677 unsigned prev_gap = *pcurr++;
2678 for (is_set ^= ~0u; right > *pcurr; is_set ^= ~0u)
2679 {
2680 bits_counter += (*pcurr - prev_gap) & is_set;
2681 if (pcurr == pend)
2682 {
2683 bits_counter -= (is_set & unsigned(is_corrected));
2684 return bits_counter;
2685 }
2686 prev_gap = *pcurr++;
2687 }
2688 bits_counter += (right - prev_gap) & is_set;
2689 bits_counter -= (is_set & unsigned(is_corrected));
2690 return bits_counter;
2691}
2692*/
2693template<typename T, bool TCORRECT=false>
2694unsigned gap_bit_count_to(const T* const buf, T right) BMNOEXCEPT
2695{
2696 BM_ASSERT(right < bm::gap_max_bits);
2697
2698 unsigned bits_counter, prev_gap;
2699
2700 unsigned is_set = ~((unsigned(*buf) & 1u) - 1u); // 0xFFF.. if true (mask for branchless code)
2701 const T* pcurr = buf + 1;
2702 if (right <= *pcurr) // we are in the target block right now
2703 {
2704 bits_counter = (right + 1u) & is_set; // & is_set == if (is_set)
2705 }
2706 else
2707 {
2708 bits_counter = (*pcurr + 1u) & is_set;
2709 prev_gap = *pcurr++;
2710 for (is_set ^= ~0u; right > *pcurr; is_set ^= ~0u, prev_gap = *pcurr++)
2711 {
2712 bits_counter += (*pcurr - prev_gap) & is_set;
2713 if (*pcurr == bm::gap_max_bits-1)
2714 goto cret;
2715 }
2716 bits_counter += (right - prev_gap) & is_set;
2717 }
2718
2719 cret:
2720 if constexpr (TCORRECT)
2721 bits_counter -= (is_set & unsigned(TCORRECT));
2722 return bits_counter;
2723}
2724
2725
2726
2727/*!
2728 D-GAP block for_each algorithm
2729
2730 D-Gap Functor is called for each element but last one.
2731
2732 \param gap_buf - GAP buffer
2733 \param func - functor object
2734
2735*/
2736template<class T, class Func>
2737void for_each_dgap(const T* gap_buf, Func& func)
2738{
2739 const T* pcurr = gap_buf;
2740 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
2741 ++pcurr;
2742
2743 T prev = *pcurr;
2744 func((T)(prev + 1)); // first element incremented to avoid 0
2745 ++pcurr;
2746 do
2747 {
2748 func((T)(*pcurr - prev)); // all others are [N] - [N-1]
2749 prev = *pcurr;
2750 } while (++pcurr < pend);
2751}
2752
2753/** d-Gap copy functor
2754 @internal
2755*/
2756template<typename T> struct d_copy_func
2757{
2758 d_copy_func(T* dg_buf) : dgap_buf_(dg_buf) {}
2759 void operator()(T dgap) { *dgap_buf_++ = dgap; }
2760
2761 T* dgap_buf_;
2762};
2763
2764/*!
2765 \brief Convert GAP buffer into D-GAP buffer
2766
2767 Delta GAP representation is DGAP[N] = GAP[N] - GAP[N-1]
2768
2769 \param gap_buf - GAP buffer
2770 \param dgap_buf - Delta-GAP buffer
2771 \param copy_head - flag to copy GAP header
2772
2773 \internal
2774
2775 @ingroup gapfunc
2776*/
2777template<typename T>
2778T* gap_2_dgap(const T* BMRESTRICT gap_buf,
2779 T* BMRESTRICT dgap_buf, bool copy_head=true) BMNOEXCEPT
2780{
2781 if (copy_head) // copy GAP header
2782 {
2783 *dgap_buf++ = *gap_buf;
2784 }
2785
2786 d_copy_func<T> copy_func(dgap_buf);
2787 for_each_dgap<T, d_copy_func<T> >(gap_buf, copy_func);
2788 return copy_func.dgap_buf_;
2789}
2790
2791/*!
2792 \brief Convert D-GAP buffer into GAP buffer
2793
2794 GAP representation is GAP[N] = DGAP[N] + DGAP[N-1]
2795
2796 \param dgap_buf - Delta-GAP buffer
2797 \param gap_header - GAP header word
2798 \param gap_buf - GAP buffer
2799
2800 \internal
2801 @ingroup gapfunc
2802*/
2803template<typename T>
2804void dgap_2_gap(const T* BMRESTRICT dgap_buf,
2805 T* BMRESTRICT gap_buf, T gap_header=0) BMNOEXCEPT
2806{
2807 const T* pcurr = dgap_buf;
2808 unsigned len;
2809 if (!gap_header) // GAP header is already part of the stream
2810 {
2811 len = *pcurr >> 3;
2812 *gap_buf++ = *pcurr++; // copy GAP header
2813 }
2814 else // GAP header passed as a parameter
2815 {
2816 len = gap_header >> 3;
2817 *gap_buf++ = gap_header; // assign GAP header
2818 }
2819 --len; // last element is actually not encoded
2820 const T* pend = pcurr + len;
2821
2822 *gap_buf = *pcurr++; // copy first element
2823 if (*gap_buf == 0)
2824 *gap_buf = 65535; // fix +1 overflow
2825 else
2826 *gap_buf = T(*gap_buf - 1);
2827
2828 for (++gap_buf; pcurr < pend; ++pcurr)
2829 {
2830 T prev = *(gap_buf-1); // don't remove temp(undef expression!)
2831 *gap_buf++ = T(*pcurr + prev);
2832 }
2833 *gap_buf = 65535; // add missing last element
2834}
2835
2836
2837/*!
2838 \brief Lexicographical comparison of GAP buffers.
2839 \param buf1 - First GAP buffer pointer.
2840 \param buf2 - Second GAP buffer pointer.
2841 \return <0 - less, =0 - equal, >0 - greater.
2842
2843 @ingroup gapfunc
2844*/
2845template<typename T>
2846int gapcmp(const T* buf1, const T* buf2) BMNOEXCEPT
2847{
2848 const T* pcurr1 = buf1;
2849 const T* pend1 = pcurr1 + (*pcurr1 >> 3);
2850 unsigned bitval1 = *buf1 & 1;
2851 ++pcurr1;
2852
2853 const T* pcurr2 = buf2;
2854 unsigned bitval2 = *buf2 & 1;
2855 ++pcurr2;
2856
2857 while (pcurr1 <= pend1)
2858 {
2859 if (*pcurr1 == *pcurr2)
2860 {
2861 if (bitval1 != bitval2)
2862 {
2863 return (bitval1) ? 1 : -1;
2864 }
2865 }
2866 else
2867 {
2868 if (bitval1 == bitval2)
2869 {
2870 if (bitval1)
2871 {
2872 return (*pcurr1 < *pcurr2) ? -1 : 1;
2873 }
2874 else
2875 {
2876 return (*pcurr1 < *pcurr2) ? 1 : -1;
2877 }
2878 }
2879 else
2880 {
2881 return (bitval1) ? 1 : -1;
2882 }
2883 }
2884 ++pcurr1; ++pcurr2;
2885 bitval1 ^= 1;
2886 bitval2 ^= 1;
2887 }
2888
2889 return 0;
2890}
2891
2892/*!
2893 \brief Find first bit which is different between two GAP-blocks
2894 \param buf1 - block 1
2895 \param buf2 - block 2
2896 \param pos - out - position of difference (undefined if blocks are equal)
2897 \return true if difference was found
2898
2899 @ingroup gapfunc
2900*/
2901template<typename T>
2902bool gap_find_first_diff(const T* BMRESTRICT buf1,
2903 const T* BMRESTRICT buf2,
2904 unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
2905{
2906 BM_ASSERT(buf1 && buf2 && pos);
2907
2908 const T* pcurr1 = buf1;
2909 const T* pend1 = pcurr1 + (*pcurr1 >> 3);
2910 const T* pcurr2 = buf2;
2911 for (++pcurr1, ++pcurr2; pcurr1 <= pend1; ++pcurr1, ++pcurr2)
2912 {
2913 if (*pcurr1 != *pcurr2)
2914 {
2915 *pos = 1 + ((*pcurr1 < *pcurr2) ? *pcurr1 : *pcurr2);
2916 return true;
2917 }
2918 } // for
2919 return false;
2920}
2921
2922// -------------------------------------------------------------------------
2923//
2924
2925/*!
2926 \brief Abstract operation for GAP buffers.
2927 Receives functor F as a template argument
2928 \param dest - destination memory buffer.
2929 \param vect1 - operand 1 GAP encoded buffer.
2930 \param vect1_mask - XOR mask for starting bitflag for vector1
2931 can be 0 or 1 (1 inverts the vector)
2932 \param vect2 - operand 2 GAP encoded buffer.
2933 \param vect2_mask - same as vect1_mask
2934 \param dlen - destination length after the operation
2935
2936 \note Internal function.
2937 @internal
2938
2939 @ingroup gapfunc
2940*/
2941template<typename T, class F>
2942void gap_buff_op(T* BMRESTRICT dest,
2943 const T* BMRESTRICT vect1,
2944 unsigned vect1_mask,
2945 const T* BMRESTRICT vect2,
2946 unsigned vect2_mask,
2947 unsigned& dlen) BMNOEXCEPT2
2948{
2949 const T* cur1 = vect1;
2950 const T* cur2 = vect2;
2951
2952 T bitval1 = (T)((*cur1++ & 1) ^ vect1_mask);
2953 T bitval2 = (T)((*cur2++ & 1) ^ vect2_mask);
2954
2955 T bitval = (T) F::op(bitval1, bitval2);
2956 T bitval_prev = bitval;
2957
2958 T* res = dest;
2959 *res = bitval;
2960 ++res;
2961
2962 T c1 = *cur1; T c2 = *cur2;
2963 while (1)
2964 {
2965 bitval = (T) F::op(bitval1, bitval2);
2966
2967 // Check if GAP value changes and we need to
2968 // start the next one
2969 //
2970 res += (bitval != bitval_prev);
2971 bitval_prev = bitval;
2972 if (c1 < c2) // (*cur1 < *cur2)
2973 {
2974 *res = c1;
2975 ++cur1; c1 = *cur1;
2976 bitval1 ^= 1;
2977 }
2978 else // >=
2979 {
2980 *res = c2;
2981 if (c2 < c1) // (*cur2 < *cur1)
2982 {
2983 bitval2 ^= 1;
2984 }
2985 else // equal
2986 {
2987 if (c2 == (bm::gap_max_bits - 1))
2988 break;
2989
2990 ++cur1; c1 = *cur1;
2991 bitval1 ^= 1; bitval2 ^= 1;
2992 }
2993 ++cur2; c2 = *cur2;
2994 }
2995 } // while
2996
2997 dlen = (unsigned)(res - dest);
2998 *dest = (T)((*dest & 7) + (dlen << 3));
2999}
3000
3001
3002
3003/*!
3004 \brief Abstract distance test operation for GAP buffers.
3005 Receives functor F as a template argument
3006 \param vect1 - operand 1 GAP encoded buffer.
3007 \param vect1_mask - XOR mask for starting bitflag for vector1
3008 can be 0 or 1 (1 inverts the vector)
3009 \param vect2 - operand 2 GAP encoded buffer.
3010 \param vect2_mask - same as vect1_mask
3011 \note Internal function.
3012 \return non zero value if operation result returns any 1 bit
3013
3014 @ingroup gapfunc
3015*/
3016template<typename T, class F>
3017unsigned gap_buff_any_op(const T* BMRESTRICT vect1,
3018 unsigned vect1_mask,
3019 const T* BMRESTRICT vect2,
3020 unsigned vect2_mask) BMNOEXCEPT2
3021{
3022 const T* cur1 = vect1;
3023 const T* cur2 = vect2;
3024
3025 unsigned bitval1 = (*cur1++ & 1) ^ vect1_mask;
3026 unsigned bitval2 = (*cur2++ & 1) ^ vect2_mask;
3027
3028 unsigned bitval = F::op(bitval1, bitval2);
3029 if (bitval)
3030 return bitval;
3031 unsigned bitval_prev = bitval;
3032
3033 while (1)
3034 {
3035 bitval = F::op(bitval1, bitval2);
3036 if (bitval)
3037 return bitval;
3038
3039 if (bitval != bitval_prev)
3040 bitval_prev = bitval;
3041
3042 if (*cur1 < *cur2)
3043 {
3044 ++cur1;
3045 bitval1 ^= 1;
3046 }
3047 else // >=
3048 {
3049 if (*cur2 < *cur1)
3050 {
3051 bitval2 ^= 1;
3052 }
3053 else // equal
3054 {
3055 if (*cur2 == (bm::gap_max_bits - 1))
3056 {
3057 break;
3058 }
3059 ++cur1;
3060 bitval1 ^= 1; bitval2 ^= 1;
3061 }
3062 ++cur2;
3063 }
3064
3065 } // while
3066
3067 return 0;
3068}
3069
3070
3071
3072/*!
3073 \brief Abstract distance(similarity) operation for GAP buffers.
3074 Receives functor F as a template argument
3075 \param vect1 - operand 1 GAP encoded buffer.
3076 \param vect2 - operand 2 GAP encoded buffer.
3077 \note Internal function.
3078
3079 @ingroup gapfunc
3080*/
3081template<typename T, class F>
3082unsigned gap_buff_count_op(const T* vect1, const T* vect2) BMNOEXCEPT2
3083{
3084 unsigned count;// = 0;
3085 const T* cur1 = vect1;
3086 const T* cur2 = vect2;
3087
3088 unsigned bitval1 = (*cur1++ & 1);
3089 unsigned bitval2 = (*cur2++ & 1);
3090 unsigned bitval = count = F::op(bitval1, bitval2);
3091 unsigned bitval_prev = bitval;
3092
3093 T res, res_prev;
3094 res = res_prev = 0;
3095
3096 while (1)
3097 {
3098 bitval = F::op(bitval1, bitval2);
3099 // Check if GAP value changes and we need to
3100 // start the next one.
3101 if (bitval != bitval_prev)
3102 {
3103 bitval_prev = bitval;
3104 res_prev = res;
3105 }
3106
3107 if (*cur1 < *cur2)
3108 {
3109 res = *cur1;
3110 if (bitval)
3111 {
3112 count += res - res_prev;
3113 res_prev = res;
3114 }
3115 ++cur1; bitval1 ^= 1;
3116 }
3117 else // >=
3118 {
3119 res = *cur2;
3120 if (bitval)
3121 {
3122 count += res - res_prev;
3123 res_prev = res;
3124 }
3125 if (*cur2 < *cur1)
3126 {
3127 bitval2 ^= 1;
3128 }
3129 else // equal
3130 {
3131 if (*cur2 == (bm::gap_max_bits - 1))
3132 break;
3133
3134 ++cur1;
3135 bitval1 ^= 1; bitval2 ^= 1;
3136 }
3137 ++cur2;
3138 }
3139
3140 } // while
3141
3142 return count;
3143}
3144
3145
3146#ifdef __GNUG__
3147#pragma GCC diagnostic push
3148#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion"
3149#endif
3150
3151/*!
3152 \brief Sets or clears bit in the GAP buffer.
3153
3154 \param val - new bit value
3155 \param buf - GAP buffer.
3156 \param pos - Index of bit to set.
3157 \param is_set - (OUT) flag if bit was actually set.
3158
3159 \return New GAP buffer length.
3160
3161 @ingroup gapfunc
3162*/
3163template<typename T>
3164unsigned gap_set_value(unsigned val,
3165 T* BMRESTRICT buf,
3166 unsigned pos,
3167 unsigned* BMRESTRICT is_set) BMNOEXCEPT
3168{
3169 BM_ASSERT(pos < bm::gap_max_bits);
3170
3171 unsigned curr = bm::gap_bfind(buf, pos, is_set);
3172 T end = (T)(*buf >> 3);
3173 if (*is_set == val)
3174 {
3175 *is_set = 0;
3176 return end;
3177 }
3178 *is_set = 1;
3179
3180 T* pcurr = buf + curr;
3181 T* pprev = pcurr - 1;
3182 T* pend = buf + end;
3183
3184 // Special case, first bit GAP operation. There is no platform beside it.
3185 // initial flag must be inverted.
3186 if (!pos)
3187 {
3188 *buf ^= 1;
3189 if (buf[1]) // We need to insert a 1 bit GAP here
3190 {
3191 ::memmove(&buf[2], &buf[1], (end - 1) * sizeof(gap_word_t));
3192 buf[1] = 0;
3193 ++end;
3194 }
3195 else // Only 1 bit in the GAP. We need to delete the first GAP.
3196 {
3197 pprev = buf + 1; pcurr = pprev + 1;
3198 goto copy_gaps;
3199 }
3200 }
3201 else
3202 if (curr > 1 && ((unsigned)(*pprev))+1 == pos) // Left border bit
3203 {
3204 ++(*pprev);
3205 if (*pprev == *pcurr) // Curr. GAP to be merged with prev.GAP.
3206 {
3207 --end;
3208 if (pcurr != pend) // GAP merge: 2 GAPS to be deleted
3209 {
3210 ++pcurr;
3211 copy_gaps:
3212 --end;
3213 do { *pprev++ = *pcurr++; } while (pcurr < pend);
3214 }
3215 }
3216 }
3217 else
3218 if (*pcurr == pos) // Rightmost bit in the GAP. Border goes left.
3219 {
3220 --(*pcurr);
3221 end += (pcurr == pend);
3222 }
3223 else // Worst case: split current GAP
3224 {
3225 if (*pcurr != bm::gap_max_bits-1) // last gap does not need memmove
3226 ::memmove(pcurr+2, pcurr, (end - curr + 1)*(sizeof(T)));
3227 end += 2;
3228 pcurr[0] = (T)(pos-1);
3229 pcurr[1] = (T)pos;
3230 }
3231
3232 // Set correct length word and last border word
3233 *buf = (T)((*buf & 7) + (end << 3));
3234 buf[end] = bm::gap_max_bits-1;
3235 return end;
3236}
3237
3238
3239
3240
3241
3242/*!
3243 \brief Sets or clears bit in the GAP buffer.
3244
3245 \param val - new bit value
3246 \param buf - GAP buffer.
3247 \param pos - Index of bit to set.
3248
3249 \return New GAP buffer length.
3250
3251 @ingroup gapfunc
3252*/
3253template<typename T>
3254unsigned gap_set_value(unsigned val,
3255 T* BMRESTRICT buf,
