3256 unsigned pos) BMNOEXCEPT
3257{
3258 BM_ASSERT(pos < bm::gap_max_bits);
3259 unsigned is_set;
3260 unsigned curr = bm::gap_bfind(buf, pos, &is_set);
3261 T end = (T)(*buf >> 3);
3262 if (is_set == val)
3263 return end;
3264
3265 T* pcurr = buf + curr;
3266 T* pprev = pcurr - 1;
3267 T* pend = buf + end;
3268
3269 // Special case, first bit GAP operation. There is no platform beside it.
3270 // initial flag must be inverted.
3271 if (!pos)
3272 {
3273 *buf ^= 1;
3274 if (buf[1]) // We need to insert a 1 bit GAP here
3275 {
3276 ::memmove(&buf[2], &buf[1], (end - 1) * sizeof(gap_word_t));
3277 buf[1] = 0;
3278 ++end;
3279 }
3280 else // Only 1 bit in the GAP. We need to delete the first GAP.
3281 {
3282 pprev = buf + 1; pcurr = pprev + 1;
3283 goto copy_gaps;
3284 }
3285 }
3286 else
3287 if (curr > 1 && ((unsigned)(*pprev))+1 == pos) // Left border bit
3288 {
3289 ++(*pprev);
3290 if (*pprev == *pcurr) // Curr. GAP to be merged with prev.GAP.
3291 {
3292 --end;
3293 if (pcurr != pend) // GAP merge: 2 GAPS to be deleted
3294 {
3295 ++pcurr;
3296 copy_gaps:
3297 --end;
3298 do { *pprev++ = *pcurr++; } while (pcurr < pend);
3299 }
3300 }
3301 }
3302 else
3303 if (*pcurr == pos) // Rightmost bit in the GAP. Border goes left.
3304 {
3305 --(*pcurr);
3306 end += (pcurr == pend);
3307 }
3308 else // Worst case: split current GAP
3309 {
3310 if (*pcurr != bm::gap_max_bits-1) // last gap does not need memmove
3311 ::memmove(pcurr+2, pcurr, (end - curr + 1)*(sizeof(T)));
3312 end += 2;
3313 pcurr[0] = (T)(pos-1);
3314 pcurr[1] = (T)pos;
3315 }
3316
3317 // Set correct length word and last border word
3318 *buf = (T)((*buf & 7) + (end << 3));
3319 buf[end] = bm::gap_max_bits-1;
3320 return end;
3321}
3322
3323/*!
3324 \brief Add new value to the end of GAP buffer.
3325
3326 \param buf - GAP buffer.
3327 \param pos - Index of bit to set.
3328
3329 \return New GAP buffer length.
3330
3331 @ingroup gapfunc
3332*/
3333template<typename T>
3334unsigned gap_add_value(T* buf, unsigned pos) BMNOEXCEPT
3335{
3336 BM_ASSERT(pos < bm::gap_max_bits);
3337
3338 T end = (T)(*buf >> 3);
3339 T curr = end;
3340 T* pcurr = buf + end;
3341 T* pend = pcurr;
3342 T* pprev = pcurr - 1;
3343
3344 // Special case, first bit GAP operation. There is no platform beside it.
3345 // initial flag must be inverted.
3346 if (!pos)
3347 {
3348 *buf ^= 1;
3349 if ( buf[1] ) // We need to insert a 1 bit platform here.
3350 {
3351 ::memmove(&buf[2], &buf[1], (end - 1) * sizeof(gap_word_t));
3352 buf[1] = 0;
3353 ++end;
3354 }
3355 else // Only 1 bit in the GAP. We need to delete the first GAP.
3356 {
3357 pprev = buf + 1; pcurr = pprev + 1;
3358 --end;
3359 do { *pprev++ = *pcurr++; } while (pcurr < pend);
3360 }
3361 }
3362 else if (((unsigned)(*pprev))+1 == pos && (curr > 1) ) // Left border bit
3363 {
3364 ++(*pprev);
3365 if (*pprev == *pcurr) // Curr. GAP to be merged with prev.GAP.
3366 {
3367 --end;
3368 BM_ASSERT(pcurr == pend);
3369 }
3370 }
3371 else if (*pcurr == pos) // Rightmost bit in the GAP. Border goes left.
3372 {
3373 --(*pcurr);
3374 end += (pcurr == pend);
3375 }
3376 else // Worst case we need to split current block.
3377 {
3378 pcurr[0] = (T)(pos-1);
3379 pcurr[1] = (T)pos;
3380 end = (T)(end+2);
3381 }
3382
3383 // Set correct length word.
3384 *buf = (T)((*buf & 7) + (end << 3));
3385 buf[end] = bm::gap_max_bits - 1;
3386 return end;
3387}
3388
3389#ifdef __GNUG__
3390#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
3391#endif
3392
3393
3394/*!
3395 @brief Right shift GAP block by 1 bit
3396 @param buf - block pointer
3397 @param co_flag - carry over from the previous block
3398 @param new_len - output length of the GAP block after the operation
3399
3400 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
3401 @ingroup gapfunc
3402*/
3403template<typename T>
3404bool gap_shift_r1(T* BMRESTRICT buf,
3405 unsigned co_flag, unsigned* BMRESTRICT new_len) BMNOEXCEPT
3406{
3407 BM_ASSERT(new_len);
3408 BM_ASSERT(co_flag <= 1);
3409
3410 bool co, gap_set_flag;
3411 unsigned len = (*buf >> 3);
3412 // 1: increment all GAP values by 1
3413 {
3414 unsigned bitval = *buf & 1;
3415 gap_set_flag = (bitval != co_flag);
3416 if (buf[1] == bm::gap_max_bits-1) // full GAP block
3417 co = bitval;
3418 else
3419 {
3420 unsigned i = 1;
3421 for (; i < len; ++i)
3422 {
3423 buf[i]++;
3424 bitval ^= 1;
3425 } // for i
3426 BM_ASSERT(buf[i] == bm::gap_max_bits-1);
3427 if (buf[i-1] == bm::gap_max_bits-1) // last element shifts out
3428 {
3429 // Set correct length word
3430 --len;
3431 *buf = (T)((*buf & 7) + (len << 3));
3432 }
3433 co = bitval;
3434 }
3435 }
3436 // set bit bit 0 with carry-in flag
3437 unsigned is_set;
3438 if (gap_set_flag)
3439 *new_len = bm::gap_set_value(co_flag, buf, 0, &is_set);
3440 else
3441 *new_len = len;
3442
3443 return co;
3444}
3445
3446/*!
3447 @brief isnert bit into GAP compressed block
3448 @param buf - block pointer
3449 @param pos - insert position
3450 @param value - (0 or 1) - value to set
3451 @param new_len - output length of the GAP block after the operation
3452
3453 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
3454 @ingroup gapfunc
3455*/
3456template<typename T>
3457bool gap_insert(T* BMRESTRICT buf,
3458 unsigned pos, unsigned val, unsigned* BMRESTRICT new_len) BMNOEXCEPT
3459{
3460 BM_ASSERT(new_len);
3461 BM_ASSERT(val <= 1);
3462
3463 bool co, gap_set_flag;
3464 unsigned is_set;
3465 unsigned idx = bm::gap_bfind(buf, pos, &is_set);
3466 BM_ASSERT(is_set <= 1);
3467
3468 gap_set_flag = (val != is_set);
3469 unsigned len = (*buf >> 3);
3470
3471 // 1: increment all GAP values by 1
3472 if (buf[idx] == bm::gap_max_bits-1)
3473 {
3474 co = is_set;
3475 }
3476 else
3477 {
3478 unsigned i = idx;
3479 for (; i < len; ++i)
3480 {
3481 buf[i]++;
3482 is_set ^= 1;
3483 } // for i
3484 BM_ASSERT(buf[i] == bm::gap_max_bits-1);
3485 if (buf[i-1] == bm::gap_max_bits-1) // last element shifts out
3486 {
3487 // Set correct length word
3488 --len;
3489 *buf = (T)((*buf & 7) + (len << 3));
3490 *new_len = len;
3491 }
3492 co = is_set;
3493 }
3494
3495 if (gap_set_flag)
3496 *new_len = bm::gap_set_value(val, buf, pos, &is_set);
3497 else
3498 *new_len = len;
3499
3500 return co;
3501}
3502
3503/*!
3504 @brief Left shift GAP block by 1 bit
3505 @param buf - block pointer
3506 @param co_flag - carry over from the previous block
3507 @param new_len - new length of the block
3508
3509 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
3510 @ingroup gapfunc
3511*/
3512template<typename T>
3513bool gap_shift_l1(T* BMRESTRICT buf,
3514 unsigned co_flag, unsigned* BMRESTRICT new_len) BMNOEXCEPT
3515{
3516 BM_ASSERT(new_len);
3517 BM_ASSERT(co_flag <= 1);
3518
3519 unsigned is_set;
3520
3521 // 1: decrement all GAP values by 1
3522 //
3523 unsigned bitval = *buf & 1;
3524 bool co0 = bitval;
3525
3526 if (!buf[1]) // cannot decrement (corner case)
3527 {
3528 bitval ^= 1;
3529 *new_len = bm::gap_set_value(bitval, buf, 0, &is_set);
3530
3531 BM_ASSERT(is_set);
3532 BM_ASSERT(buf[1]);
3533 BM_ASSERT(bitval == unsigned(*buf & 1u));
3534
3535 if (*new_len == 1)
3536 {
3537 *new_len = bm::gap_set_value(co_flag, buf,
3538 bm::gap_max_bits-1, &is_set);
3539 return co0;
3540 }
3541 }
3542 if (buf[1] != bm::gap_max_bits-1) // full GAP block
3543 {
3544 BM_ASSERT(buf[1]);
3545 unsigned len = (*buf >> 3);
3546 unsigned i = 1;
3547 for (; i < len; ++i)
3548 {
3549 buf[i]--;
3550 bitval ^= 1;
3551 } // for i
3552 BM_ASSERT(buf[i] == bm::gap_max_bits-1);
3553 }
3554 // 2: set last bit position with carry-in flag
3555 //
3556 *new_len = bm::gap_set_value(co_flag, buf, bm::gap_max_bits-1, &is_set);
3557 return co0;
3558}
3559
3560
3561/*!
3562 \brief Convert array to GAP buffer.
3563
3564 \param buf - GAP buffer.
3565 \param arr - array of values to set
3566 \param len - length of the array
3567
3568 \return New GAP buffer length.
3569
3570 @ingroup gapfunc
3571*/
3572
3573template<typename T>
3574unsigned gap_set_array(T* buf, const T* arr, unsigned len) BMNOEXCEPT
3575{
3576 *buf = (T)((*buf & 6u) + (1u << 3)); // gap header setup
3577
3578 T* pcurr = buf + 1;
3579
3580 unsigned i = 0;
3581 T curr = arr[i];
3582 if (curr != 0) // need to add the first gap: (0 to arr[0]-1)
3583 {
3584 *pcurr = (T)(curr - 1);
3585 ++pcurr;
3586 }
3587 else
3588 {
3589 ++(*buf); // GAP starts with 1
3590 }
3591 T prev = curr;
3592 T acc = prev;
3593
3594 for (i = 1; i < len; ++i)
3595 {
3596 curr = arr[i];
3597 if (curr == prev + 1)
3598 {
3599 ++acc;
3600 prev = curr;
3601 }
3602 else
3603 {
3604 *pcurr++ = acc;
3605 acc = curr;
3606 *pcurr++ = (T)(curr-1);
3607 }
3608 prev = curr;
3609 }
3610 *pcurr = acc;
3611 if (acc != bm::gap_max_bits - 1)
3612 {
3613 ++pcurr;
3614 *pcurr = bm::gap_max_bits - 1;
3615 }
3616
3617 unsigned gap_len = unsigned(pcurr - buf);
3618 BM_ASSERT(gap_len == ((gap_len << 3) >> 3));
3619
3620 *buf = (T)((*buf & 7) + (gap_len << 3));
3621 return gap_len+1;
3622}
3623
3624
3625//------------------------------------------------------------------------
3626
3627/**
3628 \brief Compute number of GAPs in bit-array
3629 \param arr - array of BITs
3630 \param len - array length
3631
3632 @ingroup gapfunc
3633*/
3634template<typename T>
3635unsigned bit_array_compute_gaps(const T* arr, unsigned len) BMNOEXCEPT
3636{
3637 unsigned gap_count = 1;
3638 T prev = arr[0];
3639 if (prev > 0)
3640 ++gap_count;
3641 for (unsigned i = 1; i < len; ++i)
3642 {
3643 T curr = arr[i];
3644 if (curr != prev + 1)
3645 {
3646 gap_count += 2;
3647 }
3648 prev = curr;
3649 }
3650 return gap_count;
3651}
3652
3653
3654//------------------------------------------------------------------------
3655
3656/**
3657 \brief Searches for the next 1 bit in the GAP block
3658 \param buf - GAP buffer
3659 \param nbit - bit index to start checking from.
3660 \param prev - returns previously checked value
3661
3662 \return 0 if not found
3663
3664 @ingroup gapfunc
3665*/
3666template<typename T>
3667unsigned gap_block_find(const T* BMRESTRICT buf,
3668 unsigned nbit,
3669 bm::id_t* BMRESTRICT prev) BMNOEXCEPT
3670{
3671 BM_ASSERT(nbit < bm::gap_max_bits);
3672
3673 unsigned bitval;
3674 unsigned gap_idx = bm::gap_bfind(buf, nbit, &bitval);
3675
3676 if (bitval) // positive block.
3677 {
3678 *prev = nbit;
3679 return 1u;
3680 }
3681 unsigned val = buf[gap_idx] + 1;
3682 *prev = val;
3683 return (val != bm::gap_max_bits); // no bug here.
3684}
3685
3686//------------------------------------------------------------------------
3687
3688
3689/*!
3690 \brief Set 1 bit in a block
3691 @ingroup bitfunc
3692*/
3693BMFORCEINLINE
3694void set_bit(unsigned* dest, unsigned bitpos) BMNOEXCEPT
3695{
3696 unsigned nbit = unsigned(bitpos & bm::set_block_mask);
3697 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
3698 nbit &= bm::set_word_mask;
3699 dest[nword] |= unsigned(1u << nbit);
3700}
3701
3702/*!
3703 \brief Set 1 bit in a block
3704 @ingroup bitfunc
3705*/
3706BMFORCEINLINE
3707void clear_bit(unsigned* dest, unsigned bitpos) BMNOEXCEPT
3708{
3709 unsigned nbit = unsigned(bitpos & bm::set_block_mask);
3710 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
3711 nbit &= bm::set_word_mask;
3712 dest[nword] &= ~(unsigned(1u << nbit));
3713}
3714
3715/*!
3716 \brief Test 1 bit in a block
3717
3718 @ingroup bitfunc
3719*/
3720BMFORCEINLINE
3721unsigned test_bit(const unsigned* block, unsigned bitpos) BMNOEXCEPT
3722{
3723 unsigned nbit = unsigned(bitpos & bm::set_block_mask);
3724 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
3725 nbit &= bm::set_word_mask;
3726 return (block[nword] >> nbit) & 1u;
3727}
3728
3729
3730/*!
3731 \brief Sets bits to 1 in the bitblock.
3732 \param dest - Bitset buffer.
3733 \param bitpos - Offset of the start bit.
3734 \param bitcount - number of bits to set.
3735
3736 @ingroup bitfunc
3737*/
3738inline
3739void or_bit_block(unsigned* dest, unsigned bitpos, unsigned bitcount) BMNOEXCEPT
3740{
3741 const unsigned maskFF = ~0u;
3742
3743 dest += unsigned(bitpos >> bm::set_word_shift); // nword
3744 bitpos &= bm::set_word_mask;
3745
3746 if (bitcount == 1u) // special case (only 1 bit to set)
3747 {
3748 *dest |= (1u << bitpos);
3749 return;
3750 }
3751
3752 if (bitpos) // starting pos is not aligned
3753 {
3754 unsigned mask_r = maskFF << bitpos;
3755 unsigned right_margin = bitpos + bitcount;
3756 if (right_margin < 32)
3757 {
3758 *dest |= (maskFF >> (32 - right_margin)) & mask_r;
3759 return;
3760 }
3761 *dest++ |= mask_r;
3762 bitcount -= 32 - bitpos;
3763 }
3764 for ( ;bitcount >= 64; bitcount-=64, dest+=2)
3765 dest[0] = dest[1] = maskFF;
3766 if (bitcount >= 32)
3767 {
3768 *dest++ = maskFF; bitcount -= 32;
3769 }
3770 if (bitcount)
3771 {
3772 *dest |= maskFF >> (32 - bitcount);
3773 }
3774}
3775
3776
3777/*!
3778 \brief SUB (AND NOT) bit interval to 1 in the bitblock.
3779 \param dest - Bitset buffer.
3780 \param bitpos - Offset of the start bit.
3781 \param bitcount - number of bits to set.
3782
3783 @ingroup bitfunc
3784*/
3785inline
3786void sub_bit_block(unsigned* dest, unsigned bitpos, unsigned bitcount) BMNOEXCEPT
3787{
3788 const unsigned maskFF = ~0u;
3789
3790 dest += unsigned(bitpos >> bm::set_word_shift); // nword
3791 bitpos &= bm::set_word_mask;
3792
3793 if (bitcount == 1u) // special case (only 1 bit to set)
3794 {
3795 *dest &= ~(1u << bitpos);
3796 return;
3797 }
3798
3799 if (bitpos) // starting pos is not aligned
3800 {
3801 unsigned mask_r = maskFF << bitpos;
3802 unsigned right_margin = bitpos + bitcount;
3803 if (right_margin < 32)
3804 {
3805 *dest &= ~((maskFF >> (32 - right_margin)) & mask_r);
3806 return;
3807 }
3808 *dest++ &= ~~mask_r;
3809 bitcount -= 32 - bitpos;
3810 }
3811 for ( ;bitcount >= 64; bitcount-=64, dest+=2)
3812 dest[0] = dest[1] = 0u;
3813 if (bitcount >= 32)
3814 {
3815 *dest++ = 0u; bitcount -= 32;
3816 }
3817 if (bitcount)
3818 {
3819 *dest &= ~(maskFF >> (32 - bitcount));
3820 }
3821}
3822
3823
3824
3825/*!
3826 \brief XOR bit interval to 1 in the bitblock.
3827 \param dest - Bitset buffer.
3828 \param bitpos - Offset of the start bit.
3829 \param bitcount - number of bits to set.
3830
3831 @ingroup bitfunc
3832*/
3833inline void xor_bit_block(unsigned* dest,
3834 unsigned bitpos,
3835 unsigned bitcount) BMNOEXCEPT
3836{
3837 unsigned nbit = unsigned(bitpos & bm::set_block_mask);
3838 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
3839 nbit &= bm::set_word_mask;
3840
3841 bm::word_t* word = dest + nword;
3842
3843 if (bitcount == 1) // special case (only 1 bit to set)
3844 {
3845 *word ^= unsigned(1 << nbit);
3846 return;
3847 }
3848
3849 if (nbit) // starting position is not aligned
3850 {
3851 unsigned right_margin = nbit + bitcount;
3852
3853 // here we checking if we setting bits only in the current
3854 // word. Example: 00111000000000000000000000000000 (32 bits word)
3855
3856 if (right_margin < 32)
3857 {
3858 unsigned mask_r = bm::mask_r_u32(nbit);
3859 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(right_margin-1);
3860 unsigned mask = mask_r & mask_l;
3861 *word ^= mask;
3862 return;
3863 }
3864 *word ^= bm::mask_r_u32(nbit);
3865 bitcount -= 32 - nbit;
3866 ++word;
3867 }
3868 for ( ;bitcount >= 64; bitcount-=64, word+=2)
3869 {
3870 word[0] ^= ~0u; word[1] ^= ~0u;
3871 }
3872 if (bitcount >= 32)
3873 {
3874 *word++ ^= ~0u; bitcount -= 32;
3875 }
3876 if (bitcount)
3877 {
3878 *word ^= bm::mask_l_u32(bitcount-1);
3879 }
3880}
3881
3882
3883/*!
3884 \brief SUB (AND NOT) GAP block to bitblock.
3885 \param dest - bitblock buffer pointer.
3886 \param pcurr - GAP buffer pointer.
3887
3888 @ingroup gapfunc
3889*/
3890template<typename T>
3891void gap_sub_to_bitset(unsigned* BMRESTRICT dest,
3892 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr) BMNOEXCEPT
3893{
3894 BM_ASSERT(dest && pcurr);
3895
3896 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
3897 if (*pcurr & 1) // Starts with 1
3898 {
3899 bm::sub_bit_block(dest, 0, 1 + pcurr[1]);
3900 ++pcurr;
3901 }
3902 for (pcurr += 2; pcurr <= pend; pcurr += 2)
3903 {
3904 BM_ASSERT(*pcurr > pcurr[-1]);
3905 bm::sub_bit_block(dest, 1 + pcurr[-1], *pcurr - pcurr[-1]);
3906 }
3907}
3908
3909
3910/*!
3911 \brief SUB (AND NOT) GAP block to bitblock with digest assist
3912
3913 \param dest - bitblock buffer pointer.
3914 \param pcurr - GAP buffer pointer.
3915 \param digest0 - digest of 0 strides inside bit block
3916
3917 @ingroup gapfunc
3918*/
3919template<typename T>
3920void gap_sub_to_bitset(unsigned* BMRESTRICT dest,
3921 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr, bm::id64_t digest0) BMNOEXCEPT
3922{
3923 BM_ASSERT(dest && pcurr);
3924
3925 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
3926 if (*pcurr & 1) // Starts with 1
3927 {
3928 bool all_zero = bm::check_zero_digest(digest0, 0, pcurr[1]);
3929 if (!all_zero)
3930 bm::sub_bit_block(dest, 0, pcurr[1] + 1); // (not AND) - SUB [0] gaps
3931 pcurr += 3;
3932 }
3933 else
3934 pcurr += 2;
3935
3936 // wind forward to digest start
3937 {
3938 unsigned tz = bm::count_trailing_zeros_u64(digest0);
3939 unsigned start_pos = tz << set_block_digest_pos_shift;
3940 for (; pcurr <= pend; pcurr += 2) // now we are in GAP "0"
3941 {
3942 if (*pcurr >= start_pos)
3943 break;
3944 }
3945 }
3946
3947 unsigned lz = bm::count_leading_zeros_u64(digest0);
3948 unsigned stop_pos = (64u - lz) << set_block_digest_pos_shift;
3949
3950 unsigned bc, pos;
3951 T prev;
3952 for (; pcurr <= pend; pcurr += 2) // now we are in GAP "1" again
3953 {
3954 BM_ASSERT(*pcurr > *(pcurr-1));
3955 prev = pcurr[-1];
3956 bc = *pcurr - prev;
3957 pos = 1u + prev;
3958
3959 bool all_zero = bm::check_zero_digest(digest0, prev, *pcurr);
3960 if (!all_zero)
3961 bm::sub_bit_block(dest, pos, bc);
3962
3963 if (pos > stop_pos)
3964 break; // early break is possible based on digest tail
3965
3966 } // for
3967}
3968
3969
3970
3971/*!
3972 \brief XOR GAP block to bitblock.
3973 \param dest - bitblock buffer pointer.
3974 \param pcurr - GAP buffer pointer.
3975
3976 @ingroup gapfunc
3977*/
3978template<typename T>
3979void gap_xor_to_bitset(unsigned* BMRESTRICT dest,
3980 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr) BMNOEXCEPT
3981{
3982 BM_ASSERT(dest && pcurr);
3983
3984 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
3985 if (*pcurr & 1) // Starts with 1
3986 {
3987 bm::xor_bit_block(dest, 0, 1 + pcurr[1]);
3988 ++pcurr;
3989 }
3990 for (pcurr += 2; pcurr <= pend; pcurr += 2)
3991 {
3992 BM_ASSERT(*pcurr > pcurr[-1]);
3993 bm::xor_bit_block(dest, 1 + pcurr[-1], *pcurr - pcurr[-1]);
3994 }
3995}
3996
3997
3998/*!
3999 \brief Adds(OR) GAP block to bitblock.
4000 \param dest - bitblock buffer pointer.
4001 \param pcurr - GAP buffer pointer.
4002 \param len - gap length
4003
4004 @ingroup gapfunc
4005*/
4006template<typename T>
4007void gap_add_to_bitset(unsigned* BMRESTRICT dest,
4008 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr, unsigned len) BMNOEXCEPT
4009{
4010 BM_ASSERT(dest && pcurr);
4011
4012 const T* pend = pcurr + len;
4013 BM_ASSERT(*pend == 65535);
4014 if (*pcurr & 1) // Starts with 1
4015 {
4016 bm::or_bit_block(dest, 0, 1 + pcurr[1]);
4017 pcurr += 3;
4018 }
4019 else
4020 pcurr += 2;
4021
4022 unsigned bc, pos;
4023 for (; pcurr <= pend; )
4024 {
4025 BM_ASSERT(*pcurr > pcurr[-1]);
4026 pos = 1u + pcurr[-1];
4027 bc = *pcurr - pcurr[-1];
4028 pcurr += 2;
4029 bm::or_bit_block(dest, pos, bc);
4030 }
4031}
4032
4033
4034/*!
4035 \brief Adds(OR) GAP block to bitblock.
4036 \param dest - bitblock buffer pointer.
4037 \param pcurr - GAP buffer pointer.
4038
4039 @ingroup gapfunc
4040*/
4041template<typename T>
4042void gap_add_to_bitset(unsigned* BMRESTRICT dest,
4043 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr) BMNOEXCEPT
4044{
4045 unsigned len = (*pcurr >> 3);
4046 gap_add_to_bitset(dest, pcurr, len);
4047}
4048
4049
4050/*!
4051 \brief ANDs GAP block to bitblock.
4052 \param dest - bitblock buffer pointer.
4053 \param pcurr - GAP buffer pointer.
4054
4055 @ingroup gapfunc
4056*/
4057template<typename T>
4058void gap_and_to_bitset(unsigned* BMRESTRICT dest,
4059 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr) BMNOEXCEPT
4060{
4061 BM_ASSERT(dest && pcurr);
4062
4063 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4064 if (!(*pcurr & 1) ) // Starts with 0
4065 {
4066 bm::sub_bit_block(dest, 0, pcurr[1] + 1); // (not AND) - SUB [0] gaps
4067 pcurr += 3;
4068 }
4069 else
4070 pcurr += 2;
4071
4072 unsigned bc, pos;
4073 for (; pcurr <= pend; ) // now we are in GAP "0" again
4074 {
4075 BM_ASSERT(*pcurr > *(pcurr-1));
4076 pos = 1u + pcurr[-1];
4077 bc = *pcurr - pcurr[-1];
4078 pcurr += 2;
4079 bm::sub_bit_block(dest, pos, bc);
4080 }
4081}
4082
4083
4084/*!
4085 \brief ANDs GAP block to bitblock with digest assist
4086 \param dest - bitblock buffer pointer.
4087 \param pcurr - GAP buffer pointer.
4088 \param digest0 - digest of 0 strides for the destination
4089
4090 @ingroup gapfunc
4091*/
4092template<typename T>
4093void gap_and_to_bitset(unsigned* BMRESTRICT dest,
4094 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr, bm::id64_t digest0) BMNOEXCEPT
4095{
4096 BM_ASSERT(dest && pcurr);
4097 if (!digest0)
4098 return;
4099
4100 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4101 if (!(*pcurr & 1) ) // Starts with 0
4102 {
4103 bool all_zero = bm::check_zero_digest(digest0, 0, pcurr[1]);
4104 if (!all_zero)
4105 bm::sub_bit_block(dest, 0, pcurr[1] + 1); // (not AND) - SUB [0] gaps
4106 pcurr += 3;
4107 }
4108 else
4109 pcurr += 2;
4110
4111 // wind forward to digest start
4112 {
4113 unsigned tz = bm::count_trailing_zeros_u64(digest0);
4114 unsigned start_pos = tz << set_block_digest_pos_shift;
4115 for (; pcurr <= pend; pcurr += 2) // now we are in GAP "0"
4116 {
4117 if (*pcurr >= start_pos)
4118 break;
4119 }
4120 }
4121
4122 unsigned lz = bm::count_leading_zeros_u64(digest0);
4123 unsigned stop_pos = (64u - lz) << set_block_digest_pos_shift;
4124
4125 unsigned bc, pos;
4126 T prev;
4127 for (; pcurr <= pend; pcurr += 2) // now we are in GAP "0" again
4128 {
4129 BM_ASSERT(*pcurr > *(pcurr-1));
4130
4131 prev = pcurr[-1];
4132 bc = *pcurr - prev;
4133 pos = 1u + prev;
4134
4135 bool all_zero = bm::check_zero_digest(digest0, prev, *pcurr);
4136 if (!all_zero)
4137 bm::sub_bit_block(dest, pos, bc);
4138
4139 if (pos > stop_pos) // early break is possible based on digest tail
4140 break;
4141
4142 } // for
4143}
4144
4145
4146/*!
4147 \brief Compute bitcount of bit block AND masked by GAP block
4148 \param block - bitblock buffer pointer
4149 \param pcurr - GAP buffer pointer
4150 \return bitcount - cardinality of the AND product
4151
4152 @ingroup gapfunc
4153*/
4154template<typename T>
4155bm::id_t gap_bitset_and_count(const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4156 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr) BMNOEXCEPT
4157{
4158 BM_ASSERT(block);
4159 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4160 bm::id_t count = 0;
4161 if (*pcurr & 1) // Starts with 1
4162 {
4163 count += bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block, 0, pcurr[1]);
4164 ++pcurr;
4165 }
4166 for (pcurr +=2 ;pcurr <= pend; pcurr += 2)
4167 {
4168 count += bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block, pcurr[-1]+1, *pcurr);
4169 }
4170 return count;
4171}
4172
4173
4174/*!
4175 \brief Bitcount test of bit block AND masked by GAP block.
4176 \param block - bitblock buffer pointer
4177 \param pcurr - GAP buffer pointer
4178 \return non-zero value if AND produces any result
4179
4180 @ingroup gapfunc
4181*/
4182template<typename T>
4183bm::id_t gap_bitset_and_any(const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4184 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr) BMNOEXCEPT
4185{
4186 BM_ASSERT(block);
4187
4188 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4189 bm::id_t count = 0;
4190 if (*pcurr & 1) // Starts with 1
4191 {
4192 count = bm::bit_block_any_range(block, 0, pcurr[1]);
4193 ++pcurr;
4194 }
4195 for (pcurr +=2 ;!count && pcurr <= pend; pcurr += 2)
4196 {
4197 count = bm::bit_block_any_range(block, pcurr[-1]+1, *pcurr);
4198 }
4199 return count;
4200}
4201
4202
4203
4204/*!
4205 \brief Compute bitcount of bit block SUB masked by GAP block.
4206 \param block - bitblock buffer pointer.
4207 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
4208 \return bit-count result of AND NOT operation
4209
4210 @ingroup gapfunc
4211*/
4212template<typename T>
4213bm::id_t gap_bitset_sub_count(const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4214 const T* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
4215{
4216 BM_ASSERT(block);
4217
4218 const T* pcurr = buf;
4219 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4220 ++pcurr;
4221
4222 bm::id_t count = 0;
4223
4224 if (!(*buf & 1)) // Starts with 0
4225 {
4226 count += bit_block_calc_count_range(block, 0, *pcurr);
4227 ++pcurr;
4228 }
4229 ++pcurr; // now we are in GAP "0" again
4230
4231 for (;pcurr <= pend; pcurr+=2)
4232 {
4233 count += bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block, *(pcurr-1)+1, *pcurr);
4234 }
4235 return count;
4236}
4237
4238
4239/*!
4240 \brief Compute bitcount test of bit block SUB masked by GAP block
4241 \param block - bitblock buffer pointer
4242 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer
4243 \return non-zero value if AND NOT produces any 1 bits
4244
4245 @ingroup gapfunc
4246*/
4247template<typename T>
4248bm::id_t gap_bitset_sub_any(const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4249 const T* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
4250{
4251 BM_ASSERT(block);
4252
4253 const T* pcurr = buf;
4254 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4255 ++pcurr;
4256
4257 bm::id_t count = 0;
4258
4259 if (!(*buf & 1)) // Starts with 0
4260 {
4261 count += bit_block_any_range(block, 0, *pcurr);
4262 if (count)
4263 return count;
4264 ++pcurr;
4265 }
4266 ++pcurr; // now we are in GAP "0" again
4267
4268 for (; !count && pcurr <= pend; pcurr+=2)
4269 {
4270 count += bm::bit_block_any_range(block, *(pcurr-1)+1, *pcurr);
4271 }
4272 return count;
4273}
4274
4275
4276
4277/*!
4278 \brief Compute bitcount of bit block XOR masked by GAP block
4279 \param block - bitblock buffer pointer
4280 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer
4281 \return bit count value of XOR operation
4282
4283 @ingroup gapfunc
4284*/
4285template<typename T>
4286bm::id_t gap_bitset_xor_count(const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4287 const T* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
4288{
4289 BM_ASSERT(block);
4290
4291 const T* pcurr = buf;
4292 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4293 ++pcurr;
4294
4295 unsigned bitval = *buf & 1;
4296
4297 bm::id_t count = bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block, 0, *pcurr);
4298 if (bitval)
4299 {
4300 count = *pcurr + 1 - count;
4301 }
4302
4303 for (bitval^=1, ++pcurr; pcurr <= pend; bitval^=1, ++pcurr)
4304 {
4305 T prev = (T)(*(pcurr-1)+1);
4306 bm::id_t c = bit_block_calc_count_range(block, prev, *pcurr);
4307
4308 if (bitval) // 1 gap; means Result = Total_Bits - BitCount;
4309 c = (*pcurr - prev + 1) - c;
4310 count += c;
4311 }
4312 return count;
4313}
4314
4315/*!
4316 \brief Compute bitcount test of bit block XOR masked by GAP block.
4317 \param block - bitblock buffer pointer
4318 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer
4319 \return non-zero value if XOR returns anything
4320
4321 @ingroup gapfunc
4322*/
4323template<typename T>
4324bm::id_t gap_bitset_xor_any(const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4325 const T* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
4326{
4327 BM_ASSERT(block);
4328
4329 const T* pcurr = buf;
4330 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4331 ++pcurr;
4332
4333 unsigned bitval = *buf & 1;
4334
4335 bm::id_t count = bit_block_any_range(block, 0, *pcurr);
4336 if (bitval)
4337 count = *pcurr + 1 - count;
4338
4339 for (bitval^=1, ++pcurr; !count && pcurr <= pend; bitval^=1, ++pcurr)
4340 {
4341 T prev = (T)(*(pcurr-1)+1);
4342 bm::id_t c = bit_block_any_range(block, prev, *pcurr);
4343
4344 if (bitval) // 1 gap; means Result = Total_Bits - BitCount;
4345 c = (*pcurr - prev + 1) - c;
4346 count += c;
4347 }
4348 return count;
4349}
4350
4351
4352
4353/*!
4354 \brief Compute bitcount of bit block OR masked by GAP block.
4355 \param block - bitblock buffer pointer.
4356 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
4357 \return bit count of OR
4358
4359 @ingroup gapfunc
4360*/
4361template<typename T>
4362bm::id_t gap_bitset_or_count(const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4363 const T* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
4364{
4365 BM_ASSERT(block);
4366 const T* pcurr = buf;
4367 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4368 ++pcurr;
4369
4370 unsigned bitval = *buf & 1;
4371
4372 bm::id_t count = bitval ? *pcurr + 1
4373 : bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block, 0, *pcurr);
4374 for (bitval^=1, ++pcurr; pcurr <= pend; bitval^=1, ++pcurr)
4375 {
4376 T prev = (T)(*(pcurr-1)+1);
4377 bm::id_t c =
4378 bitval ? (*pcurr - prev + 1)
4379 : bm::bit_block_calc_count_range(block, prev, *pcurr);
4380 count += c;
4381 }
4382 return count;
4383}
4384
4385/*!
4386 \brief Compute bitcount test of bit block OR masked by GAP block
4387 \param block - bitblock buffer pointer
4388 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer
4389 \return non zero value if union (OR) returns anything
4390
4391 @ingroup gapfunc
4392*/
4393template<typename T>
4394bm::id_t gap_bitset_or_any(const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4395 const T* BMRESTRICT buf) BMNOEXCEPT
4396{
4397 bool b = !bm::gap_is_all_zero(buf) ||
4398 !bm::bit_is_all_zero(block);
4399 return b;
4400}
4401
4402
4403
4404/*!
4405 \brief Bitblock memset operation.
4406
4407 \param dst - destination block.
4408 \param value - value to set.
4409
4410 @ingroup bitfunc
4411*/
4412inline
4413void bit_block_set(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst, bm::word_t value) BMNOEXCEPT
4414{
4415#ifdef BMVECTOPT
4416 VECT_SET_BLOCK(dst, value);
4417#else
4418 ::memset(dst, int(value), bm::set_block_size * sizeof(bm::word_t));
4419#endif
4420}
4421
4422
4423/*!
4424 \brief GAP block to bitblock conversion.
4425 \param dest - bitblock buffer pointer.
4426 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
4427 \param len - GAP length
4428
4429 @ingroup gapfunc
4430*/
4431template<typename T>
4432void gap_convert_to_bitset(unsigned* BMRESTRICT dest,
4433 const T* BMRESTRICT buf,
4434 unsigned len=0) BMNOEXCEPT
4435{
4436 bm::bit_block_set(dest, 0);
4437 if (!len)
4438 len = bm::gap_length(buf)-1;
4439 bm::gap_add_to_bitset(dest, buf, len);
4440}
4441
4442
4443
4444/*!
4445 \brief Smart GAP block to bitblock conversion.
4446
4447 Checks if GAP block is ALL-ZERO or ALL-ON. In those cases returns
4448 pointer on special static bitblocks.
4449
4450 \param dest - bitblock buffer pointer.
4451 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
4452 \param set_max - max possible bitset length
4453
4454 @ingroup gapfunc
4455*/
4456template<typename T>
4457unsigned* gap_convert_to_bitset_smart(unsigned* BMRESTRICT dest,
4458 const T* BMRESTRICT buf,
4459 id_t set_max) BMNOEXCEPT
4460{
4461 if (buf[1] == set_max - 1)
4462 return (buf[0] & 1) ? FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR : 0;
4463 bm::gap_convert_to_bitset(dest, buf);
4464 return dest;
4465}
4466
4467
4468/*!
4469 \brief Calculates sum of all words in GAP block. (For debugging purposes)
4470 \note For debugging and testing ONLY.
4471 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
4472 \return Sum of all words.
4473
4474 @ingroup gapfunc
4475 @internal
4476*/
4477template<typename T>
4478unsigned gap_control_sum(const T* buf) BMNOEXCEPT
4479{
4480 unsigned end = *buf >> 3;
4481
4482 const T* pcurr = buf;
4483 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4484 ++pcurr;
4485
4486 if (*buf & 1) // Starts with 1
4487 {
4488 ++pcurr;
4489 }
4490 ++pcurr; // now we are in GAP "1" again
4491 while (pcurr <= pend)
4492 {
4493 BM_ASSERT(*pcurr > *(pcurr-1));
4494 pcurr += 2;
4495 }
4496 return buf[end];
4497}
4498
4499
4500/*!
4501 \brief Sets all bits to 0 or 1 (GAP)
4502 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
4503 \param set_max - max possible bitset length
4504 \param value - value to set
4505
4506 @ingroup gapfunc
4507*/
4508template<class T>
4509void gap_set_all(T* buf, unsigned set_max, unsigned value) BMNOEXCEPT
4510{
4511 BM_ASSERT(value == 0 || value == 1);
4512 *buf = (T)((*buf & 6u) + (1u << 3) + value);
4513 *(++buf) = (T)(set_max - 1);
4514}
4515
4516
4517/*!
4518 \brief Init gap block so it has block in it (can be whole block)
4519 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
4520 \param from - one block start
4521 \param to - one block end
4522 \param value - (block value)1 or 0
4523
4524 @ingroup gapfunc
4525*/
4526template<class T>
4527void gap_init_range_block(T* buf,
4528 T from,
4529 T to,
4530 T value) BMNOEXCEPT
4531{
4532 BM_ASSERT(value == 0 || value == 1);
4533 const unsigned set_max = bm::bits_in_block;
4534
4535 unsigned gap_len;
4536 if (from == 0)
4537 {
4538 if (to == set_max - 1)
4539 {
4540 bm::gap_set_all(buf, set_max, value);
4541 }
4542 else
4543 {
4544 gap_len = 2;
4545 buf[1] = (T)to;
4546 buf[2] = (T)(set_max - 1);
4547 buf[0] = (T)((*buf & 6u) + (gap_len << 3) + value);
4548 }
4549 return;
4550 }
4551 // from != 0
4552
4553 value = !value;
4554 if (to == set_max - 1)
4555 {
4556 gap_len = 2;
4557 buf[1] = (T)(from - 1);
4558 buf[2] = (T)(set_max - 1);
4559 }
4560 else
4561 {
4562 gap_len = 3;
4563 buf[1] = (T) (from - 1);
4564 buf[2] = (T) to;
4565 buf[3] = (T)(set_max - 1);
4566 }
4567 buf[0] = (T)((*buf & 6u) + (gap_len << 3) + value);
4568}
4569
4570
4571/*!
4572 \brief Inverts all bits in the GAP buffer.
4573 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
4574
4575 @ingroup gapfunc
4576*/
4577template<typename T> void gap_invert(T* buf) BMNOEXCEPT
4578{
4579 *buf ^= 1;
4580}
4581
4582
4583#ifdef __GNUG__
4584#pragma GCC diagnostic push
4585#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion"
4586#endif
4587
4588/*!
4589 \brief Sets GAP block capacity level.
4590 \param buf - GAP buffer pointer.
4591 \param level new GAP block capacity level.
4592
4593 @ingroup gapfunc
4594*/
4595template<typename T>
4596void set_gap_level(T* buf, int level) BMNOEXCEPT
4597{
4598 BM_ASSERT(level >= 0);
4599 BM_ASSERT(unsigned(level) < bm::gap_levels);
4600
4601 *buf = (T)(((level & 3) << 1) | (*buf & 1) | (*buf & ~7));
4602}
4603#ifdef __GNUG__
4604#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
4605#endif
4606
4607
4608
4609/*!
4610 \brief Calculates GAP block capacity level.
4611 \param len - GAP buffer length.
4612 \param glevel_len - GAP lengths table
4613 \return GAP block capacity level.
4614 -1 if block does not fit any level.
4615 @ingroup gapfunc
4616*/
4617template<typename T>
4618int gap_calc_level(unsigned len, const T* glevel_len) BMNOEXCEPT
4619{
4620 if (len <= unsigned(glevel_len[0]-4)) return 0;
4621 if (len <= unsigned(glevel_len[1]-4)) return 1;
4622 if (len <= unsigned(glevel_len[2]-4)) return 2;
4623 if (len <= unsigned(glevel_len[3]-4)) return 3;
4624
4625 BM_ASSERT(bm::gap_levels == 4);
4626 return -1;
4627}
4628
4629/*! @brief Returns number of free elements in GAP block array.
4630 Difference between GAP block capacity on this level and actual GAP length.
4631
4632 @param buf - GAP buffer pointer
4633 @param glevel_len - GAP lengths table
4634
4635 @return Number of free GAP elements
4636 @ingroup gapfunc
4637*/
4638template<typename T>
4639inline unsigned gap_free_elements(const T* BMRESTRICT buf,
4640 const T* BMRESTRICT glevel_len) BMNOEXCEPT
4641{
4642 unsigned len = bm::gap_length(buf);
4643 unsigned capacity = bm::gap_capacity(buf, glevel_len);
4644 return capacity - len;
4645}
4646
4647/*!
4648 \brief Lexicographical comparison of BIT buffers.
4649 \param buf1 - First buffer pointer.
4650 \param buf2 - Second buffer pointer.
4651 \param len - Buffer length in elements (T).
4652 \return <0 - less, =0 - equal, >0 - greater.
4653
4654 @ingroup bitfunc
4655*/
4656template<typename T>
4657int bitcmp(const T* buf1, const T* buf2, unsigned len) BMNOEXCEPT
4658{
4659 BM_ASSERT(len);
4660 const T* pend1 = buf1 + len;
4661 do
4662 {
4663 T w1 = *buf1++;
4664 T w2 = *buf2++;
4665 T diff = w1 ^ w2;
4666 if (diff)
4667 return (w1 & diff & -diff) ? 1 : -1;
4668 } while (buf1 < pend1);
4669 return 0;
4670}
4671
4672/*!
4673 \brief Find first bit which is different between two bit-blocks
4674 \param blk1 - block 1
4675 \param blk2 - block 2
4676 \param pos - out - position of difference (undefined if blocks are equal)
4677 \return true if difference was found
4678
4679 @ingroup bitfunc
4680*/
4681inline
4682bool bit_find_first_diff(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT blk1,
4683 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT blk2,
4684 unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
4685{
4686 BM_ASSERT(blk1 && blk2 && pos);
4687#ifdef VECT_BIT_FIND_DIFF
4688 bool f = VECT_BIT_FIND_DIFF(blk1, blk2, pos);
4689 return f;
4690#else
4691 #ifdef BM64OPT
4692 BM_ASSERT(sizeof(bm::wordop_t) == 8);
4693
4694 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT b1_u =
4695 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(blk1);
4696 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT b2_u =
4697 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(blk2);
4698
4699 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bm::set_block_size/2; ++i)
4700 {
4701 bm::wordop_t w1 = b1_u->w64[i];
4702 bm::wordop_t w2 = b2_u->w64[i];
4703 bm::wordop_t diff = w1 ^ w2;
4704 if (diff)
4705 {
4706 unsigned idx = bm::count_trailing_zeros_u64(diff);
4707 *pos = unsigned(idx + (i * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::wordop_t))));
4708 return true;
4709 }
4710 } // for
4711 #else
4712 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bm::set_block_size; ++i)
4713 {
4714 bm::word_t w1 = blk1[i]; bm::word_t w2 = blk2[i];
4715 bm::word_t diff = w1 ^ w2;
4716 if (diff)
4717 {
4718 unsigned idx = bm::bit_scan_forward32(diff); // trailing zeros
4719 *pos = unsigned(idx + (i * 8u * sizeof(bm::word_t)));
4720 return true;
4721 }
4722 } // for
4723 #endif
4724 return false;
4725#endif
4726}
4727
4728
4729//#ifndef BMAVX2OPT
4730
4731/*!
4732 \brief Converts bit block to GAP.
4733 \param dest - Destinatio GAP buffer.
4734 \param block - Source bitblock buffer.
4735 \param dest_len - length of the destination buffer.
4736 \return New length of GAP block or 0 if conversion failed
4737 (insufficicent space).
4738
4739 @ingroup gapfunc
4740*/
4741inline
4742unsigned bit_block_to_gap(gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT dest,
4743 const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4744 unsigned dest_len) BMNOEXCEPT
4745{
4746 const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block_end = block + bm::set_block_size;
4747 gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT pcurr = dest;
4748 gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT end = dest + dest_len; (void)end;
4749
4750 unsigned bitval = (*block) & 1u;
4751 *pcurr++ = bm::gap_word_t(bitval);
4752 *pcurr = 0;
4753 unsigned bit_idx = 0;
4754
4755 do
4756 {
4757 unsigned val = *block;
4758 while (!val || val == ~0u)
4759 {
4760 if (bitval != unsigned(bool(val)))
4761 {
4762 *pcurr++ = (gap_word_t)(bit_idx-1);
4763 bitval ^= 1u;
4764 BM_ASSERT((pcurr-1) == (dest+1) || *(pcurr-1) > *(pcurr-2));
4765 BM_ASSERT(pcurr != end);
4766 }
4767 bit_idx += unsigned(sizeof(*block) * 8);
4768 if (++block >= block_end)
4769 goto complete;
4770 val = *block;
4771 } // while
4772
4773 // process "0100011" word
4774 //
4775 unsigned bits_consumed = 0;
4776 do
4777 {
4778 unsigned tz = 1u;
4779 if (bitval != (val & 1u))
4780 {
4781 *pcurr++ = (gap_word_t)(bit_idx-1);
4782 bitval ^= 1u;
4783 BM_ASSERT((pcurr-1) == (dest+1) || *(pcurr-1) > *(pcurr-2));
4784 BM_ASSERT(pcurr != end);
4785 }
4786 else // match, find the next idx
4787 {
4788 tz = bm::bit_scan_forward32(bitval ? ~val : val);
4789 // possible alternative:
4790 // tz = bm::count_trailing_zeros(bitval ? ~val : val);
4791 }
4792
4793 bits_consumed += tz;
4794 bit_idx += tz;
4795 val >>= tz;
4796
4797 if (!val)
4798 {
4799 if (bits_consumed < 32u)
4800 {
4801 *pcurr++ = (gap_word_t)(bit_idx-1);
4802 bitval ^= 1u;
4803 bit_idx += 32u - bits_consumed;
4804 BM_ASSERT((pcurr-1) == (dest+1) || *(pcurr-1) > *(pcurr-2));
4805 BM_ASSERT(pcurr != end);
4806 }
4807 break;
4808 }
4809 } while (1);
4810
4811 } while(++block < block_end);
4812
4813complete:
4814 *pcurr = (gap_word_t)(bit_idx-1);
4815 unsigned len = (unsigned)(pcurr - dest);
4816 *dest = (gap_word_t)((*dest & 7) + (len << 3));
4817 return len;
4818}
4819//#endif
4820
4821/**
4822 Convert bit block to GAP representation
4823 @internal
4824 @ingroup bitfunc
4825*/
4826inline
4827unsigned bit_to_gap(gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT dest,
4828 const unsigned* BMRESTRICT block,
4829 unsigned dest_len) BMNOEXCEPT
4830{
4831#if defined(VECT_BIT_TO_GAP)
4832 return VECT_BIT_TO_GAP(dest, block, dest_len);
4833#else
4834 return bm::bit_block_to_gap(dest, block, dest_len);
4835#endif
4836}
4837
4838
4839/*!
4840 \brief Iterate gap block as delta-bits with a functor
4841 @ingroup gapfunc
4842*/
4843template<class T, class F>
4844void for_each_gap_dbit(const T* buf, F& func)
4845{
4846 const T* pcurr = buf;
4847 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4848
4849 ++pcurr;
4850
4851 unsigned prev = 0;
4852 unsigned first_inc;
4853
4854 if (*buf & 1)
4855 {
4856 first_inc = 0;
4857 unsigned to = *pcurr;
4858 for (unsigned i = 0; i <= to; ++i)
4859 {
4860 func(1);
4861 }
4862 prev = to;
4863 ++pcurr;
4864 }
4865 else
4866 {
4867 first_inc = 1;
4868 }
4869 ++pcurr; // set GAP to 1
4870
4871 while (pcurr <= pend)
4872 {
4873 unsigned from = *(pcurr-1)+1;
4874 unsigned to = *pcurr;
4875 if (first_inc)
4876 {
4877 func(from - prev + first_inc);
4878 first_inc = 0;
4879 }
4880 else
4881 {
4882 func(from - prev);
4883 }
4884
4885 for (unsigned i = from+1; i <= to; ++i)
4886 {
4887 func(1);
4888 }
4889 prev = to;
4890 pcurr += 2; // jump to the next positive GAP
4891 }
4892}
4893
4894/*!
4895 \brief Convert gap block into array of ints corresponding to 1 bits
4896 @ingroup gapfunc
4897*/
4898template<typename D, typename T>
4899D gap_convert_to_arr(D* BMRESTRICT dest,
4900 const T* BMRESTRICT buf,
4901 unsigned dest_len,
4902 bool invert = false) BMNOEXCEPT
4903{
4904 const T* BMRESTRICT pcurr = buf;
4905 const T* pend = pcurr + (*pcurr >> 3);
4906
4907 D* BMRESTRICT dest_curr = dest;
4908 ++pcurr;
4909
4910 int bitval = (*buf) & 1;
4911 if (invert)
4912 bitval = !bitval; // invert the GAP buffer
4913
4914 if (bitval)
4915 {
4916 if (unsigned(*pcurr + 1) >= dest_len)
4917 return 0; // insufficient space
4918 dest_len -= *pcurr;
4919 T to = *pcurr;
4920 for (T i = 0; ;++i)
4921 {
4922 *dest_curr++ = i;
4923 if (i == to) break;
4924 }
4925 ++pcurr;
4926 }
4927 ++pcurr; // set GAP to 1
4928
4929 while (pcurr <= pend)
4930 {
4931 unsigned pending = *pcurr - *(pcurr-1);
4932 if (pending >= dest_len)
4933 return 0;
4934 dest_len -= pending;
4935 T from = (T)(*(pcurr-1)+1);
4936 T to = *pcurr;
4937 for (T i = from; ;++i)
4938 {
4939 *dest_curr++ = i;
4940 if (i == to) break;
4941 }
4942 pcurr += 2; // jump to the next positive GAP
4943 }
4944 return (D) (dest_curr - dest);
4945}
4946
4947
4948/*!
4949 @brief Bitcount for bit block without agressive unrolling
4950 @ingroup bitfunc
4951*/
4952BMFORCEINLINE
4953unsigned bit_count_min_unroll(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
4954 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block_end) BMNOEXCEPT
4955{
4956 unsigned count = 0;
4957#ifdef BM64OPT__
4958 do
4959 {
4960 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u =
4961 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(block);
4962
4963 bm::id64_t x = src_u->w64[0]; bm::id64_t y = src_u->w64[1];
4964 bm::id64_t u = src_u->w64[2]; bm::id64_t v = src_u->w64[3];
4965
4966 #if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD)
4967 count += unsigned(__builtin_popcountll(x) + __builtin_popcountll(y)
4968 + __builtin_popcountll(u) + __builtin_popcountll(v));
4969 #else
4970 // 64-bit optimized algorithm. No sparse vect opt
4971 // instead it uses 4-way parallel pipelined version
4972 if (x | y | u | v)
4973 {
4974 unsigned c = bitcount64_4way(x, y, u, v);
4975 BM_ASSERT(c);
4976 count += c;
4977 }
4978 #endif
4979 block += 8;
4980 } while (block < block_end);
4981#else
4982 do
4983 {
4984 unsigned c1= bm::word_bitcount(*block);
4985 unsigned c2 = bm::word_bitcount(block[1]);
4986 count += c1 + c2;
4987 c1= bm::word_bitcount(block[2]);
4988 c2 = bm::word_bitcount(block[3]);
4989 count += c1 + c2;
4990 block+=4;
4991 } while (block < block_end);
4992
4993#endif
4994 return count;
4995}
4996
4997
4998
4999/*!
5000 @brief Bitcount for bit block
5001
5002 Function calculates number of 1 bits in the given array of words.
5003 Make sure the addresses are aligned.
5004
5005 @ingroup bitfunc
5006*/
5007inline
5008bm::id_t bit_block_count(const bm::word_t* block) BMNOEXCEPT
5009{
5010 const bm::word_t* block_end = block + bm::set_block_size;
5011#ifdef BMVECTOPT
5012 return VECT_BITCOUNT(block, block_end);
5013#else
5014 return bm::bit_count_min_unroll(block, block_end);
5015#endif
5016}
5017
5018/*!
5019 @brief Bitcount for bit block
5020
5021 Function calculates number of 1 bits in the given array of words.
5022 uses digest to understand zero areas
5023
5024 @ingroup bitfunc
5025*/
5026inline
5027bm::id_t bit_block_count(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT const block,
5028 bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
5029{
5030#ifdef VECT_BIT_COUNT_DIGEST
5031 return VECT_BIT_COUNT_DIGEST(block, digest);
5032#else
5033 bm::id_t count = 0;
5034 bm::id64_t d = digest;
5035
5036 // TODO: use platform neutral bitscan to decode digest here
5037
5038 while (d)
5039 {
5040 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(d); // d & -d;
5041
5042 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
5043 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
5044
5045#ifdef BM64OPT
5046 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u =
5047 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&block[off]);
5048 unsigned j = 0;
5049 do
5050 {
5051 bm::id64_t x = src_u->w64[0+j]; bm::id64_t y = src_u->w64[1+j];
5052 bm::id64_t u = src_u->w64[2+j]; bm::id64_t v = src_u->w64[3+j];
5053 #if defined(BM_USE_GCC_BUILD)
5054 count += unsigned(__builtin_popcountll(x) + __builtin_popcountll(y)
5055 + __builtin_popcountll(u) + __builtin_popcountll(v));
5056 #else
5057 // 64-bit optimized algorithm. No sparse vect opt
5058 // instead it uses 4-way parallel pipelined version
5059 if (x | y | u | v)
5060 {
5061 unsigned c = bm::bitcount64_4way(x, y, u, v);
5062 BM_ASSERT(c);
5063 count += c;
5064 }
5065 #endif
5066 j += 4;
5067 } while (j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size/2);
5068#else // 32-bit version
5069 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT blk = &block[off];
5070 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT blk_end = &block[off+bm::set_block_digest_wave_size];
5071 do
5072 {
5073 unsigned c1= bm::word_bitcount(*blk);
5074 unsigned c2 = bm::word_bitcount(blk[1]);
5075 count += c1 + c2;
5076 c1= bm::word_bitcount(blk[2]);
5077 c2 = bm::word_bitcount(blk[3]);
5078 count += c1 + c2;
5079 blk+=4;
5080 } while (blk < blk_end);
5081#endif
5082
5083 d = bm::bmi_bslr_u64(d); // d &= d - 1;
5084 } // while
5085 return count;
5086#endif
5087}
5088
5089
5090/*!
5091 Function calculates number of times when bit value changed
5092 (1-0 or 0-1).
5093
5094 For 001 result is 2
5095 010 - 3
5096 011 - 2
5097 111 - 1
5098
5099 @ingroup bitfunc
5100*/
5101inline
5102bm::id_t bit_count_change(bm::word_t w) BMNOEXCEPT
5103{
5104 unsigned count = 1;
5105 w ^= (w >> 1);
5106
5107 count += bm::word_bitcount(w);
5108 count -= (w >> ((sizeof(w) * 8) - 1));
5109 return count;
5110}
5111
5112
5113/*!
5114 Function calculates number of times when bit value changed
5115 @internal
5116*/
5117inline
5118unsigned bit_block_change32(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
5119 unsigned size) BMNOEXCEPT
5120{
5121 unsigned gap_count = 1;
5122
5123 bm::word_t w, w0, w_prev, w_l;
5124 w = w0 = *block;
5125
5126 const int w_shift = int(sizeof(w) * 8 - 1);
5127 w ^= (w >> 1);
5128 gap_count += bm::word_bitcount(w);
5129 gap_count -= (w_prev = (w0 >> w_shift)); // negative value correction
5130
5131 const bm::word_t* block_end = block + size;
5132 for (++block; block < block_end; ++block)
5133 {
5134 w = w0 = *block;
5135 ++gap_count;
5136 if (!w)
5137 {
5138 gap_count -= !w_prev;
5139 w_prev = 0;
5140 }
5141 else
5142 {
5143 w ^= (w >> 1);
5144 gap_count += bm::word_bitcount(w);
5145 w_l = w0 & 1;
5146 gap_count -= (w0 >> w_shift); // negative value correction
5147 gap_count -= !(w_prev ^ w_l); // word border correction
5148
5149 w_prev = (w0 >> w_shift);
5150 }
5151 } // for
5152 return gap_count;
5153}
5154
5155/*!
5156 Function calculates number of times when bit value changed
5157 @internal
5158*/
5159inline
5160unsigned bit_block_change64(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT in_block,
5161 unsigned size) BMNOEXCEPT
5162{
5163 unsigned gap_count = 1;
5164 const bm::id64_t* BMRESTRICT block = (const bm::id64_t*) in_block;
5165
5166 bm::id64_t w, w0, w_prev, w_l;
5167 w = w0 = *block;
5168
5169 const int w_shift = int(sizeof(w) * 8 - 1);
5170 w ^= (w >> 1);
5171 gap_count += bm::word_bitcount64(w);
5172 gap_count -= unsigned(w_prev = (w0 >> w_shift)); // negative value correction
5173
5174 const bm::id64_t* block_end = block + (size/2);
5175 for (++block; block < block_end; ++block)
5176 {
5177 w = w0 = *block;
5178 ++gap_count;
5179 if (!w)
5180 {
5181 gap_count -= !w_prev;
5182 w_prev = 0;
5183 }
5184 else
5185 {
5186 w ^= (w >> 1);
5187 gap_count += bm::word_bitcount64(w);
5188 w_l = w0 & 1;
5189 gap_count -= unsigned(w0 >> w_shift); // negative value correction
5190 gap_count -= !(w_prev ^ w_l); // word border correction
5191 w_prev = (w0 >> w_shift);
5192 }
5193 } // for
5194 return gap_count;
5195}
5196
5197
5198
5199/*!
5200 Function calculates basic bit-block statistics
5201 number of times when bit value changed (GAPS)
5202 and population count
5203 @param block - bit-block pointer
5204 @param gc - [output] gap_count
5205 @param bc - [output] bit count
5206 @internal
5207*/
5208inline
5209void bit_block_change_bc(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
5210 unsigned* BMRESTRICT gc, unsigned* BMRESTRICT bc) BMNOEXCEPT
5211{
5212 BM_ASSERT(gc);
5213 BM_ASSERT(bc);
5214
5215 #ifdef VECT_BLOCK_CHANGE_BC
5216 VECT_BLOCK_CHANGE_BC(block, gc, bc);
5217 #else
5218 // TODO: one pass algo
5219 #ifdef BM64OPT
5220 *gc = bm::bit_block_change64(block, bm::set_block_size);
5221 #else
5222 *gc = bm::bit_block_change32(block, bm::set_block_size);
5223 #endif
5224 *bc = bm::bit_block_count(block);
5225 #endif
5226}
5227
5228
5229
5230/*!
5231 Function calculates number of times when bit value changed
5232 (1-0 or 0-1) in the bit block.
5233
5234 @param block - bit-block start pointer
5235 @return number of 1-0, 0-1 transitions
5236
5237 @ingroup bitfunc
5238*/
5239inline
5240unsigned bit_block_calc_change(const bm::word_t* block) BMNOEXCEPT
5241{
5242#if defined(VECT_BLOCK_CHANGE)
5243 return VECT_BLOCK_CHANGE(block, bm::set_block_size);
5244#else
5245 #ifdef BM64OPT
5246 return bm::bit_block_change64(block, bm::set_block_size);
5247 #else
5248 return bm::bit_block_change32(block, bm::set_block_size);
5249 #endif
5250#endif
5251}
5252
5253/*!
5254 Check if all bits are 1 in [left, right] range
5255 @ingroup bitfunc
5256*/
5257inline
5258bool bit_block_is_all_one_range(const bm::word_t* const BMRESTRICT block,
5259 bm::word_t left,
5260 bm::word_t right) BMNOEXCEPT
5261{
5262 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
5263 BM_ASSERT(right <= bm::gap_max_bits-1);
5264
5265 unsigned nword, nbit, bitcount, temp;
5266 nbit = left & bm::set_word_mask;
5267 const bm::word_t* word =
5268 block + (nword = unsigned(left >> bm::set_word_shift));
5269 if (left == right) // special case (only 1 bit to check)
5270 return (*word >> nbit) & 1u;
5271
5272 if (nbit) // starting position is not aligned
5273 {
5274 unsigned right_margin = nbit + right - left;
5275 if (right_margin < 32)
5276 {
5277 unsigned mask_r = bm::mask_r_u32(nbit);
5278 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(right_margin);
5279 unsigned mask = mask_r & mask_l;
5280 return mask == (*word & mask);
5281 }
5282
5283 unsigned mask_r = bm::mask_r_u32(nbit);
5284 temp = *word & mask_r;
5285 if (temp != mask_r)
5286 return false;
5287 bitcount = (right - left + 1u) - (32 - nbit);
5288 ++word;
5289 }
5290 else
5291 {
5292 bitcount = right - left + 1u;
5293 }
5294
5295 const bm::word_t maskFF = ~0u;
5296 // loop unrolled to evaluate 4 words at a time
5297 // SIMD showed no advantage, unless evaluate sub-wave intervals
5298 //
5299 #if defined(BM64OPT) || defined(BM64_SSE4) || defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined(BMAVX512OPT)
5300 const bm::id64_t maskFF64 = ~0ull;
5301 for ( ;bitcount >= 128; bitcount-=128, word+=4)
5302 {
5303 bm::id64_t w64_0 = bm::id64_t(word[0]) + (bm::id64_t(word[1]) << 32);
5304 bm::id64_t w64_1 = bm::id64_t(word[2]) + (bm::id64_t(word[3]) << 32);
5305 if ((w64_0 ^ maskFF64) | (w64_1 ^ maskFF64))
5306 return false;
5307 } // for
5308 #else
5309 for ( ;bitcount >= 128; bitcount-=128, word+=4)
5310 {
5311 bm::word_t m = (word[0] != maskFF) || (word[1] != maskFF) |
5312 (word[2] != maskFF) || (word[3] != maskFF);
5313 if (m)
5314 return false;
5315 } // for
5316 #endif
5317
5318 for ( ;bitcount >= 32; bitcount-=32, ++word)
5319 {
5320 if (*word != maskFF)
5321 return false;
5322 } // for
5323 BM_ASSERT(bitcount < 32);
5324 if (bitcount) // we have a tail to count
5325 {
5326 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(bitcount-1);
5327 temp = *word & mask_l;
5328 if (temp != mask_l)
5329 return false;
5330 }
5331 return true;
5332}
5333
5334
5335
5336
5337/*!
5338 Function calculates number of 1 bits in the given array of words in
5339 the range between left anf right bits (borders included)
5340 Make sure the addr is aligned.
5341
5342 LWA - left word aligned
5343 RWA - right word aligned
5344 @ingroup bitfunc
5345*/
5346template<bool LWA, bool RWA>
5347bm::id_t bit_block_calc_count_range(const bm::word_t* block,
5348 bm::word_t left,
5349 bm::word_t right) BMNOEXCEPT
5350{
5351 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
5352 BM_ASSERT(right <= bm::gap_max_bits-1);
5353
5354 unsigned nword, nbit, bitcount, count, right_margin;
5355 nbit = left & bm::set_word_mask;
5356 block += (nword = unsigned(left >> bm::set_word_shift));
5357 if (left == right) // special case (only 1 bit to check)
5358 return (*block >> nbit) & 1u;
5359
5360 bitcount = 1u + (right_margin = (right - left));
5361 if constexpr (LWA)
5362 {
5363 BM_ASSERT(!nbit);
5364 count = 0;
5365 }
5366 else
5367 if (nbit) // starting position is not aligned
5368 {
5369 right_margin += nbit;
5370 unsigned mask_r = bm::mask_r_u32(nbit);
5371 if (right_margin < 32)
5372 {
5373 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(right_margin);
5374 return bm::word_bitcount(mask_r & mask_l & *block);
5375 }
5376 count = bm::word_bitcount(*block++ & mask_r);
5377 bitcount -= 32 - nbit;
5378 }
5379 else
5380 count = 0;
5381
5382 // now when we are word aligned, we can count bits the usual way
5383 //
5384 #if defined(BM64_SSE4) || defined(BM64_AVX2) || defined(BM64_AVX512)
5385 for ( ;bitcount >= 128; bitcount-=128)
5386 {
5387 const bm::id64_t* p64 = (bm::id64_t*) block;
5388 bm::id64_t w64_0 = p64[0]; // x86 unaligned(!) read
5389 bm::id64_t w64_1 = p64[1];
5390 count += unsigned(_mm_popcnt_u64(w64_0));
5391 count += unsigned(_mm_popcnt_u64(w64_1));
5392 block += 4;
5393 }
5394 for ( ;bitcount >= 64; bitcount-=64)
5395 {
5396 bm::id64_t w64 = *((bm::id64_t*)block); // x86 unaligned(!) read
5397 count += unsigned(_mm_popcnt_u64(w64));
5398 block += 2;
5399 }
5400 if (bitcount >= 32)
5401 {
5402 count += bm::word_bitcount(*block++);
5403 bitcount-=32;
5404 }
5405 #else
5406 for ( ;bitcount >= 32; bitcount-=32)
5407 count += bm::word_bitcount(*block++);
5408 #endif
5409 BM_ASSERT(bitcount < 32);
5410
5411 if constexpr (RWA)
5412 {
5413 BM_ASSERT(!bitcount);
5414 }
5415 else
5416 if (bitcount) // we have a tail to count
5417 {
5418 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(bitcount-1);
5419 count += bm::word_bitcount(*block & mask_l);
5420 }
5421 return count;
5422}
5423
5424
5425/*!
5426 Function calculates number of 1 bits in the given array of words in
5427 the range between 0 anf right bits (borders included)
5428 Make sure the addr is aligned.
5429
5430 @ingroup bitfunc
5431*/
5432inline
5433bm::id_t bit_block_calc_count_to(const bm::word_t* block,
5434 bm::word_t right) BMNOEXCEPT
5435{
5436 BM_ASSERT(block);
5437 if (!right) // special case, first bit check
5438 return *block & 1u;
5439 bm::id_t count = 0;
5440
5441 unsigned bitcount = right + 1;
5442
5443 // AVX2 or 64-bit loop unroll
5444 #if defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined(BMAVX512OPT)
5445 BM_AVX2_POPCNT_PROLOG
5446
5447 __m256i cnt = _mm256_setzero_si256();
5448 bm::id64_t* cnt64;
5449
5450 for ( ;bitcount >= 256; bitcount -= 256)
5451 {
5452 const __m256i* src = (__m256i*)block;
5453 __m256i xmm256 = _mm256_load_si256(src);
5454 BM_AVX2_BIT_COUNT(bc, xmm256);
5455 cnt = _mm256_add_epi64(cnt, bc);
5456
5457 block += 8;
5458 } // for
5459 cnt64 = (bm::id64_t*)&cnt;
5460 count += (unsigned)(cnt64[0] + cnt64[1] + cnt64[2] + cnt64[3]);
5461 #endif
5462
5463 for ( ;bitcount >= 64; bitcount -= 64)
5464 {
5465 bm::id64_t* p = (bm::id64_t*)block;
5466 count += bm::word_bitcount64(*p);
5467 block += 2;
5468 }
5469 if (bitcount >= 32)
5470 {
5471 count += bm::word_bitcount(*block++);
5472 bitcount-=32;
5473 }
5474
5475 if (bitcount) // we have a tail to count
5476 {
5477 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(bitcount-1);
5478 count += bm::word_bitcount(*block & mask_l);
5479 }
5480 return count;
5481}
5482
5483
5484
5485/*!
5486 Cyclic rotation of bit-block left by 1 bit
5487 @ingroup bitfunc
5488*/
5489inline
5490void bit_block_rotate_left_1(bm::word_t* block) BMNOEXCEPT
5491{
5492 bm::word_t co_flag = (block[0] >> 31) & 1; // carry over bit
5493 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bm::set_block_size-1; ++i)
5494 {
5495 block[i] = (block[i] << 1) | (block[i + 1] >> 31);
5496 }
5497 block[set_block_size - 1] = (block[set_block_size - 1] << 1) | co_flag;
5498}
5499
5500/*!
5501 @brief Unrolled cyclic rotation of bit-block left by 1 bit
5502 @param block - bit-block pointer
5503 @ingroup bitfunc
5504*/
5505inline
5506void bit_block_rotate_left_1_unr(bm::word_t* block) BMNOEXCEPT
5507{
5508 bm::word_t co_flag = (block[0] >> 31) & 1; // carry over bit
5509 const unsigned unroll_factor = 4;
5510 bm::word_t w0, w1, w2, w3;
5511
5512 unsigned i;
5513 for (i = 0; i < bm::set_block_size - unroll_factor; i += unroll_factor)
5514 {
5515 w0 = block[i + 1] >> 31;
5516 w1 = block[i + 2] >> 31;
5517 w2 = block[i + 3] >> 31;
5518 w3 = block[i + 4] >> 31;
5519
5520 block[0 + i] = (block[0 + i] << 1) | w0;
5521 block[1 + i] = (block[1 + i] << 1) | w1;
5522 block[2 + i] = (block[2 + i] << 1) | w2;
5523 block[3 + i] = (block[3 + i] << 1) | w3;
5524 }
5525 block[i] = (block[i] << 1) | (block[i + 1] >> 31);
5526 block[i + 1] = (block[i + 1] << 1) | (block[i + 2] >> 31);
5527 block[i + 2] = (block[i + 2] << 1) | (block[i + 3] >> 31);
5528 block[set_block_size - 1] = (block[set_block_size - 1] << 1) | co_flag;
5529}
5530
5531/*!
5532 @brief insert bit into position and shift the rest right with carryover
5533
5534 @param block - bit-block pointer
5535 @param bitpos - bit position to insert
5536 @param value - bit value (0|1) to insert
5537
5538 @return carry over value
5539 @ingroup bitfunc
5540*/
5541inline
5542bm::word_t bit_block_insert(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
5543 unsigned bitpos, bool value) BMNOEXCEPT
5544{
5545 BM_ASSERT(block);
5546 BM_ASSERT(bitpos < 65536);
5547
5548 unsigned nbit = unsigned(bitpos & bm::set_block_mask);
5549 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
5550 nbit &= bm::set_word_mask;
5551
5552 bm::word_t co_flag = 0;
5553 if (nbit)
5554 {
5555 unsigned mask_r = bm::mask_r_u32(nbit);
5556 bm::word_t w = block[nword] & mask_r;
5557 bm::word_t wl = block[nword] & ~~mask_r;
5558 co_flag = w >> 31;
5559 w <<= 1u;
5560 block[nword] = w | (unsigned(value) << nbit) | wl;
5561 ++nword;
5562 }
5563 else
5564 {
5565 co_flag = value;
5566 }
5567
5568 for (unsigned i = nword; i < bm::set_block_size; ++i)
5569 {
5570 bm::word_t w = block[i];
5571 bm::word_t co_flag1 = w >> 31;
5572 w = (w << 1u) | co_flag;
5573 block[i] = w;
5574 co_flag = co_flag1;
5575 } // for i
5576 return co_flag;
5577}
5578
5579
5580
5581/*!
5582 @brief Right bit-shift bitblock by 1 bit (reference)
5583 @param block - bit-block pointer
5584 @param empty_acc - [out] contains 0 if block is empty
5585 @param co_flag - carry over from the previous block
5586
5587 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
5588 @ingroup bitfunc
5589*/
5590inline
5591bool bit_block_shift_r1(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
5592 bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT empty_acc,
5593 bm::word_t co_flag) BMNOEXCEPT
5594{
5595 BM_ASSERT(block);
5596 BM_ASSERT(empty_acc);
5597
5598 bm::word_t acc(0);
5599 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bm::set_block_size; ++i)
5600 {
5601 bm::word_t w = block[i];
5602 bm::word_t co_flag1 = w >> 31;
5603 acc |= w = (w << 1u) | co_flag;
5604
5605 block[i] = w;
5606 co_flag = co_flag1;
5607 } // for i
5608 *empty_acc = acc;
5609 return co_flag;
5610}
5611
5612/*!
5613 @brief Right bit-shift bitblock by 1 bit (minimum unroll)
5614 @param block - bit-block pointer
5615 @param empty_acc - [out] contains 0 if block is empty
5616 @param co_flag - carry over from the previous block
5617
5618 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
5619 @ingroup bitfunc
5620*/
5621inline
5622bool bit_block_shift_r1_unr_min(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
5623 bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT empty_acc,
5624 bm::id64_t co_flag) BMNOEXCEPT
5625{
5626
5627#if defined(BM64OPT)
5628 // warning: all this code maybe not safe on big-endian
5629 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT b_u =
5630 (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(block);
5631
5632 bm::id64_t acc0(0), acc1(0);
5633 unsigned i = 0;
5634 do
5635 {
5636 bm::id64_t w, co_flag1;
5637 w = b_u->w64[i];
5638 co_flag1 = w >> 63;
5639 acc0 |= w = (w << 1u) | co_flag;
5640 b_u->w64[i++] = w;
5641 co_flag = co_flag1;
5642
5643 w = b_u->w64[i];
5644 co_flag1 = w >> 63;
5645 acc1 |= w = (w << 1u) | co_flag;
5646 b_u->w64[i] = w;
5647 co_flag = co_flag1;
5648
5649 } while(++i < bm::set_block_size/2);
5650 *empty_acc = bool(acc0 | acc1);
5651 return co_flag;
5652#else
5653 return bm::bit_block_shift_r1(block, empty_acc, unsigned(co_flag));
5654#endif
5655}
5656
5657
5658/*!
5659 @brief Right bit-shift of bit-block by 1 bit (loop unrolled)
5660 @param block - bit-block pointer
5661 @param empty_acc - [out] contains 0 if block is empty
5662 @param co_flag - carry over from the previous block
5663
5664 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
5665 @ingroup bitfunc
5666*/
5667inline
5668bool bit_block_shift_r1_unr(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
5669 bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT empty_acc,
5670 bm::word_t co_flag) BMNOEXCEPT
5671{
5672 BM_ASSERT(block);
5673 BM_ASSERT(empty_acc);
5674 #if defined(VECT_SHIFT_R1)
5675 return VECT_SHIFT_R1(block, empty_acc, co_flag);
5676 #else
5677 return bm::bit_block_shift_r1_unr_min(block, empty_acc, co_flag);
5678 #endif
5679}
5680
5681
5682/*!
5683 @brief Left bit-shift bitblock by 1 bit (reference)
5684 @param block - bit-block pointer
5685 @param empty_acc - [out] contains 0 if block is empty
5686 @param co_flag - carry over from the prev/next block
5687
5688 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
5689
5690 @ingroup bitfunc
5691*/
5692inline
5693bool bit_block_shift_l1(bm::word_t* block,
5694 bm::word_t* empty_acc, bm::word_t co_flag) BMNOEXCEPT
5695{
5696 BM_ASSERT(block);
5697 BM_ASSERT(empty_acc);
5698
5699 bm::word_t acc = 0;
5700 for (int i = bm::set_block_size-1; i >= 0; --i)
5701 {
5702 bm::word_t w = block[i];
5703 bm::word_t co_flag1 = w & 1u;
5704 acc |= w = (w >> 1u) | (co_flag << 31u);
5705 block[i] = w;
5706 co_flag = co_flag1;
5707 }
5708
5709 *empty_acc = acc;
5710 return co_flag;
5711}
5712
5713/*!
5714 @brief Left bit-shift bitblock by 1 bit (minimum unroll)
5715 @param block - bit-block pointer
5716 @param empty_acc - [out] contains 0 if block is empty
5717 @param co_flag - carry over from the prev/next block
5718
5719 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
5720
5721 @ingroup bitfunc
5722*/
5723inline
5724bool bit_block_shift_l1_unr_min(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
5725 bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT empty_acc,
5726 unsigned co_flag) BMNOEXCEPT
5727{
5728 bm::word_t acc = 0;
5729 for (int i = bm::set_block_size-1; i >= 0; i-=2)
5730 {
5731 bm::word_t w0, w1, co_flag1;
5732 w0 = block[i]; w1 = block[i-1];
5733 co_flag1 = w0 & 1u;
5734 acc |= w0 = (w0 >> 1u) | (co_flag << 31u);
5735 block[i] = w0;
5736 co_flag = co_flag1;
5737 co_flag1 = w1 & 1u;
5738 acc |= w1 = (w1 >> 1u) | (co_flag << 31u);
5739 block[i-1] = w1;
5740 co_flag = co_flag1;
5741
5742 i-=2;
5743 w0 = block[i]; w1 = block[i-1];
5744 co_flag1 = w0 & 1u;
5745 acc |= w0 = (w0 >> 1u) | (co_flag << 31u);
5746 block[i] = w0;
5747 co_flag = co_flag1;
5748 co_flag1 = w1 & 1u;
5749 acc |= w1 = (w1 >> 1u) | (co_flag << 31u);
5750 block[i-1] = w1;
5751 co_flag = co_flag1;
5752 } // for i
5753 *empty_acc = acc;
5754 return co_flag;
5755}
5756
5757
5758/*!
5759 @brief Left bit-shift of bit-block by 1 bit (loop unrolled)
5760 @param block - bit-block pointer
5761 @param empty_acc - [out] contains 0 if block is empty
5762 @param co_flag - carry over from the prev/next block
5763
5764 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
5765 @ingroup bitfunc
5766*/
5767inline
5768bool bit_block_shift_l1_unr(bm::word_t* block,
5769 bm::word_t* empty_acc,
5770 bm::word_t co_flag) BMNOEXCEPT
5771{
5772 BM_ASSERT(block);
5773 BM_ASSERT(empty_acc);
5774 #if defined(VECT_SHIFT_L1)
5775 return VECT_SHIFT_L1(block, empty_acc, co_flag);
5776 #else
5777 return bm::bit_block_shift_l1_unr_min(block, empty_acc, co_flag);
5778 #endif
5779}
5780
5781/*!
5782 @brief erase bit from position and shift the rest right with carryover
5783
5784 @param block - bit-block pointer
5785 @param bitpos - bit position to insert
5786 @param carry_over - bit value to add to the end (0|1)
5787
5788 @ingroup bitfunc
5789*/
5790inline
5791void bit_block_erase(bm::word_t* block,
5792 unsigned bitpos,
5793 bool carry_over) BMNOEXCEPT
5794{
5795 BM_ASSERT(block);
5796 BM_ASSERT(bitpos < 65536);
5797
5798 if (!bitpos)
5799 {
5800 bm::word_t acc;
5801 bm::bit_block_shift_l1_unr(block, &acc, carry_over);
5802 return;
5803 }
5804
5805 unsigned nbit = unsigned(bitpos & bm::set_block_mask);
5806 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
5807 nbit &= bm::set_word_mask;
5808
5809 bm::word_t co_flag = carry_over;
5810 for (unsigned i = bm::set_block_size-1; i > nword; --i)
5811 {
5812 bm::word_t w = block[i];
5813 bm::word_t co_flag1 = w & 1u;
5814 w = (w >> 1u) | (co_flag << 31u);
5815 block[i] = w;
5816 co_flag = co_flag1;
5817 }
5818
5819 if (nbit)
5820 {
5821 unsigned mask_r = bm::mask_r_u32(nbit);
5822 bm::word_t w = block[nword] & mask_r;
5823 bm::word_t wl = block[nword] & ~~mask_r;
5824 w &= ~(1 << nbit); // clear the removed bit
5825 w >>= 1u;
5826 w |= wl | (co_flag << 31u);
5827 block[nword] = w;
5828 }
5829 else
5830 {
5831 block[nword] = (block[nword] >> 1u) | (co_flag << 31u);
5832 }
5833}
5834
5835
5836/*!
5837 @brief Right bit-shift of bit-block by 1 bit (reference) + AND
5838 @param block - bit-block pointer
5839 @param co_flag - carry over from the previous block
5840 @param mask_block - mask bit-block pointer
5841 @param digest - block digest
5842
5843 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
5844 @ingroup bitfunc
5845*/
5846inline
5847bool bit_block_shift_r1_and(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
5848 bm::word_t co_flag,
5849 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT mask_block,
5850 bm::id64_t* BMRESTRICT digest) BMNOEXCEPT
5851{
5852 BM_ASSERT(block);
5853 BM_ASSERT(mask_block);
5854 BM_ASSERT(digest && *digest);
5855
5856
5857 bm::id64_t d = *digest;
5858
5859 unsigned di = 0;
5860 if (!co_flag)
5861 {
5862 bm::id64_t t = d & -d;
5863 di = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1); // find start bit-index
5864 }
5865
5866 for (; di < 64; ++di)
5867 {
5868 const unsigned d_base = di * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
5869 bm::id64_t dmask = (1ull << di);
5870 if (d & dmask) // digest stride not empty
5871 {
5872 bm::word_t acc = 0;
5873 for (unsigned i = d_base; i < d_base + bm::set_block_digest_wave_size; ++i)
5874 {
5875 BM_ASSERT(i < bm::set_block_size);
5876
5877 bm::word_t w = block[i];
5878 bm::word_t co_flag1 = w >> 31;
5879 w = (w << 1u) | co_flag;
5880 acc |= block[i] = w & mask_block[i];
5881 co_flag = co_flag1;
5882 }
5883 if (!acc)
5884 d &= ~~dmask; // update digest: clear stride bit
5885 }
5886 else // stride is empty
5887 {
5888 BM_ASSERT(block[d_base + bm::set_block_digest_wave_size -1]==0);
5889 BM_ASSERT(block[d_base]==0);
5890
5891 if (co_flag) // there is carry-over
5892 {
5893 BM_ASSERT(co_flag == 1);
5894 BM_ASSERT(block[d_base] == 0);
5895
5896 block[d_base] = co_flag & mask_block[d_base];
5897 if (block[d_base])
5898 d |= dmask; // update digest
5899 co_flag = 0;
5900 }
5901 }
5902 } // for di
5903
5904 *digest = d;
5905 return co_flag;
5906}
5907
5908/*!
5909 @brief Right bit-shift bitblock by 1 bit (reference) + AND
5910 @param block - bit-block pointer
5911 @param co_flag - carry over from the previous block
5912 @param mask_block - mask bit-block pointer
5913 @param digest - block digest
5914
5915 @return carry over bit (1 or 0)
5916 @ingroup bitfunc
5917*/
5918inline
5919bool bit_block_shift_r1_and_unr(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
5920 bm::word_t co_flag,
5921 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT mask_block,
5922 bm::id64_t* BMRESTRICT digest) BMNOEXCEPT
5923{
5924 BM_ASSERT(block);
5925 BM_ASSERT(mask_block);
5926 BM_ASSERT(digest);
5927
5928 #if defined(VECT_SHIFT_R1_AND)
5929 return VECT_SHIFT_R1_AND(block, co_flag, mask_block, digest);
5930 #else
5931 return bm::bit_block_shift_r1_and(block, co_flag, mask_block, digest);
5932 #endif
5933}
5934
5935
5936/*!
5937 Function calculates if there is any number of 1 bits
5938 in the given array of words in the range between left anf right bits
5939 (borders included). Make sure the addresses are aligned.
5940
5941 @ingroup bitfunc
5942*/
5943inline
5944bm::id_t bit_block_any_range(const bm::word_t* const BMRESTRICT block,
5945 bm::word_t left,
5946 bm::word_t right) BMNOEXCEPT
5947{
5948 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
5949
5950 unsigned nbit = left; // unsigned(left & bm::set_block_mask);
5951 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
5952 nbit &= bm::set_word_mask;
5953
5954 const bm::word_t* word = block + nword;
5955
5956 if (left == right) // special case (only 1 bit to check)
5957 {
5958 return (*word >> nbit) & 1;
5959 }
5960 unsigned acc;
5961 unsigned bitcount = right - left + 1;
5962
5963 if (nbit) // starting position is not aligned
5964 {
5965 unsigned right_margin = nbit + (right - left);
5966 if (right_margin < 32)
5967 {
5968 unsigned mask_r = bm::mask_r_u32(nbit);
5969 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(right_margin);
5970 unsigned mask = mask_r & mask_l;
5971 return *word & mask;
5972 }
5973 else
5974 {
5975 unsigned mask_r = bm::mask_r_u32(nbit);
5976 acc = *word & mask_r;
5977 if (acc)
5978 return acc;
5979 bitcount -= 32 - nbit;
5980 }
5981 ++word;
5982 }
5983
5984 // loop unrolled to evaluate 4 words at a time
5985 // SIMD showed no advantage, unless evaluate sub-wave intervals
5986 //
5987 for ( ;bitcount >= 128; bitcount-=128, word+=4)
5988 {
5989 acc = word[0] | word[1] | word[2] | word[3];
5990 if (acc)
5991 return acc;
5992 } // for
5993
5994 acc = 0;
5995 for ( ;bitcount >= 32; bitcount -= 32)
5996 {
5997 acc |= *word++;
5998 } // for
5999
6000 if (bitcount) // we have a tail to count
6001 {
6002 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(bitcount-1);
6003 acc |= (*word) & mask_l;
6004 }
6005 return acc;
6006}
6007
6008// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6009
6010/*! Function inverts block of bits
6011 @ingroup bitfunc
6012*/
6013template<typename T>
6014void bit_invert(T* start) BMNOEXCEPT
6015{
6016 BM_ASSERT(IS_VALID_ADDR((bm::word_t*)start));
6017#ifdef BMVECTOPT
6018 VECT_INVERT_BLOCK(start);
6019#else
6020 T* end = (T*)((unsigned*)(start) + bm::set_block_size);
6021 do
6022 {
6023 start[0] = ~~start[0];
6024 start[1] = ~~start[1];
6025 start[2] = ~~start[2];
6026 start[3] = ~~start[3];
6027 start+=4;
6028 } while (start < end);
6029#endif
6030}
6031
6032// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6033
6034/*! @brief Returns "true" if all bits in the block are 1
6035 @ingroup bitfunc
6036*/
6037inline
6038bool is_bits_one(const bm::wordop_t* start) BMNOEXCEPT
6039{
6040#if defined(VECT_IS_ONE_BLOCK)
6041 return VECT_IS_ONE_BLOCK(start);
6042#else
6043 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src_end = (bm::word_t*)start + bm::set_block_size;
6044 const bm::wordop_t* end = (const bm::wordop_t*)src_end;
6045 do
6046 {
6047 bm::wordop_t tmp =
6048 start[0] & start[1] & start[2] & start[3];
6049 if (tmp != bm::all_bits_mask)
6050 return false;
6051 start += 4;
6052 } while (start < end);
6053 return true;
6054#endif
6055}
6056
6057// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6058
6059/*! @brief Returns "true" if all bits are 1 in the block [left, right]
6060 Function check for block varieties
6061 @internal
6062*/
6063inline
6064bool block_is_all_one_range(const bm::word_t* const BMRESTRICT block,
6065 unsigned left, unsigned right) BMNOEXCEPT
6066{
6067 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
6068 BM_ASSERT(right < bm::gap_max_bits);
6069 if (block)
6070 {
6071 if (BM_IS_GAP(block))
6072 return bm::gap_is_all_one_range(BMGAP_PTR(block), left, right);
6073 if (block == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
6074 return true;
6075 return bm::bit_block_is_all_one_range(block, left, right);
6076 }
6077 return false;
6078}
6079
6080/*! @brief Returns "true" if all bits are 1 in the block [left, right]
6081 and border bits are 0
6082 @internal
6083*/
6084inline
6085bool block_is_interval(const bm::word_t* const BMRESTRICT block,
6086 unsigned left, unsigned right) BMNOEXCEPT
6087{
6088 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
6089 BM_ASSERT(right < bm::gap_max_bits-1);
6090
6091 if (block)
6092 {
6093 bool is_left, is_right, all_one;
6094 if (BM_IS_GAP(block))
6095 {
6096 const bm::gap_word_t* gap = BMGAP_PTR(block);
6097 all_one = bm::gap_is_interval(gap, left, right);
6098 return all_one;
6099 }
6100 else // bit-block
6101 {
6102 if (block == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
6103 return false;
6104 unsigned nword = ((left-1) >> bm::set_word_shift);
6105 is_left = block[nword] & (1u << ((left-1) & bm::set_word_mask));
6106 if (is_left == false)
6107 {
6108 nword = ((right + 1) >> bm::set_word_shift);
6109 is_right = block[nword] & (1u << ((right + 1) & bm::set_word_mask));
6110 if (is_right == false)
6111 {
6112 all_one = bm::bit_block_is_all_one_range(block, left, right);
6113 return all_one;
6114 }
6115 }
6116 }
6117 }
6118
6119 return false;
6120}
6121
6122// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6123
6124/**
6125 \brief Searches for the last 1 bit in the 111 interval of a BIT block
6126 \param block - BIT buffer
6127 \param nbit - bit index to start checking from
6128 \param pos - [out] found value
6129
6130 \return false if not found
6131 @ingroup bitfunc
6132*/
6133inline
6134bool bit_block_find_interval_end(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
6135 unsigned nbit, unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
6136{
6137 BM_ASSERT(block);
6138 BM_ASSERT(pos);
6139
6140 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
6141 unsigned bit_pos = (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
6142 bm::word_t w = block[nword];
6143 w &= (1u << bit_pos);
6144 if (!w)
6145 return false;
6146
6147 if (nbit == bm::gap_max_bits-1)
6148 {
6149 *pos = bm::gap_max_bits-1;
6150 return true;
6151 }
6152 *pos = nbit;
6153
6154 ++nbit;
6155 nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
6156 bit_pos = (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
6157
6158 w = (~~block[nword]) >> bit_pos;
6159 w <<= bit_pos; // clear the trailing bits
6160 if (w)
6161 {
6162 bit_pos = bm::bit_scan_forward32(w); // trailing zeros
6163 *pos = unsigned(bit_pos + (nword * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t)))-1);
6164 return true;
6165 }
6166
6167 for (++nword; nword < bm::set_block_size; ++nword)
6168 {
6169 w = ~~block[nword];
6170 if (w)
6171 {
6172 bit_pos = bm::bit_scan_forward32(w); // trailing zeros
6173 *pos = unsigned(bit_pos + (nword * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t)))-1);
6174 return true;
6175 }
6176 } // for nword
6177
6178 // 0 not found, all block is 1s...
6179 *pos = bm::gap_max_bits-1;
6180 return true;
6181}
6182
6183
6184/*! @brief Find end of the current 111 interval
6185 @return search result code 0 - not found, 1 found, 2 - found at the end
6186 @internal
6187*/
6188inline
6189unsigned block_find_interval_end(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
6190 unsigned nbit_from,
6191 unsigned* BMRESTRICT found_nbit) BMNOEXCEPT
6192{
6193 BM_ASSERT(block && found_nbit);
6194 BM_ASSERT(nbit_from < bm::gap_max_bits);
6195
6196 bool b;
6197 if (BM_IS_GAP(block))
6198 {
6199 const bm::gap_word_t* gap = BMGAP_PTR(block);
6200 b = bm::gap_find_interval_end(gap, nbit_from, found_nbit);
6201 if (b && *found_nbit == bm::gap_max_bits-1)
6202 return 2; // end of block, keep searching
6203 }
6204 else // bit-block
6205 {
6206 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(block))
6207 {
6208 *found_nbit = bm::gap_max_bits-1;
6209 return 2;
6210 }
6211 b = bm::bit_block_find_interval_end(block, nbit_from, found_nbit);
6212 if (b && *found_nbit == bm::gap_max_bits-1)
6213 return 2; // end of block, keep searching
6214 }
6215 return b;
6216}
6217
6218// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6219
6220/**
6221 \brief Searches for the first 1 bit in the 111 interval of a BIT block
6222 \param block - BIT buffer
6223 \param nbit - bit index to start checking from
6224 \param pos - [out] found value
6225
6226 \return false if not found
6227 @ingroup bitfunc
6228*/
6229inline
6230bool bit_block_find_interval_start(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
6231 unsigned nbit, unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
6232{
6233 BM_ASSERT(block);
6234 BM_ASSERT(pos);
6235
6236 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
6237 unsigned bit_pos = (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
6238 bm::word_t w = block[nword];
6239 w &= (1u << bit_pos);
6240 if (!w)
6241 return false;
6242
6243 if (nbit == 0)
6244 {
6245 *pos = 0;
6246 return true;
6247 }
6248 *pos = nbit;
6249
6250 --nbit;
6251 nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
6252 bit_pos = (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
6253
6254 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(bit_pos);
6255 w = (~~block[nword]) & mask_l;
6256 if (w)
6257 {
6258 bit_pos = bm::bit_scan_reverse32(w);
6259 *pos = unsigned(bit_pos + (nword * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t)))+1);
6260 return true;
6261 }
6262
6263 if (nword)
6264 {
6265 for (--nword; true; --nword)
6266 {
6267 w = ~~block[nword];
6268 if (w)
6269 {
6270 bit_pos = bm::bit_scan_reverse32(w); // trailing zeros
6271 *pos = unsigned(bit_pos + (nword * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t)))+1);
6272 return true;
6273 }
6274 if (!nword)
6275 break;
6276 } // for nword
6277 }
6278
6279 // 0 not found, all block is 1s...
6280 *pos = 0;
6281 return true;
6282}
6283
6284/**
6285 \brief Reverse search for the previous 1 bit
6286 \param block - BIT buffer
6287 \param nbit - bit index to start checking from
6288 \param pos - [out] found value
6289
6290 \return false if not found
6291 @ingroup bitfunc
6292*/
6293inline
6294bool bit_block_find_prev(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
6295 unsigned nbit, unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
6296{
6297 BM_ASSERT(block);
6298 BM_ASSERT(pos);
6299
6300 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
6301 unsigned bit_pos = (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
6302 bm::word_t w = block[nword];
6303 w &= (1u << bit_pos);
6304 if (w)
6305 {
6306 *pos = unsigned(bit_pos + (nword * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t))));
6307 return true;
6308 }
6309
6310 if (!nbit)
6311 return false;
6312
6313 --nbit;
6314 nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
6315 bit_pos = (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
6316
6317 unsigned mask_l = bm::mask_l_u32(bit_pos);
6318 w = block[nword] & mask_l;
6319 if (w)
6320 {
6321 bit_pos = bm::bit_scan_reverse32(w);
6322 *pos = unsigned(bit_pos + (nword * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t))));
6323 return true;
6324 }
6325
6326 if (nword)
6327 {
6328 for (--nword; true; --nword)
6329 {
6330 w = block[nword];
6331 if (w)
6332 {
6333 bit_pos = bm::bit_scan_reverse32(w); // trailing zeros
6334 *pos =
6335 unsigned(bit_pos + (nword * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t))));
6336 return true;
6337 }
6338 if (!nword)
6339 break;
6340 } // for nword
6341 }
6342 return false;
6343}
6344
6345
6346// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6347
6348/*! @brief Find start of the current 111 interval
6349 @return search result code 0 - not found, 1 found, 2 - found at the start
6350 @internal
6351*/
6352inline
6353unsigned block_find_interval_start(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
6354 unsigned nbit_from,
6355 unsigned* BMRESTRICT found_nbit) BMNOEXCEPT
6356{
6357 BM_ASSERT(block && found_nbit);
6358 BM_ASSERT(nbit_from < bm::gap_max_bits);
6359 bool b;
6360 if (BM_IS_GAP(block))
6361 {
6362 const bm::gap_word_t* gap = BMGAP_PTR(block);
6363 b = bm::gap_find_interval_start(gap, nbit_from, found_nbit);
6364 if (b && *found_nbit == 0)
6365 return 2; // start of block, keep searching
6366 }
6367 else // bit-block
6368 {
