6369 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(block))
6370 {
6371 *found_nbit = 0;
6372 return 2;
6373 }
6374 b = bm::bit_block_find_interval_start(block, nbit_from, found_nbit);
6375 if (b && *found_nbit == 0)
6376 return 2; // start of block, keep searching
6377 }
6378 return b;
6379}
6380
6381// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6382
6383/*! @brief Reverse find 1
6384 @return search result code 0 - not found, 1 found
6385 @internal
6386*/
6387inline
6388bool block_find_reverse(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
6389 unsigned nbit_from,
6390 unsigned* BMRESTRICT found_nbit) BMNOEXCEPT
6391{
6392 BM_ASSERT(block && found_nbit);
6393 BM_ASSERT(nbit_from < bm::gap_max_bits);
6394 bool b;
6395 if (BM_IS_GAP(block))
6396 {
6397 b = bm::gap_find_prev(BMGAP_PTR(block), nbit_from, found_nbit);
6398 }
6399 else // bit-block
6400 {
6401 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(block))
6402 {
6403 *found_nbit = nbit_from;
6404 return true;
6405 }
6406 b = bm::bit_block_find_prev(block, nbit_from, found_nbit);
6407 }
6408 return b;
6409}
6410
6411// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6412
6413/*! @brief Returns "true" if one bit is set in the block [left, right]
6414 Function check for block varieties
6415 @internal
6416*/
6417inline
6418bool block_any_range(const bm::word_t* const BMRESTRICT block,
6419 unsigned left, unsigned right) BMNOEXCEPT
6420{
6421 BM_ASSERT(left <= right);
6422 BM_ASSERT(right < bm::gap_max_bits);
6423 if (!block)
6424 return false;
6425 if (BM_IS_GAP(block))
6426 return bm::gap_any_range(BMGAP_PTR(block), left, right);
6427 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(block))
6428 return true;
6429 return bm::bit_block_any_range(block, left, right);
6430}
6431
6432// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6433
6434/*! @brief Returns "true" if one bit is set in the block
6435 Function check for block varieties
6436 @internal
6437*/
6438inline
6439bool block_any(const bm::word_t* const BMRESTRICT block) BMNOEXCEPT
6440{
6441 if (!block)
6442 return false;
6443 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(block))
6444 return true;
6445 bool all_zero = (BM_IS_GAP(block)) ?
6446 bm::gap_is_all_zero(BMGAP_PTR(block))
6447 : bm::bit_is_all_zero(block);
6448 return !all_zero;
6449}
6450
6451
6452
6453// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6454
6455// GAP blocks manipulation functions:
6456
6457
6458/*!
6459 \brief GAP AND operation.
6460
6461 Function performs AND logical operation on gap vectors.
6462 If possible function put the result into vect1 and returns this
6463 pointer. Otherwise result is put into tmp_buf, which should be
6464 twice of the vector size.
6465
6466 \param vect1 - operand 1
6467 \param vect2 - operand 2
6468 \param tmp_buf - pointer on temporary buffer
6469 \param dsize - out size of the destination
6470 \return Result pointer (tmp_buf OR vect1)
6471
6472 @ingroup gapfunc
6473*/
6474inline
6475gap_word_t* gap_operation_and(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6476 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2,
6477 gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT tmp_buf,
6478 unsigned& dsize) BMNOEXCEPT
6479{
6480 bm::gap_buff_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::and_func>(
6481 tmp_buf, vect1, 0, vect2, 0, dsize);
6482 return tmp_buf;
6483}
6484
6485/*!
6486 \brief GAP AND operation test.
6487
6488 Function performs AND logical operation on gap vectors.
6489 If possible function put the result into vect1 and returns this
6490 pointer. Otherwise result is put into tmp_buf, which should be
6491 twice of the vector size.
6492
6493 \param vect1 - operand 1
6494 \param vect2 - operand 2
6495 \return non zero value if operation returns any 1 bit
6496
6497 @ingroup gapfunc
6498*/
6499inline
6500unsigned gap_operation_any_and(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6501 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2) BMNOEXCEPT
6502{
6503 return gap_buff_any_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::and_func>(vect1, 0, vect2, 0);
6504}
6505
6506
6507/*!
6508 \brief GAP bitcount AND operation test.
6509
6510 \param vect1 - operand 1
6511 \param vect2 - operand 2
6512 \return bitcount of vect1 AND vect2
6513
6514 @ingroup gapfunc
6515*/
6516inline
6517unsigned gap_count_and(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6518 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2) BMNOEXCEPT
6519{
6520 return bm::gap_buff_count_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::and_func>(vect1, vect2);
6521}
6522
6523
6524
6525/*!
6526 \brief GAP XOR operation.
6527
6528 Function performs XOR logical operation on gap vectors.
6529 If possible function put the result into vect1 and returns this
6530 pointer. Otherwise result is put into tmp_buf, which should be
6531 twice of the vector size.
6532
6533 \param vect1 - operand 1
6534 \param vect2 - operand 2
6535 \param tmp_buf - pointer on temporary buffer
6536 \param dsize - out destination size
6537 \return Result pointer (tmp_buf)
6538
6539 @ingroup gapfunc
6540*/
6541inline
6542gap_word_t* gap_operation_xor(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6543 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2,
6544 gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT tmp_buf,
6545 unsigned& dsize) BMNOEXCEPT
6546{
6547 bm::gap_buff_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::xor_func>(
6548 tmp_buf, vect1, 0, vect2, 0, dsize);
6549 return tmp_buf;
6550}
6551
6552/*! Light weight gap_operation_xor for len prediction
6553 @ingroup gapfunc
6554*/
6555/*
6556inline
6557bool gap_operation_dry_xor(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6558 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2,
6559 unsigned& dsize,
6560 unsigned limit) BMNOEXCEPT
6561{
6562 return
6563 bm::gap_buff_dry_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::xor_func>(vect1, vect2, dsize, limit);
6564}
6565*/
6566
6567/*!
6568 \brief GAP XOR operation test.
6569
6570 Function performs AND logical operation on gap vectors.
6571 If possible function put the result into vect1 and returns this
6572 pointer. Otherwise result is put into tmp_buf, which should be
6573 twice of the vector size.
6574
6575 \param vect1 - operand 1
6576 \param vect2 - operand 2
6577 \return non zero value if operation returns any 1 bit
6578
6579 @ingroup gapfunc
6580*/
6581BMFORCEINLINE
6582unsigned gap_operation_any_xor(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6583 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2) BMNOEXCEPT
6584{
6585 return gap_buff_any_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::xor_func>(vect1, 0, vect2, 0);
6586}
6587
6588/*!
6589 \brief GAP bitcount XOR operation test.
6590
6591 \param vect1 - operand 1
6592 \param vect2 - operand 2
6593 \return bitcount of vect1 XOR vect2
6594
6595 @ingroup gapfunc
6596*/
6597BMFORCEINLINE
6598unsigned gap_count_xor(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6599 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2) BMNOEXCEPT
6600{
6601 return bm::gap_buff_count_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::xor_func>(vect1, vect2);
6602}
6603
6604
6605/*!
6606 \brief GAP OR operation.
6607
6608 Function performs OR logical oparation on gap vectors.
6609 If possible function put the result into vect1 and returns this
6610 pointer. Otherwise result is put into tmp_buf, which should be
6611 twice of the vector size.
6612
6613 \param vect1 - operand 1
6614 \param vect2 - operand 2
6615 \param tmp_buf - pointer on temporary buffer
6616 \param dsize - out destination size
6617
6618 \return Result pointer (tmp_buf)
6619
6620 @ingroup gapfunc
6621*/
6622inline
6623gap_word_t* gap_operation_or(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6624 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2,
6625 gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT tmp_buf,
6626 unsigned& dsize) BMNOEXCEPT
6627{
6628 bm::gap_buff_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::and_func>(tmp_buf, vect1, 1, vect2, 1, dsize);
6629 bm::gap_invert(tmp_buf);
6630 return tmp_buf;
6631}
6632
6633/*!
6634 \brief GAP bitcount OR operation test.
6635
6636 \param vect1 - operand 1
6637 \param vect2 - operand 2
6638 \return bitcount of vect1 OR vect2
6639
6640 @ingroup gapfunc
6641*/
6642BMFORCEINLINE
6643unsigned gap_count_or(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6644 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2) BMNOEXCEPT
6645{
6646 return gap_buff_count_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::or_func>(vect1, vect2);
6647}
6648
6649
6650
6651/*!
6652 \brief GAP SUB (AND NOT) operation.
6653
6654 Function performs SUB logical operation on gap vectors.
6655 If possible function put the result into vect1 and returns this
6656 pointer. Otherwise result is put into tmp_buf, which should be
6657 twice of the vector size.
6658
6659 \param vect1 - operand 1
6660 \param vect2 - operand 2
6661 \param tmp_buf - pointer on temporary buffer
6662 \param dsize - out destination size
6663
6664 \return Result pointer (tmp_buf)
6665
6666 @ingroup gapfunc
6667*/
6668inline
6669gap_word_t* gap_operation_sub(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6670 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2,
6671 gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT tmp_buf,
6672 unsigned& dsize) BMNOEXCEPT
6673{
6674 bm::gap_buff_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::and_func>( // no bug here
6675 tmp_buf, vect1, 0, vect2, 1, dsize);
6676 return tmp_buf;
6677}
6678
6679
6680/*!
6681 \brief GAP SUB operation test.
6682
6683 Function performs AND logical operation on gap vectors.
6684 If possible function put the result into vect1 and returns this
6685 pointer. Otherwise result is put into tmp_buf, which should be
6686 twice of the vector size.
6687
6688 \param vect1 - operand 1
6689 \param vect2 - operand 2
6690 \return non zero value if operation returns any 1 bit
6691
6692 @ingroup gapfunc
6693*/
6694inline
6695unsigned gap_operation_any_sub(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6696 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2) BMNOEXCEPT
6697{
6698 return
6699 bm::gap_buff_any_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::and_func>( // no bug here
6700 vect1, 0, vect2, 1);
6701}
6702
6703
6704/*!
6705\brief GAP bitcount SUB (AND NOT) operation test.
6706
6707\param vect1 - operand 1
6708\param vect2 - operand 2
6709\return bitcount of vect1 SUB (AND NOT) vect2
6710
6711@ingroup gapfunc
6712*/
6713BMFORCEINLINE
6714unsigned gap_count_sub(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect1,
6715 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT vect2) BMNOEXCEPT
6716{
6717 return bm::gap_buff_count_op<bm::gap_word_t, bm::sub_func>(vect1, vect2);
6718}
6719
6720
6721// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
6722
6723// BIT blocks manipulation functions:
6724
6725
6726/*!
6727 \brief Bitblock copy operation.
6728 \param dst [out] - destination block.
6729 \param src [in] - source block.
6730
6731 @ingroup bitfunc
6732*/
6733inline
6734void bit_block_copy(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
6735 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
6736{
6737#ifdef BMVECTOPT
6738 VECT_COPY_BLOCK(dst, src);
6739#else
6740 ::memcpy(dst, src, bm::set_block_size * sizeof(bm::word_t));
6741#endif
6742}
6743
6744/*!
6745 \brief Bitblock copy operation (unaligned src)
6746 \param dst [out] - destination block.
6747 \param src [in] - source block.
6748
6749 @ingroup bitfunc
6750*/
6751inline
6752void bit_block_copy_unalign(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
6753 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
6754{
6755#ifdef VECT_COPY_BLOCK_UNALIGN
6756 VECT_COPY_BLOCK_UNALIGN(dst, src);
6757#else
6758 ::memcpy(dst, src, bm::set_block_size * sizeof(bm::word_t));
6759#endif
6760}
6761
6762
6763
6764/*!
6765 \brief Bitblock copy/stream operation.
6766
6767 \param dst - destination block.
6768 \param src - source block.
6769
6770 @ingroup bitfunc
6771*/
6772inline
6773void bit_block_stream(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
6774 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
6775{
6776#ifdef VECT_STREAM_BLOCK
6777 VECT_STREAM_BLOCK(dst, src);
6778#else
6779 ::memcpy(dst, src, bm::set_block_size * sizeof(bm::word_t));
6780#endif
6781}
6782
6783/*!
6784 \brief Bitblock copy/stream operation (unaligned src)
6785 \param dst [out] - destination block.
6786 \param src [in] - source block (unaligned address)
6787
6788 @ingroup bitfunc
6789*/
6790inline
6791void bit_block_stream_unalign(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
6792 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
6793{
6794#ifdef VECT_STREAM_BLOCK_UNALIGN
6795 VECT_STREAM_BLOCK_UNALIGN(dst, src);
6796#else
6797 ::memcpy(dst, src, bm::set_block_size * sizeof(bm::word_t));
6798#endif
6799}
6800
6801
6802
6803/*!
6804 \brief Plain bitblock AND operation.
6805 Function does not analyse availability of source and destination blocks.
6806
6807 \param dst - destination block.
6808 \param src - source block.
6809
6810 \return 0 if AND operation did not produce anything (no 1s in the output)
6811
6812 @ingroup bitfunc
6813*/
6814inline
6815bm::id64_t bit_block_and(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
6816 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
6817{
6818 BM_ASSERT(dst);
6819 BM_ASSERT(src);
6820 BM_ASSERT(dst != src);
6821
6822#ifdef BMVECTOPT
6823 bm::id64_t acc = VECT_AND_BLOCK(dst, src);
6824#else
6825 unsigned arr_sz = bm::set_block_size / 2;
6826 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u = (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)src;
6827 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT dst_u = (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)dst;
6828 bm::id64_t acc = 0;
6829 for (unsigned i = 0; i < arr_sz; i+=4)
6830 {
6831 acc |= (dst_u->w64[i] &= src_u->w64[i]) |
6832 (dst_u->w64[i+1] &= src_u->w64[i+1]) |
6833 (dst_u->w64[i+2] &= src_u->w64[i+2]) |
6834 (dst_u->w64[i+3] &= src_u->w64[i+3]);
6835 }
6836#endif
6837 return acc;
6838}
6839
6840/*!
6841 \brief digest based bit-block AND
6842
6843 \param dst - destination block.
6844 \param src - source block.
6845 \param digest - known digest of dst block
6846
6847 \return new digest
6848
6849 @ingroup bitfunc
6850*/
6851inline
6852bm::id64_t bit_block_and(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
6853 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src,
6854 bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
6855{
6856 BM_ASSERT(dst);
6857 BM_ASSERT(src);
6858 BM_ASSERT(dst != src);
6859
6860 const bm::id64_t mask(1ull);
6861 bm::id64_t d = digest;
6862 while (d)
6863 {
6864 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(d); // d & -d;
6865
6866 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
6867 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
6868
6869 #if defined(VECT_AND_DIGEST)
6870 bool all_zero = VECT_AND_DIGEST(&dst[off], &src[off]);
6871 if (all_zero)
6872 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
6873 #else
6874 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u = (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src[off]);
6875 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT dst_u = (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&dst[off]);
6876
6877 bm::id64_t acc = 0;
6878 unsigned j = 0;
6879 do
6880 {
6881 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+0] &= src_u->w64[j+0];
6882 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+1] &= src_u->w64[j+1];
6883 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+2] &= src_u->w64[j+2];
6884 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+3] &= src_u->w64[j+3];
6885 j+=4;
6886 } while (j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size/2);
6887
6888 if (!acc) // all zero
6889 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
6890 #endif
6891
6892 d = bm::bmi_bslr_u64(d); // d &= d - 1;
6893 } // while
6894
6895 return digest;
6896}
6897
6898
6899/*!
6900 \brief digest based bit-block AND 5-way
6901
6902 \return new digest
6903
6904 @ingroup bitfunc
6905*/
6906inline
6907bm::id64_t bit_block_and_5way(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
6908 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src0,
6909 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
6910 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2,
6911 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src3,
6912 bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
6913{
6914 BM_ASSERT(dst);
6915 BM_ASSERT(src0 && src1 && src2 && src3);
6916
6917 const bm::id64_t mask(1ull);
6918 bm::id64_t d = digest;
6919 while (d)
6920 {
6921 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(d); // d & -d;
6922
6923 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
6924 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
6925
6926#if defined(VECT_AND_DIGEST_5WAY)
6927 bool all_zero = VECT_AND_DIGEST_5WAY(&dst[off], &src0[off], &src1[off], &src2[off], &src3[off]);
6928 if (all_zero)
6929 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
6930#else
6931 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u0 = (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src0[off]);
6932 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u1 = (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src1[off]);
6933 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u2 = (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src2[off]);
6934 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u3 = (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src3[off]);
6935 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT dst_u = (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&dst[off]);
6936
6937 bm::id64_t acc = 0;
6938 unsigned j = 0;
6939 do
6940 {
6941 acc |= dst_u->w64[j + 0] &= src_u0->w64[j + 0] & src_u1->w64[j + 0] & src_u2->w64[j + 0] & src_u3->w64[j + 0];
6942 acc |= dst_u->w64[j + 1] &= src_u0->w64[j + 1] & src_u1->w64[j + 1] & src_u2->w64[j + 1] & src_u3->w64[j + 1];
6943 acc |= dst_u->w64[j + 2] &= src_u0->w64[j + 2] & src_u1->w64[j + 2] & src_u2->w64[j + 2] & src_u3->w64[j + 2];
6944 acc |= dst_u->w64[j + 3] &= src_u0->w64[j + 3] & src_u1->w64[j + 3] & src_u2->w64[j + 3] & src_u3->w64[j + 3];
6945 j += 4;
6946 } while (j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size / 2);
6947
6948 if (!acc) // all zero
6949 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
6950#endif
6951
6952 d = bm::bmi_bslr_u64(d); // d &= d - 1;
6953 } // while
6954
6955 return digest;
6956}
6957
6958
6959/*!
6960 \brief digest based bit-block AND
6961
6962 dst = src1 AND src2
6963
6964 \param dst - destination block.
6965 \param src1 - source block.
6966 \param src2 - source block.
6967 \param digest - known initial digest
6968
6969 \return new digest
6970
6971 @ingroup bitfunc
6972*/
6973inline
6974bm::id64_t bit_block_and_2way(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
6975 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
6976 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2,
6977 bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
6978{
6979 BM_ASSERT(dst);
6980 BM_ASSERT(src1 && src2);
6981 BM_ASSERT(dst != src1 && dst != src2);
6982
6983 const bm::id64_t mask(1ull);
6984 bm::id64_t d = digest;
6985 while (d)
6986 {
6987 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(d); // d & -d;
6988
6989 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
6990 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
6991
6992 #if defined(VECT_AND_DIGEST_2WAY)
6993 bool all_zero = VECT_AND_DIGEST_2WAY(&dst[off], &src1[off], &src2[off]);
6994 if (all_zero)
6995 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
6996 #else
6997 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u1 =
6998 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src1[off]);
6999 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u2 =
7000 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src2[off]);
7001 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT dst_u =
7002 (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&dst[off]);
7003
7004 bm::id64_t acc = 0;
7005 unsigned j = 0;
7006 do
7007 {
7008 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+0] = src_u1->w64[j+0] & src_u2->w64[j+0];
7009 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+1] = src_u1->w64[j+1] & src_u2->w64[j+1];
7010 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+2] = src_u1->w64[j+2] & src_u2->w64[j+2];
7011 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+3] = src_u1->w64[j+3] & src_u2->w64[j+3];
7012 j+=4;
7013 } while (j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size/2);
7014
7015 if (!acc) // all zero
7016 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
7017 #endif
7018
7019 d = bm::bmi_bslr_u64(d); // d &= d - 1;
7020 } // while
7021
7022 return digest;
7023}
7024
7025
7026/*!
7027 \brief digest based bit-block AND - OR
7028
7029 dst =dst OR (src1 AND src2)
7030
7031 \param dst - destination block.
7032 \param src1 - source block.
7033 \param src2 - source block.
7034 \param digest - known initial digest
7035
7036 \return new digest (for the AND operation)
7037
7038 @ingroup bitfunc
7039*/
7040inline
7041bm::id64_t bit_block_and_or_2way(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7042 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7043 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2,
7044 bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
7045{
7046 BM_ASSERT(dst);
7047 BM_ASSERT(src1 && src2);
7048 BM_ASSERT(dst != src1 && dst != src2);
7049
7050 const bm::id64_t mask(1ull);
7051 bm::id64_t d = digest;
7052 while (d)
7053 {
7054 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(d); // d & -d;
7055
7056 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
7057 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
7058
7059 #if defined(VECT_AND_OR_DIGEST_2WAY)
7060 bool all_zero =
7061 VECT_AND_OR_DIGEST_2WAY(&dst[off], &src1[off], &src2[off]);
7062 if (all_zero)
7063 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
7064 #else
7065 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u1 =
7066 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src1[off]);
7067 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u2 =
7068 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src2[off]);
7069 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT dst_u =
7070 (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&dst[off]);
7071
7072 bm::id64_t acc = 0;
7073 unsigned j = 0;
7074 do
7075 {
7076 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+0] |= src_u1->w64[j+0] & src_u2->w64[j+0];
7077 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+1] |= src_u1->w64[j+1] & src_u2->w64[j+1];
7078 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+2] |= src_u1->w64[j+2] & src_u2->w64[j+2];
7079 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+3] |= src_u1->w64[j+3] & src_u2->w64[j+3];
7080 j+=4;
7081 } while (j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size/2);
7082
7083 if (!acc) // all zero
7084 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
7085 #endif
7086
7087 d = bm::bmi_bslr_u64(d); // d &= d - 1;
7088 } // while
7089
7090 return digest;
7091}
7092
7093
7094
7095/*!
7096 \brief Function ANDs two bitblocks and computes the bitcount.
7097 Function does not analyse availability of source blocks.
7098
7099 \param src1 - first bit block
7100 \param src2 - second bit block
7101
7102 @ingroup bitfunc
7103*/
7104inline
7105unsigned bit_block_and_count(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7106 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7107{
7108 unsigned count;
7109 const bm::word_t* src1_end = src1 + bm::set_block_size;
7110#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7111 count = VECT_BITCOUNT_AND(src1, src1_end, src2);
7112#else
7113 count = 0;
7114# ifdef BM64OPT
7115 const bm::id64_t* b1 = (bm::id64_t*) src1;
7116 const bm::id64_t* b1_end = (bm::id64_t*) src1_end;
7117 const bm::id64_t* b2 = (bm::id64_t*) src2;
7118 do
7119 {
7120 count += bm::bitcount64_4way(b1[0] & b2[0],
7121 b1[1] & b2[1],
7122 b1[2] & b2[2],
7123 b1[3] & b2[3]);
7124 b1 += 4; b2 += 4;
7125 } while (b1 < b1_end);
7126# else
7127 do
7128 {
7129 count +=
7130 bm::word_bitcount(src1[0] & src2[0]) +
7131 bm::word_bitcount(src1[1] & src2[1]) +
7132 bm::word_bitcount(src1[2] & src2[2]) +
7133 bm::word_bitcount(src1[3] & src2[3]);
7134 src1+=4; src2+=4;
7135 } while (src1 < src1_end);
7136# endif
7137#endif
7138 return count;
7139}
7140
7141
7142/*!
7143 \brief Function ANDs two bitblocks and tests for any bit.
7144 Function does not analyse availability of source blocks.
7145
7146 \param src1 - first bit block
7147 \param src2 - second bit block
7148
7149 @ingroup bitfunc
7150*/
7151inline
7152unsigned bit_block_and_any(const bm::word_t* src1,
7153 const bm::word_t* src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7154{
7155 unsigned count = 0;
7156 const bm::word_t* src1_end = src1 + bm::set_block_size;
7157 do
7158 {
7159 count = (src1[0] & src2[0]) |
7160 (src1[1] & src2[1]) |
7161 (src1[2] & src2[2]) |
7162 (src1[3] & src2[3]);
7163 src1+=4; src2+=4;
7164 } while ((src1 < src1_end) && !count);
7165 return count;
7166}
7167
7168
7169
7170
7171/*!
7172 \brief Function XORs two bitblocks and computes the bitcount.
7173 Function does not analyse availability of source blocks.
7174
7175 \param src1 - first bit block
7176 \param src2 - second bit block
7177
7178 @ingroup bitfunc
7179*/
7180inline
7181unsigned bit_block_xor_count(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7182 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7183{
7184 unsigned count;
7185 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1_end = src1 + bm::set_block_size;
7186#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7187 count = VECT_BITCOUNT_XOR(src1, src1_end, src2);
7188#else
7189 count = 0;
7190# ifdef BM64OPT
7191 const bm::id64_t* b1 = (bm::id64_t*) src1;
7192 const bm::id64_t* b1_end = (bm::id64_t*) src1_end;
7193 const bm::id64_t* b2 = (bm::id64_t*) src2;
7194 do
7195 {
7196 count += bitcount64_4way(b1[0] ^ b2[0],
7197 b1[1] ^ b2[1],
7198 b1[2] ^ b2[2],
7199 b1[3] ^ b2[3]);
7200 b1 += 4;
7201 b2 += 4;
7202 } while (b1 < b1_end);
7203# else
7204 do
7205 {
7206 count +=
7207 bm::word_bitcount(src1[0] ^ src2[0]) +
7208 bm::word_bitcount(src1[1] ^ src2[1]) +
7209 bm::word_bitcount(src1[2] ^ src2[2]) +
7210 bm::word_bitcount(src1[3] ^ src2[3]);
7211 src1+=4; src2+=4;
7212 } while (src1 < src1_end);
7213# endif
7214#endif
7215 return count;
7216}
7217
7218
7219/*!
7220 \brief Function XORs two bitblocks and and tests for any bit.
7221 Function does not analyse availability of source blocks.
7222
7223 \param src1 - first bit block.
7224 \param src2 - second bit block.
7225
7226 @ingroup bitfunc
7227*/
7228inline
7229unsigned bit_block_xor_any(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7230 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7231{
7232 unsigned count = 0;
7233 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1_end = src1 + bm::set_block_size;
7234 do
7235 {
7236 count = (src1[0] ^ src2[0]) |
7237 (src1[1] ^ src2[1]) |
7238 (src1[2] ^ src2[2]) |
7239 (src1[3] ^ src2[3]);
7240 src1+=4; src2+=4;
7241 } while (!count && (src1 < src1_end));
7242 return count;
7243}
7244
7245/*!
7246 \brief Function SUBs two bitblocks and computes the bitcount.
7247 Function does not analyse availability of source blocks.
7248
7249 \param src1 - first bit block.
7250 \param src2 - second bit block.
7251
7252 @ingroup bitfunc
7253*/
7254inline
7255unsigned bit_block_sub_count(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7256 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7257{
7258 unsigned count;
7259 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1_end = src1 + bm::set_block_size;
7260#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7261 count = VECT_BITCOUNT_SUB(src1, src1_end, src2);
7262#else
7263 count = 0;
7264# ifdef BM64OPT
7265 const bm::id64_t* b1 = (bm::id64_t*) src1;
7266 const bm::id64_t* b1_end = (bm::id64_t*) src1_end;
7267 const bm::id64_t* b2 = (bm::id64_t*) src2;
7268 do
7269 {
7270 count += bitcount64_4way(b1[0] & ~b2[0],
7271 b1[1] & ~b2[1],
7272 b1[2] & ~b2[2],
7273 b1[3] & ~b2[3]);
7274 b1 += 4; b2 += 4;
7275 } while (b1 < b1_end);
7276# else
7277 do
7278 {
7279 count +=
7280 bm::word_bitcount(src1[0] & ~src2[0]) +
7281 bm::word_bitcount(src1[1] & ~src2[1]) +
7282 bm::word_bitcount(src1[2] & ~src2[2]) +
7283 bm::word_bitcount(src1[3] & ~src2[3]);
7284 src1+=4; src2+=4;
7285 } while (src1 < src1_end);
7286# endif
7287#endif
7288 return count;
7289}
7290
7291/*!
7292 \brief Function SUBs two bitblocks and and tests for any bit.
7293 Function does not analyse availability of source blocks.
7294
7295 \param src1 - first bit block.
7296 \param src2 - second bit block.
7297
7298 @ingroup bitfunc
7299*/
7300inline
7301unsigned bit_block_sub_any(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7302 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7303{
7304 unsigned count = 0;
7305 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1_end = src1 + bm::set_block_size;
7306
7307 do
7308 {
7309 count = (src1[0] & ~~src2[0]) |
7310 (src1[1] & ~src2[1]) |
7311 (src1[2] & ~~src2[2]) |
7312 (src1[3] & ~src2[3]);
7313 src1+=4; src2+=4;
7314 } while ((src1 < src1_end) && (count == 0));
7315 return count;
7316}
7317
7318
7319/*!
7320 \brief Function ORs two bitblocks and computes the bitcount.
7321 Function does not analyse availability of source blocks.
7322
7323 \param src1 - first bit block
7324 \param src2 - second bit block.
7325
7326 @ingroup bitfunc
7327*/
7328inline
7329unsigned bit_block_or_count(const bm::word_t* src1,
7330 const bm::word_t* src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7331{
7332 unsigned count;
7333 const bm::word_t* src1_end = src1 + bm::set_block_size;
7334#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7335 count = VECT_BITCOUNT_OR(src1, src1_end, src2);
7336#else
7337 count = 0;
7338# ifdef BM64OPT
7339 const bm::id64_t* b1 = (bm::id64_t*) src1;
7340 const bm::id64_t* b1_end = (bm::id64_t*) src1_end;
7341 const bm::id64_t* b2 = (bm::id64_t*) src2;
7342 do
7343 {
7344 count += bitcount64_4way(b1[0] | b2[0],
7345 b1[1] | b2[1],
7346 b1[2] | b2[2],
7347 b1[3] | b2[3]);
7348 b1 += 4;
7349 b2 += 4;
7350 } while (b1 < b1_end);
7351# else
7352 do
7353 {
7354 count +=
7355 bm::word_bitcount(src1[0] | src2[0]) +
7356 bm::word_bitcount(src1[1] | src2[1]) +
7357 bm::word_bitcount(src1[2] | src2[2]) +
7358 bm::word_bitcount(src1[3] | src2[3]);
7359 src1+=4; src2+=4;
7360 } while (src1 < src1_end);
7361# endif
7362#endif
7363 return count;
7364}
7365
7366/*!
7367 \brief Function ORs two bitblocks and and tests for any bit.
7368 Function does not analyse availability of source blocks.
7369
7370 \param src1 - first bit block.
7371 \param src2 - second bit block.
7372
7373 @ingroup bitfunc
7374*/
7375inline
7376unsigned bit_block_or_any(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7377 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7378{
7379 unsigned count = 0;
7380 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1_end = src1 + bm::set_block_size;
7381 do
7382 {
7383 count = (src1[0] | src2[0]) |
7384 (src1[1] | src2[1]) |
7385 (src1[2] | src2[2]) |
7386 (src1[3] | src2[3]);
7387
7388 src1+=4; src2+=4;
7389 } while (!count && (src1 < src1_end));
7390 return count;
7391}
7392
7393
7394
7395
7396/*!
7397 \brief bitblock AND operation.
7398
7399 \param dst - destination block.
7400 \param src - source block.
7401
7402 \returns pointer on destination block.
7403 If returned value equal to src means that block mutation requested.
7404 NULL is valid return value.
7405
7406 @ingroup bitfunc
7407*/
7408inline
7409bm::word_t* bit_operation_and(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7410 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
7411{
7412 BM_ASSERT(dst || src);
7413 bm::word_t* ret = dst;
7414 if (IS_VALID_ADDR(dst)) // The destination block already exists
7415 {
7416 if (!IS_VALID_ADDR(src))
7417 {
7418 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src))
7419 return 0; //just clean the destination block
7420 }
7421 else
7422 {
7423 if (!bm::bit_block_and(dst, src))
7424 ret = 0;
7425 }
7426 }
7427 else // The destination block does not exist yet
7428 {
7429 if(!IS_VALID_ADDR(src))
7430 {
7431 if(IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src))
7432 return 0; // One argument empty - all result is empty.
7433 // Src block is all ON, dst block remains as it is. nothing to do.
7434 }
7435 else // destination block does not exists, src - valid block
7436 {
7437 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(dst))
7438 return const_cast<bm::word_t*>(src);
7439 // Dst block is all ZERO no combination required. Nothng to do.
7440 }
7441 }
7442 return ret;
7443}
7444
7445
7446/*!
7447 \brief Performs bitblock AND operation and calculates bitcount of the result.
7448
7449 \param src1 - first bit block.
7450 \param src2 - second bit block.
7451
7452 \returns bitcount value
7453
7454 @ingroup bitfunc
7455*/
7456inline
7457bm::id_t bit_operation_and_count(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7458 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7459{
7460 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1) || IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2))
7461 return 0;
7462 if (src1 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7463 src1 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7464 if (src2 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7465 src2 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7466
7467 return bit_block_and_count(src1, src2);
7468}
7469
7470/*!
7471 \brief Performs bitblock AND operation test.
7472
7473 \param src1 - first bit block.
7474 \param src2 - second bit block.
7475
7476 \returns non zero if there is any value
7477
7478 @ingroup bitfunc
7479*/
7480inline
7481bm::id_t bit_operation_and_any(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7482 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7483{
7484 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1) || IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2))
7485 return 0;
7486 if (src1 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7487 src1 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7488 if (src2 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7489 src2 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7490 return bit_block_and_any(src1, src2);
7491}
7492
7493
7494
7495/*!
7496 \brief Performs bitblock SUB operation and calculates bitcount of the result.
7497
7498 \param src1 - first bit block.
7499 \param src2 - second bit block
7500
7501 \returns bitcount value
7502
7503 @ingroup bitfunc
7504*/
7505inline
7506bm::id_t bit_operation_sub_count(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7507 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7508{
7509 if (src1 == src2)
7510 return 0;
7511 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1))
7512 return 0;
7513 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2)) // nothing to diff
7514 {
7515 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(src1))
7516 return bm::gap_max_bits;
7517 return bm::bit_block_count(src1);
7518 }
7519 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(src2))
7520 return 0;
7521
7522 if (src1 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7523 src1 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7524 if (src2 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7525 src2 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7526
7527 return bm::bit_block_sub_count(src1, src2);
7528}
7529
7530
7531/*!
7532 \brief Performs inverted bitblock SUB operation and calculates
7533 bitcount of the result.
7534
7535 \param src1 - first bit block.
7536 \param src2 - second bit block
7537
7538 \returns bitcount value
7539
7540 @ingroup bitfunc
7541*/
7542inline
7543bm::id_t bit_operation_sub_count_inv(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7544 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7545{
7546 return bit_operation_sub_count(src2, src1);
7547}
7548
7549
7550/*!
7551 \brief Performs bitblock test of SUB operation.
7552
7553 \param src1 - first bit block.
7554 \param src2 - second bit block
7555
7556 \returns non zero value if there are any bits
7557
7558 @ingroup bitfunc
7559*/
7560inline
7561bm::id_t bit_operation_sub_any(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7562 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7563{
7564 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1))
7565 return 0;
7566 if (src1 == src2)
7567 return 0;
7568
7569 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2)) // nothing to diff
7570 return !bit_is_all_zero(src1);
7571
7572 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(src2))
7573 return 0;
7574
7575 if (src1 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7576 src1 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7577 if (src2 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7578 src2 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7579
7580 return bm::bit_block_sub_any(src1, src2);
7581}
7582
7583
7584
7585/*!
7586 \brief Performs bitblock OR operation and calculates bitcount of the result.
7587
7588 \param src1 - first bit block.
7589 \param src2 - second bit block.
7590
7591 \returns bitcount value
7592
7593 @ingroup bitfunc
7594*/
7595inline
7596bm::id_t bit_operation_or_count(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7597 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7598{
7599 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(src1) || IS_FULL_BLOCK(src2))
7600 return bm::gap_max_bits;
7601
7602 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1))
7603 {
7604 if (!IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2))
7605 return bm::bit_block_count(src2);
7606 else
7607 return 0; // both blocks are empty
7608 }
7609 else
7610 {
7611 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2))
7612 return bm::bit_block_count(src1);
7613 }
7614 if (src1 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7615 src1 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7616 if (src2 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7617 src2 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7618
7619 return bm::bit_block_or_count(src1, src2);
7620}
7621
7622/*!
7623 \brief Performs bitblock OR operation test.
7624
7625 \param src1 - first bit block.
7626 \param src2 - second bit block.
7627
7628 \returns non zero value if there are any bits
7629
7630 @ingroup bitfunc
7631*/
7632inline
7633bm::id_t bit_operation_or_any(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7634 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7635{
7636 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1))
7637 {
7638 if (!IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2))
7639 return !bit_is_all_zero(src2);
7640 else
7641 return 0; // both blocks are empty
7642 }
7643 else
7644 {
7645 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2))
7646 return !bit_is_all_zero(src1);
7647 }
7648 if (src1 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7649 src1 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7650 if (src2 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
7651 src2 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
7652
7653 return bit_block_or_any(src1, src2);
7654}
7655
7656/*!
7657 \brief Plain bitblock OR operation.
7658 Function does not analyse availability of source and destination blocks.
7659
7660 \param dst - destination block.
7661 \param src - source block.
7662
7663 @ingroup bitfunc
7664*/
7665inline
7666bool bit_block_or(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7667 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
7668{
7669#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7670 return VECT_OR_BLOCK(dst, src);
7671#else
7672 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr = (wordop_t*)src;
7673 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_end = (wordop_t*)(src + bm::set_block_size);
7674 bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT dst_ptr = (wordop_t*)dst;
7675
7676 bm::wordop_t acc = 0;
7677 const bm::wordop_t not_acc = acc = ~~acc;
7678
7679 do
7680 {
7681 acc &= (dst_ptr[0] |= wrd_ptr[0]);
7682 acc &= (dst_ptr[1] |= wrd_ptr[1]);
7683 acc &= (dst_ptr[2] |= wrd_ptr[2]);
7684 acc &= (dst_ptr[3] |= wrd_ptr[3]);
7685
7686 dst_ptr+=4;wrd_ptr+=4;
7687
7688 } while (wrd_ptr < wrd_end);
7689 return acc == not_acc;
7690#endif
7691}
7692
7693/*!
7694 \brief 2 way (target := source1 | source2) bitblock OR operation.
7695 \param dst - dest block [out]
7696 \param src1 - source 1
7697 \param src2 - source 2
7698
7699 @return 1 if produced block of ALL ones
7700 @ingroup bitfunc
7701*/
7702inline
7703bool bit_block_or_2way(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7704 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7705 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7706{
7707#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7708 return VECT_OR_BLOCK_2WAY(dst, src1, src2);
7709#else
7710 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr1 = (wordop_t*)src1;
7711 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_end1 = (wordop_t*)(src1 + set_block_size);
7712 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr2 = (wordop_t*)src2;
7713 bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT dst_ptr = (wordop_t*)dst;
7714
7715 bm::wordop_t acc = 0;
7716 const bm::wordop_t not_acc = acc = ~~acc;
7717 do
7718 {
7719 acc &= (dst_ptr[0] = wrd_ptr1[0] | wrd_ptr2[0]);
7720 acc &= (dst_ptr[1] = wrd_ptr1[1] | wrd_ptr2[1]);
7721 acc &= (dst_ptr[2] = wrd_ptr1[2] | wrd_ptr2[2]);
7722 acc &= (dst_ptr[3] = wrd_ptr1[3] | wrd_ptr2[3]);
7723
7724 dst_ptr+=4; wrd_ptr1+=4; wrd_ptr2+=4;
7725
7726 } while (wrd_ptr1 < wrd_end1);
7727 return acc == not_acc;
7728#endif
7729}
7730
7731
7732/*!
7733 \brief 2 way (target := source1 ^ source2) bitblock XOR operation.
7734 \param dst - dest block [out]
7735 \param src1 - source 1
7736 \param src2 - source 2
7737
7738 @return OR accumulator
7739 @ingroup bitfunc
7740*/
7741inline
7742bm::id64_t bit_block_xor_2way(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7743 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7744 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7745{
7746#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7747 return VECT_XOR_BLOCK_2WAY(dst, src1, src2);
7748#else
7749 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr1 = (wordop_t*)src1;
7750 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_end1 = (wordop_t*)(src1 + set_block_size);
7751 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr2 = (wordop_t*)src2;
7752 bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT dst_ptr = (wordop_t*)dst;
7753
7754 bm::wordop_t acc = 0;
7755 do
7756 {
7757 acc |= (dst_ptr[0] = wrd_ptr1[0] ^ wrd_ptr2[0]);
7758 acc |= (dst_ptr[1] = wrd_ptr1[1] ^ wrd_ptr2[1]);
7759 acc |= (dst_ptr[2] = wrd_ptr1[2] ^ wrd_ptr2[2]);
7760 acc |= (dst_ptr[3] = wrd_ptr1[3] ^ wrd_ptr2[3]);
7761
7762 dst_ptr+=4; wrd_ptr1+=4; wrd_ptr2+=4;
7763
7764 } while (wrd_ptr1 < wrd_end1);
7765 return acc;
7766#endif
7767}
7768
7769
7770/*!
7771 \brief 3 way (target | source1 | source2) bitblock OR operation.
7772 Function does not analyse availability of source and destination blocks.
7773
7774 \param dst - sst-dest block [in,out]
7775 \param src1 - source 1
7776 \param src2 - source 2
7777
7778 @return 1 if produced block of ALL ones
7779
7780 @ingroup bitfunc
7781*/
7782inline
7783bool bit_block_or_3way(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7784 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7785 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
7786{
7787#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7788 return VECT_OR_BLOCK_3WAY(dst, src1, src2);
7789#else
7790 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr1 = (wordop_t*)src1;
7791 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_end1 = (wordop_t*)(src1 + set_block_size);
7792 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr2 = (wordop_t*)src2;
7793 bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT dst_ptr = (wordop_t*)dst;
7794
7795 bm::wordop_t acc = 0;
7796 const bm::wordop_t not_acc = acc = ~~acc;
7797 do
7798 {
7799 acc &= (dst_ptr[0] |= wrd_ptr1[0] | wrd_ptr2[0]);
7800 acc &= (dst_ptr[1] |= wrd_ptr1[1] | wrd_ptr2[1]);
7801 acc &= (dst_ptr[2] |= wrd_ptr1[2] | wrd_ptr2[2]);
7802 acc &= (dst_ptr[3] |= wrd_ptr1[3] | wrd_ptr2[3]);
7803
7804 dst_ptr+=4; wrd_ptr1+=4;wrd_ptr2+=4;
7805
7806 } while (wrd_ptr1 < wrd_end1);
7807 return acc == not_acc;
7808#endif
7809}
7810
7811
7812/*!
7813 \brief 5 way (target, source1, source2) bitblock OR operation.
7814 Function does not analyse availability of source and destination blocks.
7815
7816 \param dst - destination block.
7817 \param src1 - source1, etc
7818 \param src2 - source1, etc
7819 \param src3 - source1, etc
7820 \param src4 - source1, etc
7821
7822 @return 1 if produced block of ALL ones
7823
7824 @ingroup bitfunc
7825*/
7826inline
7827bool bit_block_or_5way(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7828 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
7829 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2,
7830 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src3,
7831 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src4) BMNOEXCEPT
7832{
7833#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7834 return VECT_OR_BLOCK_5WAY(dst, src1, src2, src3, src4);
7835#else
7836 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr1 = (wordop_t*)src1;
7837 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_end1 = (wordop_t*)(src1 + set_block_size);
7838 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr2 = (wordop_t*)src2;
7839 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr3 = (wordop_t*)src3;
7840 const bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT wrd_ptr4 = (wordop_t*)src4;
7841 bm::wordop_t* BMRESTRICT dst_ptr = (wordop_t*)dst;
7842
7843 bm::wordop_t acc = 0;
7844 const bm::wordop_t not_acc = acc = ~~acc;
7845 do
7846 {
7847 acc &= (dst_ptr[0] |= wrd_ptr1[0] | wrd_ptr2[0] | wrd_ptr3[0] | wrd_ptr4[0]);
7848 acc &= (dst_ptr[1] |= wrd_ptr1[1] | wrd_ptr2[1] | wrd_ptr3[1] | wrd_ptr4[1]);
7849 acc &= (dst_ptr[2] |= wrd_ptr1[2] | wrd_ptr2[2] | wrd_ptr3[2] | wrd_ptr4[2]);
7850 acc &= (dst_ptr[3] |= wrd_ptr1[3] | wrd_ptr2[3] | wrd_ptr3[3] | wrd_ptr4[3]);
7851
7852 dst_ptr+=4;
7853 wrd_ptr1+=4;wrd_ptr2+=4;wrd_ptr3+=4;wrd_ptr4+=4;
7854
7855 } while (wrd_ptr1 < wrd_end1);
7856 return acc == not_acc;
7857#endif
7858}
7859
7860
7861
7862
7863/*!
7864 \brief Block OR operation. Makes analysis if block is 0 or FULL.
7865
7866 \param dst - destination block.
7867 \param src - source block.
7868
7869 \returns pointer on destination block.
7870 If returned value equal to src means that block mutation requested.
7871 NULL is valid return value.
7872
7873 @ingroup bitfunc
7874*/
7875inline
7876bm::word_t* bit_operation_or(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7877 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
7878{
7879 BM_ASSERT(dst || src);
7880
7881 bm::word_t* ret = dst;
7882
7883 if (IS_VALID_ADDR(dst)) // The destination block already exists
7884 {
7885 if (!IS_VALID_ADDR(src))
7886 {
7887 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(src))
7888 {
7889 // if the source block is all set
7890 // just set the destination block
7891 ::memset(dst, 0xFF, bm::set_block_size * sizeof(bm::word_t));
7892 }
7893 }
7894 else
7895 {
7896 // Regular operation OR on the whole block
7897 bm::bit_block_or(dst, src);
7898 }
7899 }
7900 else // The destination block does not exist yet
7901 {
7902 if (!IS_VALID_ADDR(src))
7903 {
7904 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(src))
7905 {
7906 // The source block is all set, because dst does not exist
7907 // we can simply replace it.
7908 return const_cast<bm::word_t*>(FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR);
7909 }
7910 }
7911 else
7912 {
7913 if (dst == 0)
7914 {
7915 // The only case when we have to allocate the new block:
7916 // Src is all zero and Dst does not exist
7917 return const_cast<bm::word_t*>(src);
7918 }
7919 }
7920 }
7921 return ret;
7922}
7923
7924/*!
7925 \brief Plain bitblock SUB (AND NOT) operation.
7926 Function does not analyse availability of source and destination blocks.
7927
7928 \param dst - destination block.
7929 \param src - source block.
7930
7931 \return 0 if SUB operation did not produce anything (no 1s in the output)
7932
7933 @ingroup bitfunc
7934*/
7935inline
7936bm::id64_t bit_block_sub(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7937 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
7938{
7939#ifdef BMVECTOPT
7940 bm::id64_t acc = VECT_SUB_BLOCK(dst, src);
7941 return acc;
7942#else
7943 unsigned arr_sz = bm::set_block_size / 2;
7944
7945 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u = (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)src;
7946 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT dst_u = (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)dst;
7947
7948 bm::id64_t acc = 0;
7949 for (unsigned i = 0; i < arr_sz; i+=4)
7950 {
7951 acc |= (dst_u->w64[i] &= ~~src_u->w64[i]) |
7952 (dst_u->w64[i+1] &= ~src_u->w64[i+1]) |
7953 (dst_u->w64[i+2] &= ~~src_u->w64[i+2]) |
7954 (dst_u->w64[i+3] &= ~src_u->w64[i+3]);
7955 }
7956 return acc;
7957#endif
7958}
7959
7960/*!
7961 \brief digest based bitblock SUB (AND NOT) operation
7962
7963 \param dst - destination block.
7964 \param src - source block.
7965 \param digest - known digest of dst block
7966
7967 \return new digest
7968
7969 @ingroup bitfunc
7970*/
7971inline
7972bm::id64_t bit_block_sub(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
7973 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src,
7974 bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
7975{
7976 BM_ASSERT(dst);
7977 BM_ASSERT(src);
7978 BM_ASSERT(dst != src);
7979
7980 const bm::id64_t mask(1ull);
7981
7982 bm::id64_t d = digest;
7983 while (d)
7984 {
7985 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(d); // d & -d;
7986
7987 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
7988 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
7989
7990 #if defined(VECT_SUB_DIGEST)
7991 bool all_zero = VECT_SUB_DIGEST(&dst[off], &src[off]);
7992 if (all_zero)
7993 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
7994 #else
7995 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u = (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src[off]);
7996 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT dst_u = (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&dst[off]);
7997
7998 bm::id64_t acc = 0;
7999 unsigned j = 0;
8000 do
8001 {
8002 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+0] &= ~~src_u->w64[j+0];
8003 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+1] &= ~~src_u->w64[j+1];
8004 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+2] &= ~~src_u->w64[j+2];
8005 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+3] &= ~~src_u->w64[j+3];
8006 j+=4;
8007 } while (j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size/2);
8008
8009 if (!acc) // all zero
8010 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
8011 #endif
8012
8013 d = bm::bmi_bslr_u64(d); // d &= d - 1;
8014 } // while
8015
8016 return digest;
8017}
8018
8019/*!
8020 \brief digest based bitblock SUB (AND NOT) operation (3 operand)
8021
8022 \param dst - destination block.
8023 \param src1 - source block 1
8024 \param src2 - source block 2
8025 \param digest - known digest of dst block
8026
8027 \return new digest
8028
8029 @ingroup bitfunc
8030*/
8031inline
8032bm::id64_t bit_block_sub_2way(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
8033 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
8034 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2,
8035 bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
8036{
8037 BM_ASSERT(dst);
8038 BM_ASSERT(src1 && src2);
8039 BM_ASSERT(dst != src1 && dst != src2);
8040
8041 const bm::id64_t mask(1ull);
8042
8043 bm::id64_t d = digest;
8044 while (d)
8045 {
8046 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(d); // d & -d;
8047
8048 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
8049 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
8050
8051 #if defined(VECT_SUB_DIGEST_2WAY)
8052 bool all_zero = VECT_SUB_DIGEST_2WAY(&dst[off], &src1[off], &src2[off]);
8053 if (all_zero)
8054 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
8055 #else
8056 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u1 =
8057 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src1[off]);
8058 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u2 =
8059 (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&src2[off]);
8060 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT dst_u =
8061 (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)(&dst[off]);
8062
8063 bm::id64_t acc = 0;
8064 unsigned j = 0;
8065 do
8066 {
8067 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+0] = src_u1->w64[j+0] & ~~src_u2->w64[j+0];
8068 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+1] = src_u1->w64[j+1] & ~~src_u2->w64[j+1];
8069 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+2] = src_u1->w64[j+2] & ~~src_u2->w64[j+2];
8070 acc |= dst_u->w64[j+3] = src_u1->w64[j+3] & ~~src_u2->w64[j+3];
8071 j+=4;
8072 } while (j < bm::set_block_digest_wave_size/2);
8073
8074 if (!acc) // all zero
8075 digest &= ~(mask << wave);
8076 #endif
8077
8078 d = bm::bmi_bslr_u64(d); // d &= d - 1;
8079 } // while
8080
8081 return digest;
8082}
8083
8084
8085
8086/*!
8087 \brief bitblock SUB operation.
8088
8089 \param dst - destination block.
8090 \param src - source block.
8091
8092 \returns pointer on destination block.
8093 If returned value equal to src means that block mutation requested.
8094 NULL is valid return value.
8095
8096 @ingroup bitfunc
8097*/
8098inline
8099bm::word_t* bit_operation_sub(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
8100 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
8101{
8102 BM_ASSERT(dst || src);
8103
8104 bm::word_t* ret = dst;
8105 if (IS_VALID_ADDR(dst)) // The destination block already exists
8106 {
8107 if (!IS_VALID_ADDR(src))
8108 {
8109 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(src))
8110 {
8111 // If the source block is all set
8112 // just clean the destination block
8113 return 0;
8114 }
8115 }
8116 else
8117 {
8118 auto any = bm::bit_block_sub(dst, src);
8119 if (!any)
8120 ret = 0;
8121 }
8122 }
8123 else // The destination block does not exist yet
8124 {
8125 if (!IS_VALID_ADDR(src))
8126 {
8127 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(src))
8128 {
8129 // The source block is full
8130 return 0;
8131 }
8132 }
8133 else
8134 {
8135 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(dst))
8136 {
8137 // The only case when we have to allocate the new block:
8138 // dst is all set and src exists
8139 return const_cast<bm::word_t*>(src);
8140 }
8141 }
8142 }
8143 return ret;
8144}
8145
8146
8147/*!
8148 \brief Plain bitblock XOR operation.
8149 Function does not analyse availability of source and destination blocks.
8150
8151 \param dst - destination block.
8152 \param src - source block.
8153
8154 @ingroup bitfunc
8155*/
8156inline
8157bm::id64_t bit_block_xor(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
8158 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
8159{
8160 BM_ASSERT(dst);
8161 BM_ASSERT(src);
8162 BM_ASSERT(dst != src);
8163
8164#ifdef BMVECTOPT
8165 bm::id64_t acc = VECT_XOR_BLOCK(dst, src);
8166#else
8167 unsigned arr_sz = bm::set_block_size / 2;
8168
8169 const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT src_u = (const bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)src;
8170 bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t* BMRESTRICT dst_u = (bm::bit_block_t::bunion_t*)dst;
8171
8172 bm::id64_t acc = 0;
8173 for (unsigned i = 0; i < arr_sz; i+=4)
8174 {
8175 acc |= dst_u->w64[i] ^= src_u->w64[i];
8176 acc |= dst_u->w64[i+1] ^= src_u->w64[i+1];
8177 acc |= dst_u->w64[i+2] ^= src_u->w64[i+2];
8178 acc |= dst_u->w64[i+3] ^= src_u->w64[i+3];
8179 }
8180#endif
8181 return acc;
8182}
8183
8184/*!
8185 \brief bitblock AND NOT with constant ~0 mask operation.
8186
8187 \param dst - destination block.
8188 \param src - source block.
8189
8190 @ingroup bitfunc
8191*/
8192inline
8193void bit_andnot_arr_ffmask(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
8194 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
8195{
8196 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src_end = src + bm::set_block_size;
8197#ifdef BMVECTOPT
8198 VECT_ANDNOT_ARR_2_MASK(dst, src, src_end, ~0u);
8199#else
8200 bm::wordop_t* dst_ptr = (wordop_t*)dst;
8201 const bm::wordop_t* wrd_ptr = (wordop_t*) src;
8202 const bm::wordop_t* wrd_end = (wordop_t*) src_end;
8203
8204 do
8205 {
8206 dst_ptr[0] = bm::all_bits_mask & ~~wrd_ptr[0];
8207 dst_ptr[1] = bm::all_bits_mask & ~~wrd_ptr[1];
8208 dst_ptr[2] = bm::all_bits_mask & ~~wrd_ptr[2];
8209 dst_ptr[3] = bm::all_bits_mask & ~~wrd_ptr[3];
8210 dst_ptr+=4; wrd_ptr+=4;
8211 } while (wrd_ptr < wrd_end);
8212#endif
8213}
8214
8215/*!
8216 \brief bitblock XOR operation.
8217
8218 \param dst - destination block.
8219 \param src - source block.
8220
8221 \returns pointer on destination block.
8222 If returned value equal to src means that block mutation requested.
8223 NULL is valid return value.
8224
8225 @ingroup bitfunc
8226*/
8227inline
8228bm::word_t* bit_operation_xor(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT dst,
8229 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src) BMNOEXCEPT
8230{
8231 BM_ASSERT(dst || src);
8232 if (src == dst) return 0; // XOR rule
8233
8234 bm::word_t* ret = dst;
8235
8236 if (IS_VALID_ADDR(dst)) // The destination block already exists
8237 {
8238 if (!src) return dst;
8239
8240 bit_block_xor(dst, src);
8241 }
8242 else // The destination block does not exist yet
8243 {
8244 if (!src) return dst; // 1 xor 0 = 1
8245
8246 // Here we have two cases:
8247 // if dest block is full or zero if zero we need to copy the source
8248 // otherwise XOR loop against 0xFF...
8249 //BM_ASSERT(dst == 0);
8250 return const_cast<bm::word_t*>(src); // src is the final result
8251 }
8252 return ret;
8253}
8254
8255/*!
8256 \brief Performs bitblock XOR operation and calculates bitcount of the result.
8257
8258 \param src1 - bit block start ptr
8259 \param src2 - second bit block
8260
8261 \returns bitcount value
8262
8263 @ingroup bitfunc
8264*/
8265inline
8266bm::id_t bit_operation_xor_count(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
8267 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
8268{
8269 if (src1 == src2)
8270 return 0;
8271
8272 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1) || IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2))
8273 {
8274 const bm::word_t* block = IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1) ? src2 : src1;
8275 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(block))
8276 return bm::gap_max_bits;
8277 return bm::bit_block_count(block);
8278 }
8279 if (src1 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
8280 src1 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
8281 if (src2 == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
8282 src2 = FULL_BLOCK_REAL_ADDR;
8283
8284 return bit_block_xor_count(src1, src2);
8285}
8286
8287/*!
8288 \brief Performs bitblock XOR operation test.
8289
8290 \param src1 - bit block start ptr
8291 \param src2 - second bit block ptr
8292
8293 \returns non zero value if there are bits
8294
8295 @ingroup bitfunc
8296*/
8297inline
8298bm::id_t bit_operation_xor_any(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src1,
8299 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT src2) BMNOEXCEPT
8300{
8301 if (src1 == src2)
8302 return 0;
8303 if (IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1) || IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src2))
8304 {
8305 const bm::word_t* block = IS_EMPTY_BLOCK(src1) ? src2 : src1;
8306 return !bit_is_all_zero(block);
8307 }
8308 return bm::bit_block_xor_any(src1, src2);
8309}
8310
8311
8312
8313/**
8314 \brief Inspects block for full zero words
8315
8316 \param blk - bit block pointer
8317 \param data_size - data size
8318
8319 \return size of all non-zero words
8320
8321 @ingroup bitfunc
8322*/
8323template<class T>
8324unsigned bit_count_nonzero_size(const T* blk, unsigned data_size) BMNOEXCEPT
8325{
8326 BM_ASSERT(blk && data_size);
8327 unsigned count = 0;
8328 const T* blk_end = blk + data_size - 2;
8329 do
8330 {
8331 if (*blk == 0) // scan fwd to find 0 island length
8332 {
8333 const T* blk_j = blk + 1;
8334 for (; blk_j < blk_end; ++blk_j)
8335 {
8336 if (*blk_j != 0)
8337 break;
8338 } // for
8339 blk = blk_j-1;
8340 count += (unsigned)sizeof(gap_word_t);
8341 }
8342 else
8343 {
8344 const T* blk_j = blk + 1; // scan fwd to find non-0 island len
8345 for ( ; blk_j < blk_end; ++blk_j)
8346 {
8347 if (*blk_j == 0)
8348 {
8349 if (blk_j[1] | blk_j[2]) // look ahead, ignore short 0-run
8350 {
8351 ++blk_j; // skip zero word
8352 continue;
8353 }
8354 break;
8355 }
8356 } // for
8357 count += unsigned(sizeof(gap_word_t));
8358 // count all bit-words now
8359 count += unsigned(blk_j - blk) * unsigned(sizeof(T));
8360 blk = blk_j;
8361 }
8362 ++blk;
8363 }
8364 while(blk < blk_end);
8365 return count + unsigned(2 * sizeof(T));
8366}
8367
8368
8369/**
8370 \brief Searches for the next 1 bit in the BIT block
8371 \param block - BIT buffer
8372 \param nbit - bit index to start checking from
8373 \param pos - [out] found value
8374
8375 \return 0 if not found
8376
8377 @ingroup bitfunc
8378*/
8379inline
8380unsigned bit_block_find(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
8381 unsigned nbit, unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
8382{
8383 BM_ASSERT(block);
8384 BM_ASSERT(pos);
8385
8386 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
8387 unsigned bit_pos = (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
8388
8389 bm::word_t w = block[nword];
8390 w &= (1u << bit_pos);
8391 if (w)
8392 {
8393 *pos = nbit;
8394 return 1;
8395 }
8396 w = block[nword] >> bit_pos;
8397 w <<= bit_pos; // clear the trailing bits
8398 if (w)
8399 {
8400 bit_pos = bm::bit_scan_forward32(w); // trailing zeros
8401 *pos = unsigned(bit_pos + (nword * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t))));
8402 return 1;
8403 }
8404
8405 for (unsigned i = nword+1; i < bm::set_block_size; ++i)
8406 {
8407 w = block[i];
8408 if (w)
8409 {
8410 bit_pos = bm::bit_scan_forward32(w); // trailing zeros
8411 *pos = unsigned(bit_pos + (i * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t))));
8412 return w;
8413 }
8414 } // for i
8415 return 0u;
8416}
8417
8418
8419
8420
8421/*!
8422 \brief BIT block find the last set bit (backward search)
8423
8424 \param block - bit block buffer pointer
8425 \param last - index of the last 1 bit (out)
8426 \return true if found
8427
8428 @ingroup bitfunc
8429*/
8430inline
8431unsigned bit_find_last(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
8432 unsigned* BMRESTRICT last) BMNOEXCEPT
8433{
8434 BM_ASSERT(block);
8435 BM_ASSERT(last);
8436
8437 // TODO: SIMD version
8438
8439 for (unsigned i = bm::set_block_size-1; true; --i)
8440 {
8441 bm::word_t w = block[i];
8442 if (w)
8443 {
8444 unsigned idx = bm::bit_scan_reverse(w);
8445 *last = unsigned(idx + (i * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t))));
8446 return w;
8447 }
8448 if (i == 0)
8449 break;
8450 } // for i
8451 return 0u;
8452}
8453
8454/*!
8455 \brief BIT block find the first set bit
8456
8457 \param block - bit block buffer pointer
8458 \param pos - index of the first 1 bit (out)
8459 \return 0 if not found
8460
8461 @ingroup bitfunc
8462 @internal
8463*/
8464inline
8465bool bit_find_first(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
8466 unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
8467{
8468 BM_ASSERT(block);
8469 BM_ASSERT(pos);
8470
8471#ifdef VECT_BIT_FIND_FIRST
8472 return VECT_BIT_FIND_FIRST(block, pos);
8473#else
8474 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bm::set_block_size; ++i)
8475 {
8476 bm::word_t w = block[i];
8477 if (w)
8478 {
8479 unsigned idx = bm::bit_scan_forward32(w); // trailing zeros
8480 *pos = unsigned(idx + (i * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t))));
8481 return w;
8482 }
8483 } // for i
8484 return false;
8485#endif
8486}
8487
8488/*!
8489 \brief BIT block find the first set bit
8490
8491 \param block - bit block buffer pointer
8492 \param first - index of the first 1 bit (out)
8493 \param digest - known digest of dst block
8494
8495 \return 0 if not found
8496
8497 @ingroup bitfunc
8498*/
8499inline
8500unsigned bit_find_first(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
8501 unsigned* BMRESTRICT first,
8502 bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
8503{
8504 BM_ASSERT(block);
8505 BM_ASSERT(first);
8506 BM_ASSERT(digest);
8507
8508 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(digest); // d & -d;
8509
8510 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
8511 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
8512 for (unsigned i = off; i < bm::set_block_size; ++i)
8513 {
8514 bm::word_t w = block[i];
8515 if (w)
8516 {
8517 unsigned idx = bit_scan_forward32(w); // trailing zeros
8518 *first = unsigned(idx + (i * 8u * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t))));
8519 return w;
8520 }
8521 } // for i
8522 return 0u;
8523}
8524
8525
8526/*!
8527 \brief BIT block find the first set bit if only 1 bit is set
8528
8529 \param block - bit block buffer pointer
8530 \param first - index of the first 1 bit (out)
8531 \param digest - known digest of dst block
8532
8533 \return 0 if not found
8534
8535 @ingroup bitfunc
8536*/
8537inline
8538bool bit_find_first_if_1(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
8539 unsigned* BMRESTRICT first,
8540 bm::id64_t digest) BMNOEXCEPT
8541{
8542 BM_ASSERT(block);
8543 BM_ASSERT(first);
8544 BM_ASSERT(bm::word_bitcount64(digest)==1);
8545
8546 bool found = false;
8547 bm::id64_t t = bm::bmi_blsi_u64(digest); // d & -d;
8548
8549 unsigned wave = bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1);
8550 unsigned off = wave * bm::set_block_digest_wave_size;
8551 unsigned i;
8552 for (i = off; i < off + bm::set_block_digest_wave_size; ++i)
8553 {
8554 bm::word_t w = block[i];
8555 if (w)
8556 {
8557 unsigned bc = bm::word_bitcount(w);
8558 if (bc != 1)
8559 return false;
8560
8561 unsigned idx = bit_scan_forward32(w); // trailing zeros
8562 *first = unsigned(idx + (i * 8u * sizeof(bm::word_t)));
8563 found = true;
8564 break;
8565 }
8566 } // for i
8567
8568 // check if all other bits are zero
8569 for (++i; i < off + bm::set_block_digest_wave_size; ++i)
8570 {
8571 if (block[i])
8572 return false;
8573 }
8574 return found;
8575}
8576
8577
8578/*!
8579 \brief BIT block find position for the rank
8580
8581 \param block - bit block buffer pointer
8582 \param rank - rank to find (must be > 0)
8583 \param nbit_from - start bit position in block
8584 \param nbit_pos - (out)found position
8585
8586 \return 0 if position with rank was found, or
8587 the remaining rank (rank - population count)
8588
8589 @ingroup bitfunc
8590*/
8591template<typename SIZE_TYPE>
8592SIZE_TYPE bit_find_rank(const bm::word_t* const block,
8593 SIZE_TYPE rank,
8594 unsigned nbit_from,
8595 unsigned& nbit_pos) BMNOEXCEPT
8596{
8597 BM_ASSERT(block);
8598 BM_ASSERT(rank);
8599
8600 unsigned nword = nbit_from >> bm::set_word_shift;
8601 BM_ASSERT(nword < bm::set_block_size);
8602
8603 unsigned pos = nbit_from;
8604 bm::id_t nbit = (nbit_from & bm::set_word_mask);
8605
8606 if (nbit)
8607 {
8608 bm::id_t w = block[nword];
8609 w >>= nbit;
8610 unsigned bc = bm::word_bitcount(w);
8611 if (bc < rank) // skip this
8612 {
8613 rank -= bc; pos += unsigned(32u - nbit);
8614 ++nword;
8615 }
8616 else // target word
8617 {
8618 unsigned idx = bm::word_select32(w, unsigned(rank));
8619 nbit_pos = pos + idx;
8620 return 0;
8621 }
8622 }
8623
8624 #if defined(BM64OPT) || defined(BM64_SSE4) || defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined(BMAVX512OPT)
8625 {
8626 for (; nword < bm::set_block_size-1; nword+=2)
8627 {
8628 bm::id64_t w =
8629 (bm::id64_t(block[nword+1]) << 32) | bm::id64_t(block[nword]);
8630 bm::id_t bc = bm::word_bitcount64(w);
8631 if (bc >= rank) // target
8632 {
8633 unsigned idx = bm::word_select64(w, unsigned(rank));
8634 nbit_pos = pos + idx;
8635 return 0;
8636 }
8637 rank -= bc;
8638 pos += 64u;
8639 }
8640 }
8641 #endif
8642
8643 for (; nword < bm::set_block_size; ++nword)
8644 {
8645 bm::id_t w = block[nword];
8646 bm::id_t bc = bm::word_bitcount(w);
8647 if (rank > bc)
8648 {
8649 rank -= bc; pos += 32u;
8650 continue;
8651 }
8652 unsigned idx = bm::word_select32(w, unsigned(rank));
8653 nbit_pos = pos + idx;
8654 return 0;
8655 } // for nword
8656 return rank;
8657}
8658
8659/**
8660 \brief Find rank in block (GAP or BIT)
8661
8662 \param block - bit block buffer pointer
8663 \param rank - rank to find (must be > 0)
8664 \param nbit_from - start bit position in block
8665 \param nbit_pos - found position
8666
8667 \return 0 if position with rank was found, or
8668 the remaining rank (rank - population count)
8669
8670 @internal
8671*/
8672template<typename SIZE_TYPE>
8673SIZE_TYPE block_find_rank(const bm::word_t* const block,
8674 SIZE_TYPE rank,
8675 unsigned nbit_from,
8676 unsigned& nbit_pos) BMNOEXCEPT
8677{
8678 if (BM_IS_GAP(block))
8679 {
8680 const bm::gap_word_t* const gap_block = BMGAP_PTR(block);
8681 rank = bm::gap_find_rank(gap_block, rank, nbit_from, nbit_pos);
8682 }
8683 else
8684 {
8685 rank = bm::bit_find_rank(block, rank, nbit_from, nbit_pos);
8686 }
8687 return rank;
8688}
8689
8690
8691
8692/*!
8693 @brief Choose best representation for a bit-block
8694 @ingroup bitfunc
8695*/
8696inline
8697bm::set_representation best_representation(unsigned bit_count,
8698 unsigned total_possible_bitcount,
8699 unsigned gap_count,
8700 unsigned block_size) BMNOEXCEPT
8701{
8702 unsigned arr_size = unsigned(sizeof(bm::gap_word_t) * bit_count + sizeof(bm::gap_word_t));
8703 unsigned gap_size = unsigned(sizeof(bm::gap_word_t) * gap_count + sizeof(bm::gap_word_t));
8704 unsigned inv_arr_size = unsigned(sizeof(bm::gap_word_t) * (total_possible_bitcount - bit_count) + sizeof(bm::gap_word_t));
8705
8706 if ((gap_size < block_size) && (gap_size < arr_size) && (gap_size < inv_arr_size))
8707 {
8708 return bm::set_gap;
8709 }
8710
8711 if (arr_size < inv_arr_size)
8712 {
8713 if ((arr_size < block_size) && (arr_size < gap_size))
8714 {
8715 return bm::set_array1;
8716 }
8717 }
8718 else
8719 {
8720 if ((inv_arr_size < block_size) && (inv_arr_size < gap_size))
8721 {
8722 return bm::set_array0;
8723 }
8724 }
8725 return bm::set_bitset;
8726}
8727
8728/*!
8729 @brief Convert bit block into an array of ints corresponding to 1 bits
8730 @return destination size as a result of block decoding
8731 @ingroup bitfunc
8732*/
8733
8734/*!
8735 @brief Convert bit block into an array of ints corresponding to 1 bits
8736 @return destination size as a result of block decoding
8737 @ingroup bitfunc
8738*/
8739template<typename T>
8740unsigned bit_block_convert_to_arr(T* BMRESTRICT dest,
8741 const unsigned* BMRESTRICT src,
8742 bool inverted) BMNOEXCEPT
8743{
8744 bm::id64_t imask64 = inverted ? ~0ull : 0;
8745 T* BMRESTRICT pcurr = dest;
8746 for (unsigned bit_idx = 0; bit_idx < bm::gap_max_bits;
8747 src+=2, bit_idx += unsigned(sizeof(*src) * 8 * 2))
8748 {
8749 bm::id64_t w =
8750 (bm::id64_t(src[0]) | (bm::id64_t(src[1]) << 32u)) ^ imask64;
8751 while (w)
8752 {
8753 bm::id64_t t = bmi_blsi_u64(w); // w & -w;
8754 *pcurr++ = (T)(bm::word_bitcount64(t - 1) + bit_idx);
8755 w = bmi_bslr_u64(w); // w &= w - 1;
8756 }
8757 } // for
8758 return (unsigned)(pcurr - dest);
8759}
8760
8761
8762/**
8763 \brief Checks all conditions and returns true if block consists of only 0 bits
8764 \param blk - Blocks's pointer
8765 \param deep_scan - flag to do full bit block verification (scan)
8766 when deep scan is not requested result can be approximate
8767 \returns true if all bits are in the block are 0
8768
8769 @internal
8770*/
8771inline
8772bool check_block_zero(const bm::word_t* blk, bool deep_scan) BMNOEXCEPT
8773{
8774 if (!blk) return true;
8775 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(blk)) return false;
8776
8777 bool ret;
8778 if (BM_IS_GAP(blk))
8779 ret = gap_is_all_zero(BMGAP_PTR(blk));
8780 else
8781 ret = deep_scan ? bm::bit_is_all_zero(blk) : 0;
8782 return ret;
8783}
8784
8785
8786/**
8787 \brief Checks if block has only 1 bits
8788 \param blk - Block's pointer
8789 \param deep_scan - flag to do full bit block verification (scan)
8790 when deep scan is not requested result can be approximate
8791 \return true if block consists of 1 bits.
8792
8793 @internal
8794*/
8795inline
8796bool check_block_one(const bm::word_t* blk, bool deep_scan) BMNOEXCEPT
8797{
8798 if (blk == 0) return false;
8799
8800 if (BM_IS_GAP(blk))
8801 return bm::gap_is_all_one(BMGAP_PTR(blk));
8802
8803 if (IS_FULL_BLOCK(blk))
8804 return true;
8805
8806 if (!deep_scan)
8807 return false; // block exists - presume it has 0 bits
8808
8809 return bm::is_bits_one((wordop_t*)blk);
8810}
8811
8812
8813
8814/*! @brief Calculates memory overhead for number of gap blocks sharing
8815 the same memory allocation table (level lengths table).
8816 @ingroup gapfunc
8817*/
8818template<typename T>
8819unsigned gap_overhead(const T* length,
8820 const T* length_end,
8821 const T* glevel_len) BMNOEXCEPT
8822{
8823 BM_ASSERT(length && length_end && glevel_len);
8824
8825 unsigned overhead = 0;
8826 for (;length < length_end; ++length)
8827 {
8828 unsigned len = *length;
8829 int level = gap_calc_level(len, glevel_len);
8830 BM_ASSERT(level >= 0 && level < (int)bm::gap_levels);
8831 unsigned capacity = glevel_len[level];
8832 BM_ASSERT(capacity >= len);
8833 overhead += capacity - len;
8834 }
8835 return overhead;
8836}
8837
8838
8839/*! @brief Finds optimal gap blocks lengths.
8840 @param length - first element of GAP lengths array
8841 @param length_end - end of the GAP lengths array
8842 @param glevel_len - destination GAP lengths array
8843 @ingroup gapfunc
8844*/
8845template<typename T>
8846bool improve_gap_levels(const T* length,
8847 const T* length_end,
8848 T* glevel_len) BMNOEXCEPT
8849{
8850 BM_ASSERT(length && length_end && glevel_len);
8851
8852 size_t lsize = size_t(length_end - length);
8853
8854 BM_ASSERT(lsize);
8855
8856 gap_word_t max_len = 0;
8857 unsigned i;
8858 for (i = 0; i < lsize; ++i)
8859 {
8860 if (length[i] > max_len)
8861 max_len = length[i];
8862 }
8863 if (max_len < 5 || lsize <= bm::gap_levels)
8864 {
8865 glevel_len[0] = T(max_len + 4);
8866 for (i = 1; i < bm::gap_levels; ++i)
8867 {
8868 glevel_len[i] = bm::gap_max_buff_len;
8869 }
8870 return true;
8871 }
8872
8873 glevel_len[bm::gap_levels-1] = T(max_len + 5);
8874
8875 unsigned min_overhead = gap_overhead(length, length_end, glevel_len);
8876 bool is_improved = false;
8877
8878 // main problem solving loop
8879 //
8880 for (i = bm::gap_levels-2; ; --i)
8881 {
8882 unsigned opt_len = 0;
8883 unsigned j;
8884 bool imp_flag = false;
8885 gap_word_t gap_saved_value = glevel_len[i];
8886 for (j = 0; j < lsize; ++j)
8887 {
8888 glevel_len[i] = T(length[j] + 4);
8889 unsigned ov = gap_overhead(length, length_end, glevel_len);
8890 if (ov <= min_overhead)
8891 {
8892 min_overhead = ov;
8893 opt_len = length[j]+4;
8894 imp_flag = true;
8895 }
8896 }
8897 if (imp_flag)
8898 {
8899 glevel_len[i] = (T)opt_len; // length[opt_idx]+4;
8900 is_improved = true;
8901 }
8902 else
8903 {
8904 glevel_len[i] = gap_saved_value;
8905 }
8906 if (i == 0)
8907 break;
8908 }
8909
8910 // Remove duplicates
8911 //
8912 T val = *glevel_len;
8913 T* gp = glevel_len;
8914 T* res = glevel_len;
8915 for (i = 0; i < bm::gap_levels; ++i)
8916 {
8917 if (val != *gp)
8918 {
8919 val = *gp;
8920 *++res = val;
8921 }
8922 ++gp;
8923 }
8924
8925 // Filling the "unused" part with max. possible value
8926 while (++res < (glevel_len + bm::gap_levels))
8927 {
8928 *res = bm::gap_max_buff_len;
8929 }
8930
8931 return is_improved;
8932
8933}
8934
8935/*!
8936 \brief Find first bit which is different between two blocks (GAP or bit)
8937 \param blk - block 1
8938 \param arg_blk - block 2
8939 \param pos - out - position of difference (undefined if blocks are equal)
8940 \return true if difference was found
8941 @internal
8942*/
8943inline
8944bool block_find_first_diff(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT blk,
8945 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT arg_blk,
8946 unsigned* BMRESTRICT pos) BMNOEXCEPT
8947{
8948 // If one block is zero we check if the other one has at least
8949 // one bit ON
8950
8951 if (!blk || !arg_blk)
8952 {
8953 const bm::word_t* pblk; bool is_gap;
8954 if (blk)
8955 {
8956 pblk = blk;
8957 is_gap = BM_IS_GAP(blk);
8958 }
8959 else
8960 {
8961 pblk = arg_blk;
8962 is_gap = BM_IS_GAP(arg_blk);
8963 }
8964
8965 if (is_gap)
8966 {
8967 unsigned found = bm::gap_find_first(BMGAP_PTR(pblk), pos);
8968 if (found)
8969 return true;
8970 }
8971 else
8972 {
8973 unsigned found = bm::bit_find_first(pblk, pos);
8974 if (found)
8975 return true;
8976 }
8977 return false;
8978 }
8979
8980 bool arg_gap = BM_IS_GAP(arg_blk);
8981 bool gap = BM_IS_GAP(blk);
8982
8983 if (arg_gap != gap)
8984 {
8985 //BM_DECLARE_TEMP_BLOCK(temp_blk)
8986 bm::bit_block_t temp_blk;
8987 bm::word_t* blk1; bm::word_t* blk2;
8988
8989 if (gap)
8990 {
8991 bm::gap_convert_to_bitset((bm::word_t*)temp_blk,
8992 BMGAP_PTR(blk));
8993 blk1 = (bm::word_t*)temp_blk;
8994 blk2 = (bm::word_t*)arg_blk;
8995 }
8996 else
8997 {
8998 bm::gap_convert_to_bitset((bm::word_t*)temp_blk,
8999 BMGAP_PTR(arg_blk));
9000 blk1 = (bm::word_t*)blk;
9001 blk2 = (bm::word_t*)temp_blk;
9002 }
9003 bool found = bm::bit_find_first_diff(blk1, blk2, pos);
9004 if (found)
9005 return true;
9006 }
9007 else
9008 {
9009 if (gap)
9010 {
9011 bool found =
9012 bm::gap_find_first_diff(BMGAP_PTR(blk),
9013 BMGAP_PTR(arg_blk), pos);
9014 if (found)
9015 return true;
9016 }
9017 else
9018 {
9019 bool found = bm::bit_find_first_diff(blk, arg_blk, pos);
9020 if (found)
9021 return true;
9022 }
9023 }
9024 return false;
9025}
9026
9027
9028
9029
9030/**
9031 Bit-block get adapter, takes bitblock and represents it as a
9032 get_32() accessor function
9033 \internal
9034*/
9035class bitblock_get_adapter
9036{
9037public:
9038 bitblock_get_adapter(const bm::word_t* bit_block) : b_(bit_block) {}
9039
9040 BMFORCEINLINE
9041 bm::word_t get_32() BMNOEXCEPT { return *b_++; }
9042private:
9043 const bm::word_t* b_;
9044};
9045
9046
9047/**
9048 Bit-block store adapter, takes bitblock and saves results into it
9049 \internal
9050*/
9051class bitblock_store_adapter
9052{
9053public:
9054 bitblock_store_adapter(bm::word_t* bit_block) : b_(bit_block) {}
9055 BMFORCEINLINE
9056 void push_back(bm::word_t w) { *b_++ = w; }
9057private:
9058 bm::word_t* b_;
9059};
9060
9061/**
9062 Bit-block sum adapter, takes values and sums it
9063 /internal
9064*/
9065class bitblock_sum_adapter
9066{
9067public:
9068 bitblock_sum_adapter() : sum_(0) {}
9069 BMFORCEINLINE
9070 void push_back(bm::word_t w) BMNOEXCEPT { this->sum_+= w; }
9071 /// Get accumulated sum
9072 bm::word_t sum() const BMNOEXCEPT { return this->sum_; }
9073private:
9074 bm::word_t sum_;
9075};
9076
9077/**
9078 Adapter to get words from a range stream
9079 (see range serialized bit-block)
9080 \internal
9081*/
9082template<class DEC> class decoder_range_adapter
9083{
9084public:
9085 decoder_range_adapter(DEC& dec, unsigned from_idx, unsigned to_idx)
9086 : decoder_(dec),
9087 from_(from_idx),
9088 to_(to_idx),
9089 cnt_(0)
9090 {}
9091
9092 bm::word_t get_32() BMNOEXCEPT
9093 {
9094 if (cnt_ < from_ || cnt_ > to_)
9095 {
9096 ++cnt_; return 0;
9097 }
9098 ++cnt_;
9099 return decoder_.get_32();
9100 }
9101
9102private:
9103 DEC& decoder_;
9104 unsigned from_;
9105 unsigned to_;
9106 unsigned cnt_;
9107};
9108
9109
9110/*!
9111 Abstract recombination algorithm for two bit-blocks
9112 Bit blocks can come as dserialization decoders or bit-streams
9113*/
9114template<class It1, class It2, class BinaryOp, class Encoder>
9115void bit_recomb(It1& it1, It2& it2,
9116 BinaryOp& op,
9117 Encoder& enc,
9118 unsigned block_size = bm::set_block_size) BMNOEXCEPT
9119{
9120 for (unsigned i = 0; i < block_size; ++i)
9121 {
9122 bm::word_t w1 = it1.get_32();
9123 bm::word_t w2 = it2.get_32();
9124 bm::word_t w = op(w1, w2);
9125 enc.push_back( w );
9126 } // for
9127}
9128
9129/// Bit AND functor
9130template<typename W> struct bit_AND
9131{
9132 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return w1 & w2; }
9133};
9134
9135/// Bit OR functor
9136template<typename W> struct bit_OR
9137{
9138 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return w1 | w2; }
9139};
9140
9141/// Bit SUB functor
9142template<typename W> struct bit_SUB
9143{
9144 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return w1 & ~~w2; }
9145};
9146
9147/// Bit XOR functor
9148template<typename W> struct bit_XOR
9149{
9150 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return w1 ^ w2; }
9151};
9152
9153/// Bit ASSIGN functor
9154template<typename W> struct bit_ASSIGN
9155{
9156 W operator()(W, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return w2; }
9157};
9158
9159/// Bit COUNT functor
9160template<typename W> struct bit_COUNT
9161{
9162 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT
9163 {
9164 w1 = 0; w1 += bm::word_bitcount(w2);
9165 return w1;
9166 }
9167};
9168
9169/// Bit COUNT AND functor
9170template<typename W> struct bit_COUNT_AND
9171{
9172 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return bm::word_bitcount(w1 & w2); }
9173};
9174
9175/// Bit COUNT XOR functor
9176template<typename W> struct bit_COUNT_XOR
9177{
9178 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return bm::word_bitcount(w1 ^ w2); }
9179};
9180
9181/// Bit COUNT OR functor
9182template<typename W> struct bit_COUNT_OR
9183{
9184 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return bm::word_bitcount(w1 | w2); }
9185};
9186
9187
9188/// Bit COUNT SUB AB functor
9189template<typename W> struct bit_COUNT_SUB_AB
9190{
9191 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return bm::word_bitcount(w1 & (~w2)); }
9192};
9193
9194/// Bit SUB BA functor
9195template<typename W> struct bit_COUNT_SUB_BA
9196{
9197 W operator()(W w1, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return bm::word_bitcount(w2 & (~w1)); }
9198};
9199
9200/// Bit COUNT A functor
9201template<typename W> struct bit_COUNT_A
9202{
9203 W operator()(W w1, W ) BMNOEXCEPT { return bm::word_bitcount(w1); }
9204};
9205
9206/// Bit COUNT B functor
9207template<typename W> struct bit_COUNT_B
9208{
9209 W operator()(W, W w2) BMNOEXCEPT { return bm::word_bitcount(w2); }
9210};
9211
9212typedef
9213void (*gap_operation_to_bitset_func_type)(unsigned*,
9214 const gap_word_t*);
9215
9216typedef
9217gap_word_t* (*gap_operation_func_type)(const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT,
9218 const gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT,
9219 gap_word_t* BMRESTRICT,
9220 unsigned& );
9221
9222typedef
9223bm::id_t (*bit_operation_count_func_type)(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT,
9224 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT);
9225
9226
9227template<bool T>
9228struct operation_functions
9229{
9230 static
9231 gap_operation_to_bitset_func_type gap2bit_table_[bm::set_END];
9232 static
9233 gap_operation_func_type gapop_table_[bm::set_END];
9234 static
9235 bit_operation_count_func_type bit_op_count_table_[bm::set_END];
9236
9237 static
9238 gap_operation_to_bitset_func_type gap_op_to_bit(unsigned i)
9239 {
9240 return gap2bit_table_[i];
9241 }
9242
9243 static
9244 gap_operation_func_type gap_operation(unsigned i)
9245 {
9246 return gapop_table_[i];
9247 }
9248
9249 static
9250 bit_operation_count_func_type bit_operation_count(unsigned i)
9251 {
9252 return bit_op_count_table_[i];
9253 }
9254};
9255
9256template<bool T>
9257gap_operation_to_bitset_func_type
9258operation_functions<T>::gap2bit_table_[bm::set_END] = {
9259 &gap_and_to_bitset<bm::gap_word_t>, // set_AND
9260 &gap_add_to_bitset<bm::gap_word_t>, // set_OR
9261 &gap_sub_to_bitset<bm::gap_word_t>, // set_SUB
9262 &gap_xor_to_bitset<bm::gap_word_t>, // set_XOR
9263 0
9264};
9265
9266template<bool T>
9267gap_operation_func_type
9268operation_functions<T>::gapop_table_[bm::set_END] = {
9269 &gap_operation_and, // set_AND
9270 &gap_operation_or, // set_OR
9271 &gap_operation_sub, // set_SUB
9272 &gap_operation_xor, // set_XOR
9273 0
9274};
9275
9276
9277template<bool T>
9278bit_operation_count_func_type
9279operation_functions<T>::bit_op_count_table_[bm::set_END] = {
9280 0, // set_AND
9281 0, // set_OR
9282 0, // set_SUB
9283 0, // set_XOR
9284 0, // set_ASSIGN
9285 0, // set_COUNT
9286 &bit_operation_and_count, // set_COUNT_AND
9287 &bit_operation_xor_count, // set_COUNT_XOR
9288 &bit_operation_or_count, // set_COUNT_OR
9289 &bit_operation_sub_count, // set_COUNT_SUB_AB
9290 &bit_operation_sub_count_inv, // set_COUNT_SUB_BA
9291 0, // set_COUNT_A
9292 0, // set_COUNT_B
9293};
9294
9295/**
9296 Size of bit decode wave in words
9297 @internal
9298 */
9299const unsigned short set_bitscan_wave_size = 4;
9300/*!
9301 \brief Unpacks word wave (Nx 32-bit words)
9302 \param w_ptr - pointer on wave start
9303 \param bits - pointer on the result array
9304 \return number of bits in the list
9305
9306 @ingroup bitfunc
9307 @internal
9308*/
9309inline
9310unsigned short
9311bitscan_wave(const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT w_ptr,
9312 unsigned char* BMRESTRICT bits) BMNOEXCEPT
9313{
9314 bm::word_t w0, w1;
9315 unsigned int cnt0;
9316
9317 w0 = w_ptr[0]; w1 = w_ptr[1];
9318
9319#if defined(BMAVX512OPT) || defined(BMAVX2OPT) || defined(BM64OPT) || defined(BM64_SSE4)
9320 // combine into 64-bit word and scan (when HW popcnt64 is available)
9321 bm::id64_t w = (bm::id64_t(w1) << 32) | w0;
9322 cnt0 = bm::bitscan_popcnt64(w, bits);
9323
9324 w0 = w_ptr[2]; w1 = w_ptr[3];
9325 w = (bm::id64_t(w1) << 32) | w0;
9326 cnt0 += bm::bitscan_popcnt64(w, bits + cnt0, 64);
9327#else
9328 #if (defined(__arm__) || defined(__aarch64__))
9329 cnt0 = bm::bitscan_bsf(w0, bits, (unsigned short)0);
9330 cnt0 += bm::bitscan_bsf(w1, bits + cnt0, (unsigned short)32);
9331
9332 w0 = w_ptr[2]; w1 = w_ptr[3];
9333 cnt0 += bm::bitscan_bsf(w0, bits + cnt0, (unsigned short)64);
9334 cnt0 += bm::bitscan_bsf(w1, bits + cnt0, (unsigned short)(64+32));
9335 #else
9336 // decode wave as two 32-bit bitscan decodes
9337 cnt0 = bm::bitscan_popcnt(w0, bits);
9338 cnt0 += bm::bitscan_popcnt(w1, bits + cnt0, 32);
9339
9340 w0 = w_ptr[2]; w1 = w_ptr[3];
9341 cnt0 += bm::bitscan_popcnt(w0, bits + cnt0, 64);
9342 cnt0 += bm::bitscan_popcnt(w1, bits + cnt0, 64+32);
9343 #endif
9344#endif
9345 return static_cast<unsigned short>(cnt0);
9346}
9347
9348#if defined (BM64_SSE4) || defined(BM64_AVX2) || defined(BM64_AVX512)
9349/**
9350 bit index to word gather-scatter algorithm (SIMD)
9351 @ingroup bitfunc
9352 @internal
9353*/
9354inline
9355void bit_block_gather_scatter(unsigned* BMRESTRICT arr,
9356 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT blk,
9357 const unsigned* BMRESTRICT idx,
