9358 unsigned size, unsigned start,
9359 unsigned bit_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
9360{
9361typedef unsigned TRGW;
9362typedef unsigned IDX;
9363#if defined(BM64_SSE4)
9364 // TODO: provide 16 and 64-bit optimized implementations
9365 // optimized for unsigned
9366 if constexpr (sizeof(TRGW)==4 && sizeof(IDX)==4)
9367 {
9368 sse4_bit_block_gather_scatter(arr, blk, idx, size, start, bit_idx);
9369 return;
9370 }
9371#elif defined(BM64_AVX2) || defined(BM64_AVX512)
9372 if constexpr (sizeof(TRGW)==4 && sizeof(IDX)==4)
9373 {
9374 avx2_bit_block_gather_scatter(arr, blk, idx, size, start, bit_idx);
9375 return;
9376 }
9377#else
9378 BM_ASSERT(0);
9379#endif
9380}
9381#endif
9382
9383/**
9384 bit index to word gather-scatter algorithm
9385 @ingroup bitfunc
9386 @internal
9387*/
9388template<typename TRGW, typename IDX, typename SZ>
9389void bit_block_gather_scatter(TRGW* BMRESTRICT arr,
9390 const bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT blk,
9391 const IDX* BMRESTRICT idx,
9392 SZ size, SZ start, unsigned bit_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
9393{
9394 // TODO: SIMD for 64-bit index sizes and 64-bit target value size
9395 //
9396 TRGW mask1 = 1;
9397 const SZ len = (size - start);
9398 const SZ len_unr = len - (len % 2);
9399 SZ k = 0;
9400 for (; k < len_unr; k+=2)
9401 {
9402 const SZ base = start + k;
9403 const unsigned nbitA = unsigned(idx[base] & bm::set_block_mask);
9404 arr[base] |= (TRGW(bool(blk[nbitA >> bm::set_word_shift] &
9405 (mask1 << (nbitA & bm::set_word_mask)))) << bit_idx);
9406 const unsigned nbitB = unsigned(idx[base + 1] & bm::set_block_mask);
9407 arr[base+1] |= (TRGW(bool(blk[nbitB >> bm::set_word_shift] &
9408 (mask1 << (nbitB & bm::set_word_mask)))) << bit_idx);
9409 } // for k
9410 for (; k < len; ++k)
9411 {
9412 unsigned nbit = unsigned(idx[start + k] & bm::set_block_mask);
9413 arr[start + k] |= (TRGW(bool(blk[nbit >> bm::set_word_shift] &
9414 (mask1 << (nbit & bm::set_word_mask)))) << bit_idx);
9415 } // for k
9416}
9417
9418/**
9419 @brief block boundaries look ahead U32
9420
9421 @param idx - array to look into
9422 @param size - array size
9423 @param nb - block number to look ahead
9424 @param start - start offset in idx
9425
9426 @return block boundary offset end (no more match at the returned offset)
9427
9428 @internal
9429*/
9430inline
9431bm::id64_t idx_arr_block_lookup_u64(const bm::id64_t* idx,
9432 bm::id64_t size, bm::id64_t nb, bm::id64_t start) BMNOEXCEPT
9433{
9434 BM_ASSERT(idx);
9435 BM_ASSERT(start < size);
9436
9437 // TODO: SIMD for 64-bit index vector
9438 for (;(start < size) &&
9439 (nb == (idx[start] >> bm::set_block_shift)); ++start)
9440 {}
9441 return start;
9442}
9443
9444/**
9445 @brief block boundaries look ahead U32
9446
9447 @param idx - array to look into
9448 @param size - array size
9449 @param nb - block number to look ahead
9450 @param start - start offset in idx
9451
9452 @return block boundary offset end (no more match at the returned offset)
9453
9454 @internal
9455*/
9456inline
9457unsigned idx_arr_block_lookup_u32(const unsigned* idx,
9458 unsigned size, unsigned nb, unsigned start) BMNOEXCEPT
9459{
9460 BM_ASSERT(idx);
9461 BM_ASSERT(start < size);
9462
9463#if defined(VECT_ARR_BLOCK_LOOKUP)
9464 return VECT_ARR_BLOCK_LOOKUP(idx, size, nb, start);
9465#else
9466 for (;(start < size) &&
9467 (nb == unsigned(idx[start] >> bm::set_block_shift)); ++start)
9468 {}
9469 return start;
9470#endif
9471}
9472
9473// --------------------------------------------------------------
9474
9475
9476/**
9477 @brief set bits in a bit-block using global index
9478
9479 @param idx - array to look into
9480 @param block - block pointer to set bits
9481 @param start - index array start
9482 @param stop - index array stop in a range [start..stop)
9483
9484 @return block boundary offset end (no more match at the returned offset)
9485
9486 @internal
9487 @ingroup bitfunc
9488*/
9489inline
9490void set_block_bits_u64(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
9491 const bm::id64_t* BMRESTRICT idx,
9492 bm::id64_t start, bm::id64_t stop) BMNOEXCEPT
9493{
9494 // TODO: SIMD for 64-bit mode
9495 for (bm::id64_t i = start; i < stop; ++i)
9496 {
9497 bm::id64_t n = idx[i];
9498 unsigned nbit = unsigned(n & bm::set_block_mask);
9499 unsigned nword = nbit >> bm::set_word_shift;
9500 nbit &= bm::set_word_mask;
9501 block[nword] |= (1u << nbit);
9502 } // for i
9503}
9504
9505
9506/**
9507 @brief set bits in a bit-block using global index
9508
9509 @param idx - array to look into
9510 @param block - block pointer to set bits
9511 @param start - index array start
9512 @param stop - index array stop in a range [start..stop)
9513
9514 @return block boundary offset end (no more match at the returned offset)
9515
9516 @internal
9517 @ingroup bitfunc
9518*/
9519inline
9520void set_block_bits_u32(bm::word_t* BMRESTRICT block,
9521 const unsigned* BMRESTRICT idx,
9522 unsigned start, unsigned stop ) BMNOEXCEPT
9523{
9524 BM_ASSERT(start < stop);
9525#if defined(VECT_SET_BLOCK_BITS)
9526 VECT_SET_BLOCK_BITS(block, idx, start, stop);
9527#else
9528 do
9529 {
9530 unsigned n = idx[start++];
9531 unsigned nbit = unsigned(n & bm::set_block_mask);
9532 unsigned nword = nbit >> bm::set_word_shift;
9533 nbit &= bm::set_word_mask;
9534 block[nword] |= (1u << nbit);
9535 } while (start < stop);
9536#endif
9537}
9538
9539
9540
9541// --------------------------------------------------------------
9542
9543/**
9544 @brief array range detector
9545 @internal
9546*/
9547inline
9548bool block_ptr_array_range(bm::word_t** arr,
9549 unsigned& left, unsigned& right) BMNOEXCEPT
9550{
9551 BM_ASSERT(arr);
9552
9553 unsigned i, j;
9554 for (i = 0; i < bm::set_sub_array_size; ++i)
9555 {
9556 if (arr[i])
9557 {
9558 left = i;
9559 break;
9560 }
9561 }
9562 if (i == bm::set_sub_array_size)
9563 {
9564 left = right = 0;
9565 return false; // nothing here
9566 }
9567 for (j = bm::set_sub_array_size-1; j != i; --j)
9568 if (arr[j])
9569 break;
9570 right = j;
9571 return true;
9572}
9573
9574// --------------------------------------------------------------
9575
9576/**
9577 Linear lower bound search in unsigned array
9578 @internal
9579*/
9580inline
9581unsigned lower_bound_linear_u32(const unsigned* arr, unsigned target,
9582 unsigned from, unsigned to) BMNOEXCEPT
9583{
9584 BM_ASSERT(arr);
9585 BM_ASSERT(from <= to);
9586
9587#if defined(VECT_LOWER_BOUND_SCAN_U32)
9588 return VECT_LOWER_BOUND_SCAN_U32(arr, target, from, to);
9589#else
9590 for (; from <= to; ++from)
9591 {
9592 if (arr[from] >= target)
9593 break;
9594 }
9595 return from;
9596#endif
9597}
9598
9599/**
9600 Linear lower bound search in unsigned LONG array
9601 @internal
9602*/
9603inline
9604unsigned lower_bound_linear_u64(const unsigned long long* arr,
9605 unsigned long long target,
9606 unsigned from, unsigned to) BMNOEXCEPT
9607{
9608 BM_ASSERT(arr);
9609 BM_ASSERT(from <= to);
9610
9611 // TODO: implement vectorized scan on u64 ints
9612 for (; from <= to; ++from)
9613 {
9614 if (arr[from] >= target)
9615 break;
9616 }
9617 return from;
9618}
9619
9620
9621
9622// --------------------------------------------------------------
9623
9624/**
9625 Hybrid, binary-linear lower bound search in unsigned array
9626 @internal
9627*/
9628inline
9629unsigned lower_bound_u32(const unsigned* arr, unsigned target,
9630 unsigned from, unsigned to) BMNOEXCEPT
9631{
9632 BM_ASSERT(arr);
9633 BM_ASSERT(from <= to);
9634 const unsigned linear_cutoff = 32;
9635
9636 unsigned l = from; unsigned r = to;
9637 unsigned dist = r - l;
9638 if (dist < linear_cutoff)
9639 {
9640 return bm::lower_bound_linear_u32(arr, target, l, r);
9641 }
9642
9643 while (l <= r)
9644 {
9645 unsigned mid = (r-l)/2+l;
9646 if (arr[mid] < target)
9647 l = mid+1;
9648 else
9649 r = mid-1;
9650 dist = r - l;
9651 if (dist < linear_cutoff)
9652 {
9653 return bm::lower_bound_linear_u32(arr, target, l, r);
9654 }
9655 }
9656 return l;
9657}
9658
9659/**
9660 Hybrid, binary-linear lower bound search in unsigned LONG array
9661 @internal
9662*/
9663inline
9664unsigned lower_bound_u64(const unsigned long long* arr,
9665 unsigned long long target,
9666 unsigned from, unsigned to) BMNOEXCEPT
9667{
9668 BM_ASSERT(arr);
9669 BM_ASSERT(from <= to);
9670 const unsigned linear_cutoff = 32;
9671
9672 unsigned l = from; unsigned r = to;
9673 unsigned dist = r - l;
9674 if (dist < linear_cutoff)
9675 {
9676 return bm::lower_bound_linear_u64(arr, target, l, r);
9677 }
9678
9679 while (l <= r)
9680 {
9681 unsigned mid = (r - l) / 2 + l;
9682 if (arr[mid] < target)
9683 l = mid + 1;
9684 else
9685 r = mid - 1;
9686 dist = r - l;
9687 if (dist < linear_cutoff)
9688 {
9689 return bm::lower_bound_linear_u64(arr, target, l, r);
9690 }
9691 }
9692 return l;
9693}
9694
9695/**
9696 Scan search for pointer value in unordered array
9697 @return found flag and index
9698 @internal
9699 */
9700inline
9701bool find_ptr(const void* const * p_arr, size_t arr_size,
9702 const void* ptr, size_t *idx) BMNOEXCEPT
9703{
9704 // TODO: SIMD?
9705 for (size_t i = 0; i < arr_size; ++i)
9706 if (ptr == p_arr[i])
9707 {
9708 *idx = i; return true;
9709 }
9710 return false;
9711}
9712
9713
9714/**
9715 calculate bvector<> global bit-index from block-local coords
9716 @return bit index in linear bit-vector coordinates
9717 @internal
9718*/
9719#ifdef BM64ADDR
9720inline
9721bm::id64_t block_to_global_index(unsigned i, unsigned j,
9722 unsigned block_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
9723{
9724 bm::id64_t base_idx = bm::id64_t(i) * bm::set_sub_array_size * bm::gap_max_bits;
9725 base_idx += j * bm::gap_max_bits;
9726 return block_idx + base_idx;
9727}
9728#else
9729inline
9730bm::id_t block_to_global_index(unsigned i, unsigned j,
9731 unsigned block_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
9732{
9733 unsigned base_idx = i * bm::set_sub_array_size * bm::gap_max_bits;
9734 base_idx += j * bm::gap_max_bits;
9735 return block_idx + base_idx;
9736}
9737#endif
9738
9739/**
9740 Calculate minimal delta between elements of sorted array
9741 @internal
9742 */
9743inline
9744unsigned min_delta_u32(const unsigned* arr, size_t arr_size)
9745{
9746 if (arr_size < 2)
9747 return 0;
9748
9749 unsigned md = arr[1] - arr[0]; // initial delta value
9750 for (size_t i = 1; i < arr_size; ++i)
9751 {
9752 unsigned prev = arr[i-1];
9753 unsigned curr = arr[i];
9754 BM_ASSERT(prev <= curr - 1);
9755 unsigned delta = curr - prev;
9756 if (delta < md)
9757 {
9758 md = delta;
9759 }
9760 } // for
9761 return md;
9762}
9763
9764/**
9765 Recalculate the array to decrement delta as
9766 arr[i] = arr[i] - delta + 1
9767 so that array remains monotonically growing (fit
9768 for interpolative compression)
9769
9770 @internal
9771 */
9772inline
9773void min_delta_apply(unsigned* arr, size_t arr_size, unsigned delta) BMNOEXCEPT
9774{
9775 BM_ASSERT(delta > 0);
9776 --delta;
9777 // TODO: SIMD and unroll
9778 for (size_t i = 1; i < arr_size; ++i)
9779 {
9780 arr[i] -= delta;
9781 BM_ASSERT(arr[i] > arr[i-1]);
9782 } // for
9783}
9784
9785/**
9786 Find max non-zero value in an array
9787 @internal
9788 */
9789template<typename VT, typename SZ>
9790bool find_max_nz(const VT* arr, SZ arr_size, SZ* found_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
9791{
9792 bool found = false;
9793 VT max_v = 0;
9794 for (SZ i = 0; i < arr_size; ++i)
9795 {
9796 VT v = arr[i];
9797 if (v > max_v)
9798 {
9799 max_v = v; *found_idx = i;
9800 found = true;
9801 }
9802 } // for i
9803 return found;
9804}
9805
9806/**
9807 Find max non-zero value in an array
9808 @internal
9809 */
9810template<typename VT, typename SZ>
9811bool find_first_nz(const VT* arr, SZ arr_size, SZ* found_idx) BMNOEXCEPT
9812{
9813 for (SZ i = 0; i < arr_size; ++i)
9814 {
9815 VT v = arr[i];
9816 if (v)
9817 {
9818 *found_idx = i;
9819 return true;
9820 }
9821 } // for i
9822 return false;
9823}
9824
9825/**
9826 Find count of non-zero elements in the array
9827 @internal
9828 */
9829template<typename VT, typename SZ>
9830SZ count_nz(const VT* arr, SZ arr_size) BMNOEXCEPT
9831{
9832 SZ cnt = 0;
9833 for (SZ i = 0; i < arr_size; ++i)
9834 cnt += (arr[i] != 0);
9835 return cnt;
9836}
9837
9838// --------------------------------------------------------------
9839// Best representation
9840// --------------------------------------------------------------
9841
9842/// Possible representations for bit sets
9843///
9844/// @internal
9845enum bit_representation
9846{
9847 e_bit_GAP = 0, ///< GAPs
9848 e_bit_INT, ///< Int list
9849 e_bit_IINT, ///< Inverted int list
9850 e_bit_1, ///< all 1s
9851 e_bit_0, ///< all 0s (empty block)
9852 e_bit_bit, ///< uncompressed bit-block
9853 e_bit_end
9854};
9855
9856/**
9857 Detect best representation for serialization for a block or sub-block
9858 @param gc - gap count
9859 @param bc - bit count
9860 @param max_bits - total number of bits in block
9861 @param bie_bits_per_int - number of bits per int in the compression scheme
9862 @param best_metric - [out] - best metric (number of bits or gaps)
9863
9864 @return representation metric
9865 */
9866inline
9867bm::bit_representation best_representation(unsigned gc,
9868 unsigned bc,
9869 unsigned max_bits,
9870 float bie_bits_per_int,
9871 unsigned* best_metric) BMNOEXCEPT
9872{
9873 if (!bc)
9874 {
9875 *best_metric = bc;
9876 return e_bit_0;
9877 }
9878 if (bc == max_bits)
9879 {
9880 *best_metric = 0;
9881 return e_bit_1;
9882 }
9883
9884 unsigned ibc = max_bits - bc;
9885 if (gc < bc) // GC < BC
9886 {
9887 if (gc <= ibc)
9888 {
9889 *best_metric = gc;
9890 float cost_in_bits = float(gc) * bie_bits_per_int;
9891 if (cost_in_bits >= float(max_bits))
9892 return e_bit_bit;
9893 return e_bit_GAP;
9894 }
9895 }
9896 else // GC >= BC
9897 {
9898 if (bc <= ibc)
9899 {
9900 *best_metric = bc;
9901 float cost_in_bits = float(bc) * bie_bits_per_int;
9902 if (cost_in_bits >= float(max_bits))
9903 return e_bit_bit;
9904 return e_bit_INT;
9905 }
9906 }
9907 *best_metric = ibc;
9908 float cost_in_bits = float(ibc) * bie_bits_per_int;
9909 if (cost_in_bits >= float(max_bits))
9910 return e_bit_bit;
9911 return e_bit_IINT;
9912}
9913
9914// --------------------------------------------------------------
9915// Nibble array functions
9916// --------------------------------------------------------------
9917
9918/**
9919 @brief set nibble in the array
9920 @param arr - base array of characters
9921 @param idx - nibble index
9922 @param v - value to set
9923
9924 @internal
9925 */
9926inline
9927void set_nibble(unsigned char* arr, unsigned idx, unsigned char v) BMNOEXCEPT
9928{
9929 BM_ASSERT(arr);
9930 BM_ASSERT(v <= 0xF);
9931
9932 unsigned arr_idx = idx >> 1;
9933 if (idx & 1)
9934 {
9935 unsigned char old_val = arr[arr_idx];
9936 old_val &= 0x0F; // clear the upper bits
9937 arr[arr_idx] = (unsigned char)(old_val | (v << 4));
9938 }
9939 else
9940 {
9941 unsigned char old_val = arr[arr_idx];
9942 old_val &= 0xF0; // clear the lower bits
9943 arr[arr_idx] = (unsigned char)(old_val | (v & 0xF));
9944 }
9945}
9946
9947/**
9948 @brief get nibble from the array
9949 @param arr - base array of characters
9950 @param idx - nibble index
9951 @return value
9952
9953 @internal
9954 */
9955inline
9956unsigned char get_nibble(const unsigned char* arr, unsigned idx) BMNOEXCEPT
9957{
9958 BM_ASSERT(arr);
9959 unsigned char v = arr[idx >> 1];
9960 v >>= (idx & 1) * 4;
9961 v &= 0xF;
9962 return v;
9963}
9964
9965
9966// --------------------------------------------------------------
9967// Functions to work with int values stored in 64-bit pointers
9968// --------------------------------------------------------------
9969
9970/*!
9971 \brief helper union to interpret pointer as integers
9972 @internal
9973*/
9974union ptr_payload_t
9975{
9976 bm::word_t* blk;
9977 bm::id64_t i64;
9978 unsigned short i16[4];
9979};
9980
9981/*!
9982 Test presense of value in payload pointer
9983 @internal
9984*/
9985inline
9986bm::id64_t ptrp_test(ptr_payload_t ptr, bm::gap_word_t v) BMNOEXCEPT
9987{
9988 if (v == 0)
9989 {
9990 return (ptr.i16[1] == 0);
9991 }
9992 bm::id64_t r = (ptr.i16[1] == v) | (ptr.i16[2] == v) | (ptr.i16[3] == v);
9993 return r;
9994}
9995
9996// --------------------------------------------------------------------------
9997
9998} // namespace bm
